Description: TOWARDS AN END-TO-END APPROACH TO FORMAL PRIVACY FOR SAMPLE SURVEYS

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INCREASE THE ACCURACY OF COMPUTATIONAL DIELECTRIC SPECTROSCOPY AND DEVELOP COMPUTATIONAL ACOUSTIC SPECTROSCOPY TO HELP THE CHEMICAL INDUSTRY DEVELOP IMPROVED SEPARATIONS TECHNOLOGIES THAT LEVERAGE THE ION PAIRING AND SOLVATION ON STRUCTURE OF SPECIES IN SOLUTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESEARCHER WILL USE MOLECULAR DYNAMICS TO MODEL SOLVENTS, MIXTURES, AND SOLUTIONS. THE DIELECTRIC SPECTRUM WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING THE DIRECT ELECTRIC FIELD METHOD, AND THE ACOUSTIC SPECTRUM WILL BE CONSTRUCTED USING SIMULATED PRESSURE WAVES. THE ACOUSTIC PORTION OF THE PROJECT WILL REQUIRE METHODS DEVELOPMENTS, AS THESE SIMULATIONS HAVE NOT BEEN DESCRIBED IN THE LITERATURE PRIOR TO NOW.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESEARCHER WILL PRODUCE DIELECTRIC AND ACOUSTIC SPECTRA THAT CAN BE USED TO UNDERSTAND ION PAIRING AND SOLVATION IN SOLUTION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE MODELING TOOLS CAN BE USED BY OTHER RESEARCHERS IN THIS FIELD, AND RESEARCHERS WHO FOCUS ON INDUSTRIALLY RELEVANT CHEMICAL SEPARATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF A MICROFABRICATED OPTOMECHANICAL SENSING PLATFORM WITH HIGH INTRINSIC ACCURACY BASED ON A FABRY-P?ROT MICROCAVITY FOR ACCELEROMETER OPERATION AND BEYOND.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL MAKE SEVERAL IMPROVEMENTS TO THE OPTOMECHANICAL SENSING PLATFORM, WHICH HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AT NIST, TO FURTHER INCREASE PERFORMANCE. FIRST, THEY WILL DEMONSTRATE CHIP-TO-CHIP BONDING OF THE OPTOMECHANICAL CAVITY TO INCREASE DIMENSIONAL STABILITY AND STIFFNESS. NEXT, THEY WILL REDESIGN THE ACCELEROMETER PACKAGE TO INCREASE ITS STIFFNESS WHILE REDUCING ITS MASS. IN TANDEM, THE MICROMECHANICAL RESONATOR WITHIN THE ACCELEROMETER WILL BE REDESIGNED TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF MECHANICAL DISSIPATION DUE TO ANCHOR LOSS AND THERMOELASTIC DISSIPATION. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL THEN BE COMBINED TO PROVIDE A MORE STABLE AND SENSITIVE ACCELEROMETER.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS? WORK IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN OPTOMECHANICAL ACCELEROMETERS THAT HAVE HIGHER STABILITY, IN TERMS OF SENSOR SIGNAL DRIFT, GREATER STIFFNESS, WHICH WILL PROVIDE GREATER ACCURACY, AND HIGHER MECHANICAL QUALITY FACTOR, RESULTING IN HIGHER SENSITIVITY. THESE OUTCOMES WILL BE USED BY NIST TO PERFORM VIBRATION METROLOGY WITH UNPRECEDENTED PERFORMANCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NIST WILL BE THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY OF THIS RESEARCH SINCE IT WILL DIRECTLY IMPROVE OUR WORK ON VIBRATION METROLOGY. THE RESEARCH WILL ALSO BENEFIT VIBRATION CALIBRATION COMPANIES AND U.S. MANUFACTURERS OF INERTIAL SENSORS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH TO DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE MICROFABRICATED ATOMIC TRANSDUCERS WITH ENHANCED FUNCTIONALITY BY INCORPORATING MICROFABRICATED PLANAR PHOTONIC COMPONENT ON ATOMIC VAPOR CELL SURFACES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH INCLUDES DEVELOPMENT OF QUANTUM PACKAGING APPROACHES THAT INCORPORATE PLANAR MICROFABRICATED OPTICAL COMPONENTS, SUCH AS GRATINGS, MULTILAYER DIELECTRIC MIRRORS, WAVEGUIDES AND METASURFACES. AS A FIRST EXAMPLE, AN ALL-DIELECTRIC ATOMIC VAPOR CELL CAPABLE OF GUIDING LASER BEAMS THROUGH MULTIPLE REFLECTIONS WILL BE DEVELOPED. UNIQUE MICROFABRICATION PROCESSES THAT HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED BY THE PROPOSED FOR ENCAPSULATION ATOMIC VAPORS IN ALL-DIELECTRIC VAPOR CELLS WILL BE FURTHER ENHANCED FOR BETTER PERFORMANCE, LARGER SCALE AND IMPROVED FUNCTIONALITY OF PATTERNED PLANAR OPTICS AND PHOTONICS. RYDBERG ELECTROMETER FUNCTION WILL BE STUDIED AS AN APPLICATION OF THE DEVELOPED TECHNOLOGY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP AND DEMONSTRATE TECHNOLOGIES NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE NEW TYPES OF MICROFABRICATED TRANSDUCERS COUPLING LIGHT WITH ATOMIC VAPORS. BY ENABLING SUCH TRANSDUCERS, THIS RESEARCH WILL OPEN UP NEW POSSIBILITIES FOR METROLOGY USING WARM VAPORS IN COMPACT AND MASS-PRODUCIBLE DEVICES, INCLUDING HIGHLY PARALLEL MEASUREMENTS, DIRECTIONAL RADIO FREQUENCY SENSING AND OTHER NEW APPLICATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  NIST RESEARCH ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM ACCESS TO TECHNOLOGY AND DEVICES FOR PACKAGING OF ATOMIC VAPORS TIGHTLY INTEGRATED WITH PHOTONICS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE APPLICATION FOR RYDBERG ATOM RADIO FREQUENCY METROLOGY. THE GLOBAL RESEARCH COMMUNITY WILL BENEFIT FROM THE DEMONSTRATION AND VALIDATION OF NEW APPROACHES AND TECHNIQUES FOR ATOMIC-PHOTONIC INTEGRATION IN MICROFABRICATED TRANSDUCERS. THE RECIPIENT WILL BENEFIT BY DEVELOPING TECHNOLOGIES AND DEVICES ENABLING A WIDE RANGE OF FOLLOW-ON RESEARCH IN THIS AREA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE PARTIAL SUPPORT FOR A UCSB GRADUATE STUDENT WHO IS WORKING ON A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT ON NEUROMORPHIC DELAY ELEMENT CHARACTERIZATION AND EXPLORATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THE STUDENT WILL TRAVEL TO NIST TO WORK CLOSELY WITH NIST FELLOW MARK STILES, GROUP LEADER JABEZ MCCLELLAND, PHYSICIST MATTHEW DANIELS, AND ASSOCIATE ADVAIT MADHAVAN. THREE MAIN TASKS WILL BE COMPLETED: (1) SIMULATIONS WILL BE PERFORMED TO CHARACTERIZE CIRCUIT ALTERNATIVES FOR DELAY ELEMENTS; (2) A SYSTEMATIC STUDY WILL BE PERFORMED TO UNDERSTAND THE STATISTICS OF DELAY ELEMENTS STACKED IN BOTH PARALLEL AND SERIES CONFIGURATIONS; (3) NEW APPROACHES TO DELAY ELEMENT DESIGN WITH THE INTEGRATION OF EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES WILL BE EXPLORED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATIONS AND PRESENTATIONS DESCRIBING THE RESULTS OF THE RESEARCH WILL BE PREPARED AND DISSEMINATED TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THIS GRANT WILL BENEFIT THE RAPIDLY EXPANDING SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY OF RESEARCHERS INVESTIGATING ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES TO COMPUTING IN THE QUEST FOR LOW-ENERGY, HIGH-EFFICIENCY INFORMATION PROCESSING THAT WILL LEAD TO SIGNIFICANT IMPROVEMENTS IN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE PARADIGMS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

TITLE: A POLICY TOOL FOR NEXT GENERATION ACCESS CONTROLPURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A USER-FRIENDLY TOOL THAT SIMPLIFIES NGAC ACCESS POLICY CONFIGURATION. CONFIGURING NGAC POLICY REQUIRES EXPERT DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE USING ADMINISTRATIVE COMMANDS. TRANSLATING NATURAL LANGUAGE POLICIES TO A MACHINE-READABLE FORMAT IS A PROMISING CONCEPT THAT CAN EASE THE BURDEN ON NGAC POLICY ADMINISTRATION. THE NGAC POLICY TOOL IS A PIPELINE WITH THE PROCESS THAT STARTS WITH PARSING NATURAL LANGUAGE POLICY INPUT TEXT, CLASSIFYING TEXT FRAGMENTS, EXTRACTING POLICY ELEMENTS, TRANSFORMING POLICY ELEMENTS TO NGAC COMMANDS, AND UTILIZING NGAC?S EXISTING POLICY REVIEW CAPABILITIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF FOUR MAJOR TASKS. FIRST, IS DEVELOPMENT OF A FORMAL POLICY LANGUAGE FOR NGAC THAT SERVES TO TRANSLATE NATURAL LANGUAGE POLICY TO NGAC ADMINISTRATIVE COMMANDS. THE SECOND TASK DESIGNS AND IMPLEMENTS AN ALGORITHM FOR FORMAL POLICY LANGUAGE TO NGAC COMMAND TRANSLATION. THE THIRD TASK IS TO DEVELOP A NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING AND MACHINE LEARNING FRAMEWORK FOR TRANSLATING NATURAL LANGUAGE POLICY TO THE FORMAL LANGUAGE. THE FOURTH TASK INCLUDES CORPUS CREATION FOR EVALUATING THE FRAMEWORK AND INTEGRATING THIS PROJECT WITH THE NIST NGAC ENVIRONMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE SCIENCE OF MAPPING NATURAL LANGUAGE EXPRESSIONS OF ABAC POLICY TO UNDERLYING AND MACHINE-READABLE SET OF POLICY ELEMENTS AND RELATIONS WITHOUT THE LOSS OF SPECIFICITY. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PRESENTED IN OPEN SCIENTIFIC FORUMS AND PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ATTRIBUTE BASED ACCESS CONTROL (ABAC) REPRESENTS THE LATEST MILESTONE IN THE ADVANCEMENT OF AUTHORIZATION SYSTEMS. XACML AND NGAC ARE THE ONLY TWO FULLY FLUSHED OUT AND STANDARDIZED ABAC FRAMEWORKS. WHILE THE OLDER XACML STANDARD (2003) ENJOYS WIDER USE IN COMMERCIAL AND RESEARCH SETTINGS, THE RECENTLY PUBLISHED NGAC STANDARD (IN 2020) IS SHOWING PROMISE IN PROVIDING INDUSTRY AND GOVERNMENT WITH A VIABLE AND EVEN MORE EFFICIENT ALTERNATIVE TO CHOOSE FROM. A KEY NGAC CRITICISM IS ITS RELIANCE ON TECHNICALLY ASTUTE ADMINISTERS. THIS PROPOSAL DEVELOPS A USER-FRIENDLY APPROACH TO MANAGE NIST NGAC. IF SUCCESSFUL, THIS ADMINISTRATIVE TOOL WILL ELEVATE THAT MARKET BARRIER, AND AS SUCH HELP PROMOTE MARKET DIVERSITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO AUTOMATE THE NIST EBIT TO ALLOW THE FAST SWITCHING OF THE ELECTRON BEAM CURRENT TO CONDUCT MEASUREMENTS OF THE FLUORESCENCE DECAY OF METASTABLE ENERGY LEVELS OF HIGHLY CHARGED IONS AND USING THE NETS MICROCALORIMETER TO MEASURE THE LIFETIME OF THE M3 DECAY OF THE 3D94S 3D3 LEVEL OF NI-LIKE RHENIUM. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:AUTOMATION OF THE NIST EBIT CONTROL HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE FOR AN ENHANCED OPERATION DURING EXPERIMENTS WILL BE IMPROVED THROUGH DEVELOPMENT OF NEW SOFTWARE. NEW MEASUREMENTS OF LIFETIMES OF METASTABLE LEVELS IN NI-LIKE RE WILL BE PERFORMED AND THE RESULTS WILL BE ANALYZED USING ADVANCED ATOMIC THEORY COMPUTER CODES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:NEW SOFTWARE WILL BE DEVELOPED AND USED FOR EBIT OPERATIONS. NEW ATOMIC DATA WILL BE GENERATED AND DISSEMINATED IN THE COMMUNITY VIA THE NIST ATOMIC DATABASES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:ASTROPHYSICAL EXPERIMENTS AND MAGNETIC FUSION RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT FROM AVAILABILITY OF NEW PRECISE ATOMIC DATA OF INTEREST.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPROVE THE SPEED OF SIMULATIONS OF X-RAY SPECTRA AND VALIDATE THEIR ACCURACY FOR SUPPORTING MEASUREMENTS OF CATALYSTS FOR CO2 CONVERSION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHER WILL IMPLEMENT NEW, MORE EFFICIENT METHODS WITHIN THE OCEAN X-RAY CODE, FOCUSING ON REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF EFFORT NEEDED FOR THE DENSITY-FUNCTIONAL THEORY CALCULATION THROUGH INTERPOLATION. THE RESEARCHER WILL VALIDATE THESE IMPROVEMENTS THROUGH CAREFUL COMPARISON WITH EXPERIMENTAL X-RAY SPECTRA OF WELL-CHARACTERIZED CATALYSTS. THE VALIDATED IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE APPLIED TO STUDYING SHORT-LIVED INTERMEDIATE STATES FOUND DURING CATALYSIS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE NIST SPECTROSCOPY CODE OCEAN. NOVEL FINDINGS WILL BE REPORTED IN APPROPRIATE JOURNAL ARTICLES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE IMPROVED CODE WILL BE USED BY EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL USERS OF THE NIST X-RAY BEAMLINES. THE IMPROVEMENTS CAN ALSO BE USED BY RESEARCHERS WORKING ON OTHER SPECTROSCOPY CODES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE CAPACITANCE MEASUREMENTS TO UNDERSTAND THE STRUCTURAL PROPERTIES OF DNA NANOSTRUCTURE TO EVALUATE THEIR USE AS BIOSENSORS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESEARCHERS WILL BUILD NEW MEASUREMENT FRAMEWORKS THAT WILL ITERATIVELY ALLOW 1) THE DESIGN A NEW DNA ORIGAMI STRUCTURES, 2) THE MEASUREMENT OF THEIR STATIC STRUCTURAL ATTRIBUTES WITH CRYO-EM MICROSCOPY, 3) THE ACQUISITION OF CAPACITANCE DISTRIBUTIONS AS THE STRUCTURES ARE BIASED BY A  DC VOLTAGE, AND 4) THE CORRELATION OF CAPACITANCE MEASUREMENTS TO DETERMINE IF THE DISTRIBUTION OF STRUCTURAL ATTRIBUTES CAN BE PREDICTED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING A NEW NON-INVASIVE AND LABEL FREE TECHNIQUE TO UTILIZE ELECTRICAL MEASUREMENTS TO DESCRIBE THE STRUCTURE-FUNCTION RELATIONSHIPS IN DNA NANO STRICTURES. THE UNIQUE PROPERTIES OF THESE STRUCTURES ALLOWS THESE ANALYTICAL TECHNIQUES TO BE USEFUL IN SPECIFIC SCENARIOS IN BIO SENSING: (1) TO RELIABLY DESIGN AND SYNTHESIZE NANOSENSORS WITH PRE-DETERMINED GAIN, KINETICS AND OTHER PHYSIO-CHEMICAL PROPERTIES; (2) TO ALLOW THESE NANO SENSORS TO BE INCORPORATED WITH SCALABLE ELECTRONICS; AND (3) ALLOW THE UNDERLYING MEASUREMENTS AND TECHNOLOGY TO BE UTILIZED IN FIELD-DEPLOYABLE TESTS AND PRODUCTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE METHODS GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL BE USED BY RESEARCHERS WORKING WITH DNA NANOTECHNOLOGY AND WHEN INCORPORATED IN SENSORS WILL GENERATE BIG DATA SETS THAT WILL BE USEFUL IN DEVELOPING MACHINE LEARNING AND AI MODELS. THE RESULTING MEASUREMENTS AND TECHNIQUES WILL LEAD TO IMPROVED SENSING ACCURACY IN BIOSENSING APPLICATIONS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO LEVERAGE METAL OXIDE HETEROSTRUCTURES DEPOSITED BY PULSED LASER DEPOSITION TO ACHIEVE REALIZE METASURFACE SENSORS AND WAVEGUIDE MODULATORS OPERATING IN THE NEAR AND MID-INFRARED, WITH RECORD FIGURES OF MERITACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIN SINGLE FILMS AND THIN-FILM HETEROSTRUCTURES OF TRANSITION METAL OXIDES (SUCH AS INDIUM TIN OXIDE, LUTETIUM OXIDE, STRONTIUM TITANATE, OR BARIUM TITANATE) WILL BE DEPOSITED BY PULSED LASER DEPOSITION (PLD) TO ACHIEVE NOVEL OPTICAL PROPERTIES INCLUDING ANOMALOUSLY LARGE OR SMALL INDICES OF REFRACTION, DIELECTRIC OR METALLIC BEHAVIOR ON DEMAND, OPTICAL ANISOTROPY, TAILORED SPECTRAL RESONANCES, AS WELL AS DRAMATIC VOLTAGE-INDUCED CHANGES IN ELECTRICAL PERMITTIVITY. OPTICAL CHARACTERISTICS WILL BE EXPERIMENTALLY CHARACTERIZED BY ELLIPSOMETRY, FOURIER-TRANSFORM INFRARED SPECTROSCOPY, AND LASER BASED ELECTRO-OPTIC PROBING. HETEROSTRUCTURE MODELING AND OPTIMIZATION WILL BE PERFORMED USING FINITE-DIFFERENCE TIME-DOMAIN SIMULATIONS.  FINALLY, NOVEL PHOTONIC DEVICES INCORPORATING PLD-DEPOSITED METAL OXIDE FILMS AND LEVERAGING THEIR UNIQUE ENGINEERED PROPERTIES WILL BE DESIGNED, FABRICATED, AND TESTED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DEMONSTRATION OF 1) A METASURFACE (FLAT LENS) ABLE TO PERFORM GAS PHASE SENSING OF ENVIRONMENTALLY OR HEALTH-RELEVANT ADSORBED MOLECULAR SPECIES BY PERTURBATION OF ITS INFRARED TRANSMISSION SPECTRUM AND 2) AN "EPSILON-NEAR-ZERO" SILICON WAVEGUIDE MODULATOR WORKING AT TELECOM WAVELENGTHS (1550 NM) WITH RECORD HIGH SPEED (~100 GHZ RANGE ) AND LOW FOOTPRINT (MICRON SCALE).  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US PHOTONICS INDUSTRY, US ENVIRONMENTAL SENSING INDUSTRY, US BIOMEDICAL SENSING INDUSTRY, AND US CONSUMERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP, STUDY AND DEMONSTRATE METHODS ON NUMERICALOPTIMIZATION AND INVERSE DESIGN OF MICRODEVICES AND THEIR APPLICATIONS IN MEASUREMENTSCIENCE.STUDY OF ADVANCED NUMERICAL OPTIMIZATION METHODS FOR PHOTONIC AND CAVITY OPTOMECHANICALDEVICES, INCLUDING DEMONSTRATION OF NUMERICAL INVERSE DESIGN TECHNIQUES FOR LARGE AREAMETAGRATING COUPLERS WITH POLARIZATION CONTROL AND NANOSCALE CAVITY OPTOMECHANICAL PROBESWITH OPTIMIZED MECHANICAL MODES AND OPTICAL RESONATORS. IMPLEMENTATION OF ADVANCEDINFORMATION-EFFICIENT MEASUREMENT METHODS USING NANOSCALE CAVITY OPTOMECHANICAL SCANNINGPROBES. METHODS WILL BE MODELED AND IMPLEMENTED VIA SOFTWARE AUTOMATION. FUNDAMENTALSTUDY AND DEMONSTRATION OF MACHINE LEARNING APPROACHES TO NUMERICAL OPTIMIZATION OF DEVICEDESIGNS AND MEASUREMENT METHODS, SUCH AS MACHINE LEARNING FROM FINITE ELEMENTS DATA ANDREINFORCEMENT LEARNING FOR OPTIMAL DESIGN AND MEASUREMENT IMPLEMENTATION.DEVELOPMENT OF DEVICE DESIGNS WITH IMPROVED PERFORMANCE. DEVELOPMENT ANDIMPLEMENTATION OF IMPROVED PHOTOTHERMAL RESONANCE INFRARED MEASUREMENT METHODS FORCHEMICAL COMPOSITION AND THERMAL PROPERTY MAPPING AT THE NANOSCALE WITH REDUCEDUNCERTAINTY AND INCREASED THROUGHPUT. DEVELOPMENT AND VALIDATION OF NOVEL METHODOLOGIESFOR USING MACHINE LEARNING IN DEVICE AND MEASUREMENT OPTIMIZATION.NIST RESEARCH PROGRAMS WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVEMENTS IN DEVICES AND MEASUREMENTMETHODS. LARGER RESEARCH COMMUNITY AND US INDUSTRY WILL BENEFIT FROM FUNDAMENTAL ADVANCESIN PHOTONIC MICROFABRICATED DEVICE DESIGN KNOWLEDGE AND METHODOLOGIES.THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL FUND RESEARCH AIMED AT IMPROVED ACCURACY OF THE SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPE (SEM) WHEN PERFORMING DIMENSIONAL MEASUREMENTS OF NANOMETER-SCALE STRUCTURES SUCH AS NANO-PARTICLES, TRANSISTORS, AND OTHER MANUFACTURED ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS.THE PROBLEM TO BE ADDRESSED: THE SEM PRODUCES IMAGES WITH CONTRAST DUE TO VARIATION IN THE SECONDARY ELECTRON YIELD. DIMENSIONS OF FEATURES IN THE IMAGE MUST BE INFERRED FROM THIS MEASURED SECONDARY ELECTRON SIGNAL. THE INFERENCE IS ONLY ACCURATE INSOFAR AS WE KNOW THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE TWO. CURRENTLY THIS KNOWLEDGE IS LIMITED FOR ELECTRONS WITH ENERGY BELOW 100 EV. USUALLY, THE PHYSICS IS APPROXIMATED WITH A VARIANT OF DIELECTRIC FUNCTION THEORY, BUT DIFFERENT VARIANTS MAKE WIDELY DIFFERENT PREDICTIONS OF SECONDARY ELECTRON SIGNAL. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH FUNDED BY THIS GRANT WILL SEEK TO IMPLEMENT A BETTER APPROXIMATION OF THE SECONDARY ELECTRON GENERATION PHYSICS. THE BETTER APPROXIMATION WILL BE BASED ON DENSITY FUNCTIONAL THEORY, WHICH HAS PROVEN TO BE VERY ACCURATE FOR COMPUTING GROUND STATE PROPERTIES OF MATERIALS. THIS APPROACH WILL BE COMBINED WITH AN IMPLEMENTATION OF THE BETHE-SALPETER EQUATION TO INCLUDE THE EFFECT OF ELECTRONIC EXCITATIONS. THIS APPROACH ACCOUNTS FOR SOME PHENOMENA (E.G., DETAILED BAND STRUCTURE, QUANTUM MECHANICAL EXCHANGE) THAT ARE OMITTED BY THE EXISTING APPROACH. THE NEW MODEL WILL BE USED TO COMPUTE THE ENERGY- AND MOMENTUM-DEPENDENT DIELECTRIC FUNCTIONS OF MATERIALS, THEN FROM THESE THE CORRESPONDING ENERGY LOSS FUNCTIONS. IF SUCCESSFUL, THIS PROCESS WILL BE REPEATED FOR MANY MATERIALS, BEGINNING FIRST WITH MATERIALS THAT ARE IMPORTANT IN INDUSTRIAL APPLICATIONS OF SEM TO DIMENSIONAL MEASUREMENTS, FOR EXAMPLE IN INTEGRATED ELECTRONICS AND NEXT GENERATION ELECTRONIC DEVICES, WHERE INDUSTRIAL TASK-GROUPS ARE HIGHLIGHTING THE NEED FOR SUB-0.5 NM ACCURACIES. THE MORE ACCURATE ENERGY LOSS FUNCTIONS WILL IMPROVE THE ACCURACY OF EXISTING ELECTRON-SCATTERING SIMULATORS, WHICH ARE USED TO INFER FEATURE DIMENSIONS FROM THEIR SECONDARY ELECTRON IMAGES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IF THE NEW APPROACH IS SUCCESSFUL, THE ACCURACY OF INFERRED FEATURE DIMENSIONS WILL BE IMPROVED. THE CAPABILITY TO MAKE SUCH INFERENCES WILL BE MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE VIA NIST?S JMONSEL SIMULATOR. SEM IS ONE OF VERY FEW MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUES SUITABLE FOR APPLICATIONS IN NANO-TECHNOLOGY, WHERE THE IMPROVEMENTS ARE EXPECTED TO SPEED DEVELOPMENTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: IN THE FIRST INSTANCE, SEMICONDUCTOR ELECTRONICS MANUFACTURING AND OTHER NANOTECHNOLOGIES SHOULD BENEFIT. THERE ARE POTENTIALLY OTHER APPLICATIONS FOR SUCH IMPROVED MODELS, FOR EXAMPLE TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF RESIST EXPOSURE PROCESSES IN ELECTRON BEAM AND EXTREME ULTRA-VIOLET LITHOGRAPHY, WHERE SUCH IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING COULD LEAD TO DESIGN OF BETTER RESISTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT A PLASMONIC-ENHANCED NANOPORE SYSTEM TO IMPROVE AND OPTIMIZE NANOPORE SENSORS FOR SINGLE MOLECULE PROTEIN SEQUENCING.THE RESEARCHER WILL DESIGN AND TEST A DNA NANOTECHNOLOGY INTERFACE THAT CAN CONNECT PROTEIN NANOPORES WITH LOCALIZED SURFACE PLASMONIC RESONANCE NANOPORES WITH SINGE NANOMETER PRECISION. THESE NANOSTRUCTURES WILL BE USED TO GENERATE TIME-RESOLVED TEMPERATURE GRADIENTS TO STUDY NANOSCALE TRANSPORT AND DEVELOP PHYSICAL MECHANISMS FOR MOLECULAR TRANSPORT ACROSS ARTIFICIAL CELL MEMBRANES. THE MECHANISTIC INFORMATION WILL BE USED TO TEST NANOPORE CHEMISTRY FOR TO OPTIMIZE NANOPORE CHEMISTRY TO DISCRIMINATE AMONG AMINO ACIDS AS LIBERATED THROUGH TRADITIONAL AND MODIFIED EDMAN DEGRADATION REACTIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE CURRENT UNDERSTANDING OF THE KINETICS OF BIOPOLYMER-NANOPORE INTERACTIONS AND WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE WIDE FIELD OF NANOPORE-BASED SENSORS. THE DEVELOPED METHODS FOR MEASURING THERMODYNAMIC PROPERTIES OF NANOPORE AND NOVEL NANOPLASMONIC STRUCTURES COULD BE SUCCESSFULLY INTEGRATED INTO EXISTING DEVICES TO ENHANCE THEIR PRECISION AND CAPABILITIES.   THE METHODS DEVELOPED FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL ENABLE RESEARCHERS TO STUDY A FUNDAMENTAL MECHANISMS OF CELL-CELL COMMUNICATION, DISEASE PROGRESSION AND BIOMOLECULAR FUNCTION WHICH CAN BE APPLIED TO THE DESIGN OF MOLECULAR THERAPEUTICS, AND DISEASE DETECTION AMONG OTHER CRITICAL OUTCOMES. THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP FABRICATION PROCESSES AND MEASUREMENTS FOR INTEGRATED DEVICES THAT CAN BE USED FOR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND APPLICATIONS DEVELOPMENT IN QUANTUM INFORMATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROCESSES FOR THE NANOFABRICATION OF INTEGRATED PHOTONIC DEVICES THAT INCLUDE TWO OR MORE TYPES OF SEMICONDUCTOR MATERIALS ON A SINGLE CHIP, OFFERING FUNCTIONALITY THAT IS RELEVANT FOR QUANTUM SCIENCE EXPERIMENTS AND APPLICATIONS - SUCH AS QUANTUM LIGHT EMISSION, LOW-LOSS LIGHT TRANSMISSION AND MANIPULATION IN AN ON-CHIP CIRCUIT. DEVELOPMENT OF FABRICATION PROCESSES FOR METASURFACES FOR LIGHT MANIPULATION WILL ALSO BE PERFORMED, WITH THE GOAL OF PRODUCING FLAT OPTICAL ELEMENTS FOR OPTICALLY ADDRESSING ATOMIC SYSTEMS FOR QUANTUM SCIENCE APPLICATIONS. FABRICATED DEVICES WILL BE CHARACTERIZED FOR THEIR OPTICAL PERFORMANCE, PROVIDING FEEDBACK FOR PROCESS OPTIMIZATION. OPTIMIZED DEVICES WILL BE PRODUCED TO SUPPORT RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN QUANTUM PHOTONICS.THE PROJECT WILL PRODUCE FABRICATION PROCESSES FOR A NOVEL CLASS OF HIGHLY OPTIMIZED CHIP-SCALE INTEGRATED OPTICAL DEVICES, AS WELL AS NOVEL FLAT OPTICAL DEVICES FOR ADDRESSING ATOMIC SYSTEMS. BOTH CLASSES OF DEVICES WILL BE USED IN RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN QUANTUM SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY, TOWARDS APPLICATIONS IN QUANTUM COMPUTATION, COMMUNICATION AND METROLOGY WITH SIGNIFICANTLY SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE THAN THE STATE-OF-THE-ART. BOTH FABRICATION PROCESSES AND DEVICES PRODUCED BY THIS RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT SCIENTISTS WORKING IN QUANTUM SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY. THIS RESEARCH WILL ALSO BENEFIT RESEARCHERS DOING WORK ON ON-CHIP INTEGRATED PHOTONIC CIRCUITS, NANOPHOTONICS AND METASURFACES. THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS WORK IS TO COLLECT, PROCESS, TEST, AND SHIP SINGLE-DONOR HUMAN URINE SPECIMENS TO NIST FOR USE IN THE COMMUTABILITY ASSESSMENT OF NIST STANDARD REFERENCE MATERIALS (SRMS). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL OBTAIN SINGLE-DONOR URINE SPECIMENS FROM RESIDUAL DE-IDENTIFIED PATIENT SPECIMENS SUBMITTED TO THE VIRGINIA COMMONWEALTH UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM, PROCESS THE SPECIMENS, MEASURE THE URINE ALBUMIN CONTENT VIA A ROUTINE CLINICAL METHOD, AND SHIP THE FROZEN MATERIAL TO NIST. THE RESEARCHER WILL ALSO PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING DATA FOR EACH SPECIMEN: STUDY ID NUMBER AND NUMBER OF ALIQUOTS; URINE ALBUMIN CONCENTRATION; TIME AND DATE OF URINE COLLECTION; SPECIMEN COLLECTION TYPE (RANDOM OR OVERNIGHT COLLECTION); RESULTS OF THE VISUAL INSPECTION OF COLOR AND PARTICULATES FOR EACH DONOR SPECIMEN AFTER CENTRIFUGATION; AND SHIPPING INFORMATION (SHIPMENT DATE, EXPECTED DELIVERY DATE, SHIPPING METHOD AND SHIPMENT TRACKING INFORMATION). EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING A CLINICAL PANEL OF SINGLE-DONOR HUMAN URINE SPECIMENS THAT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT CHARACTERIZATION OF CLINICAL HUMAN URINE SRMS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE CLINICAL PANEL OF SINGLE-DONOR HUMAN URINE SPECIMENS WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE NIST URINE ALBUMIN STANDARDIZATION PROJECT BY PROVIDING CLINICAL SAMPLES FOR USE IN CHARACTERIZING THE COMMUTABILITY OF MATRIX-BASED SRMS FOR URINE ALBUMIN.  A COMMUTABLE REFERENCE MATERIAL FOR URINE ALBUMIN CAN BE UTILIZED AS PART OF A GLOBAL REFERENCE MEASUREMENT SYSTEM TO ENABLE STANDARDIZATION OF CLINICAL LABORATORY URINE ALBUMIN RESULTS FOR KIDNEY DISEASE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TOWARDS A COMPREHENSIVE AND OBJECTIVE SOLUTION FOR TOOL AND FIREARM MARK COMPARISON AND DETERMINATION OF THE EVIDENTIAL STRENGTH OF EVIDENCE BASED ON REPRESENTATIVE MARK REFERENCE DATABASES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:WITHIN THE SCOPE OF A MULTI-YEAR COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE NETHERLANDS FORENSIC INSTITUTE (NFI), NIST AND THE FBI, WE AIM AT REALIZING AND PROVIDING A FULLY TESTED AND EVALUATED OBJECTIVE SOFTWARE SOLUTION FOR TOOL AND FIREARM MARK COMPARISON AS WELL AS DETERMINATION OF THE EVIDENTIAL STRENGTH OF EVIDENCE BASED ON REPRESENTATIVE MARK REFERENCE DATABASES. THIS NEW PROJECT AIMS AT TAKING THE LAST STEP TOWARDS THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SOFTWARE IN CASEWORK, BY ADDRESSING FEEDBACK PROVIDED BY THE EXAMINERS IN PREVIOUS, AND ONGOING EVALUATION STUDIES. THIS WILL FURTHER STREAMLINE THE PROCESS AND SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE USER EXPERIENCE AND INCREASE ACCEPTANCE IN THE FIELD FOR THIS TOOL.THE STRATEGY TO REACH THIS GOAL IS BASED ON THREE PILLARS:1.) TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENTDEVELOPMENT OF A SOFTWARE SOLUTION THAT ALLOWS THE USER TO BUILD REFERENCE DATABASES (DATA AND METADATA) FOR A LARGE VARIETY OF FIREARMS AND AMMUNITION, INTERACTIVELY DEFINE REGIONS OF INTEREST IN THE DATA TO DEFINE MARK TYPES, AUTOMATICALLY COMPARE THE MARKS ONE-TO-ONE, AUTOMATICALLY DETERMINE SCORE DISTRIBUTIONS, PROVIDE AN INTERFACE TO ADD CASEWORK DATA, DETERMINE THE EVIDENTIAL STRENGTH AND/OR IDENTIFICATION ERROR RATES OF A COMPARISON AND FINALLY GENERATE A REPORT OF THE OUTCOME. 2.) RESEARCHTHE ASSESSMENT OF THE VARIOUS POSSIBILITIES TO SET UP RELEVANT MARK REFERENCE DATABASES, BASED ON VARYING DATA PROPERTIES REFLECTED IN THE METADATA (E.G. THE AMMUNITION BRAND AND TYPE OR THE SUBSTRATE MATERIAL), AND DECIDING ON THE MOST APPROPRIATE STRATEGY FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF MARKS (EACH WITH DIFFERENT PROPERTIES).3.) EVALUATIONUSAGE OF THE OBJECTIVE COMPARISON METHODS PROVIDED BY THE SOFTWARE TO COMPARE MARKS IN REAL CASEWORK AND COMPARE THE OUTCOME OF THE OBJECTIVE ANALYSIS TO THE OUTCOME OF THE TRADITIONAL APPROACH BY A FORENSIC EXAMINER. BASED ON THE RESULTS, A STRATEGY WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR STEPWISE INTEGRATION OF THE OBJECTIVE SYSTEM IN DAILY CASEWORK OF FORENSIC FIREARMS EXAMINERS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FIREARM EXAMINERS WILL HAVE A PEER TESTED METHOD WITH ACCESS TO A COMPREHENSIVE AND OBJECTIVE SOLUTION FOR FIREARM TOOLMARK COMPARISON AND A DETERMINATION OF THE EVIDENTIAL STRENGTH OF EVIDENCE BASED ON REPRESENTATIVE MARK REFERENCE DATABASES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:FORENSIC SCIENTIST PRACTITIONERS IN THE FIREARM IDENTIFICATION SPECIALTY, OFFICERS OF THE COURT (PROSECUTION, DEFENSE ATTORNEYS), JUDGES, RESEARCHERS IN ACADEMIA AND COMMERCIAL ESTABLISHMENTS, AND THE PUBLIC WHO WILL SERVE AS JURORS WHERE SUCH EVIDENCE AND TESTIMONY WILL BE CONSIDERED IN COURT PROCEEDINGS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FURTHER DEVELOP GALLIUM OXIDE-BASED POWER ELECTRONICS BY USING METROLOGY TO IDENTIFY KEY PERFORMANCE LIMITING FACTORS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: MEASUREMENT AND ANALYSIS OF HETEROINTERFACES SIC-GA2O3, AND ASSESS CHANGE IN THERMAL CONDUCTION AND IMPACT ON FUNCTIONAL ELECTRICAL PERFORMANCE. DESIGN, DEVICE MODELLING, AND FABRICATION OF PN HETEROSTRUCTURES DIODES, SUCH AS NIO-GA2O3, WHERE ELECTRICAL PERFORMANCE OF DIODE IS ASSESSED, AND THE QUALITY OF THE INTERFACE ASSESSED BY PHYSICAL, SPECTROSCOPIC METHODS. DESIGN, FABRICATION OF VERTICAL GA2O3 SCHOTTKY DIODES WITH DIELECTRIC (E.G., AL2O3) AND DEVICE MEASUREMENTS CORRELATED WITH OTHER PHYSICAL MEASUREMENTS TO CORRELATE HOW DEVICE PROCESSING PROCEDURES INTRODUCE OR PASSIVATE DEFECTS, IMPACT OF DIELECTRICS FOR ELECTRIC FIELD MANAGEMENT. ADVANCED MEASUREMENT DEVELOPMENT AND ANALYSIS, SUCH AS PULSED ELECTRICAL MEASUREMENTS, OF LATERAL GA2O3-BASED MOSFETS TO IDENTIFY DEFECTS AND THEIR LIFETIME. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVEMENTS TO THE OVERALL RELIABILITY AND PERFORMANCE OF GA2O3-BASED POWER DEVICES BY PROVIDING KEY STRUCTURE ? DEVICE FUNCTION RELATIONSHIPS WHICH WILL ENABLE THE TECHNOLOGY CLOSER TO REACHING MARKET.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: STAKEHOLDERS DEVELOPING COMPACT, EFFICIENT POWER ELECTRONICS (E.G., AFRL, DOE, US NRL) FOR HIGH VOLTAGE, HIGH CURRENT DENSITY APPLICATIONS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP LARGE PUBLIC DATASETS FROM NEW SEQUENCING TECHNOLOGIES FOR PUBLIC GENOMES FROM THE GENOME IN A BOTTLE CONSORTIUM AND NIST REFERENCE MATERIALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO GENERATE HIGH QUALITY NANOPORE SEQUENCING DATASETS REQUIRED TO CHARACTERIZE NEW TUMOR/NORMAL CELL LINES THAT WILL LIKELY BECOME THE FIRST REFERENCE MATERIALS OF THEIR KIND. FURTHERMORE, THE PROPOSED TRANSCRIPTOME SEQUENCING WILL FURTHER IMPROVE CHARACTERIZATION AND UTILITY OF THE GIAB REFERENCEMATERIALS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROPOSED WORK WILL ACCOMPLISH IMPORTANT OBJECTIVES RELATED TO THE NIST WORK ON DEVELOPING HUMAN GENOME REFERENCE MATERIALS AND DATA. THIS WORK WILL PROVIDE IMPORTANT, PUBLIC DATA FOR NIST?S HUMAN GENOME REFERENCE MATERIALS THAT WILL BE BROADLY USEFUL TO THE COMMUNITY FOR BIOINFORMATICS AND TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT,OPTIMIZATION, AND DEMONSTRATION, AS WELL AS CLINICAL VALIDATION OF GENOMIC ASSAYS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE TECHNOLOGIES THAT ARE DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS PROJECT COULD BE APPLIED TO DEVELOPING NEW GENOMICS BIOINFORMATICS METHODS BY ACADEMIC AND COMMERCIAL LABORATORIES, BECAUSE THESE WILL BE UNIQUE PUBLIC DATA FOR BROADLY AVAILABLE HUMAN GENOMES. THESE FULLY PUBLIC DATA FOR BROADLY CONSENTED SAMPLES WOULD BE THE FIRST OF THEIRKIND FOR TUMOR AND NORMAL GENOMES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO FUND 5 SUMMER UNDERGRADUATE PHYSICS STUDENTS FOR 10-WEEK POSITIONS FOR UNDERGRADUATE PHYSICS STUDENTS IN SCIENCE RESEARCH AT NIST.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: STUDENTS WILL WORK ON NIST CAMPUS FULL-TIME FOR 10-WEEKS. THE INTERNS WILL BE PARTNERED WITH NIST STAFF AS MENTORS AND CONDUCT LABORATORY BASED RESEARCH, ADVANCING NIST PROJECTS, GAINING RESEARCH EXPERIENCE FOR STUDENTS, AND DEVELOPING THE WRITTEN AND VERBAL SKILLS TO PRESENT AND COMMUNICATE COMPLEX TECHNICAL INFORMATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE INTERNS WILL GAIN RESEARCH EXPERIENCE AND DEVELOP THE WRITTEN AND VERBAL SKILLS TO PRESENT AND COMMUNICATE COMPLEX TECHNICAL INFORMATION, CRITICAL TO CAREER DEVELOPMENT. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL POPULATION THROUGH NURTURING THE SCIENTIFIC PIPELINE WITH MENTORING AND TRAINING EMERGING HIGH-QUALITY TECHNICAL TALENT. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

AWARD DESCRIPTION PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PERFORM FOUNDATIONAL RESEARCH TO SUPPORT THE CREATION OF PROCESSES THAT ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF MEASUREMENT AND QUANTIFICATION STANDARDS FOR AUTOMATED DRIVINGSYSTEMS (ADS). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNDER THIS ONE-YEAR EFFORT, VTTI AND GCAPS WILL IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE SCENARIOS TO GUIDE DATA-DRIVEN STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT. THIS WORK WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A SIMULATION TESTBEDSOLUTION BY EXPLORING SIMULATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND DEFINING THE PROCESS AND METHODOLOGY FORSCENARIO IDENTIFICATION, ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) INTEGRATION, SENSOR/PERCEPTION INTEGRATION,INFRASTRUCTURE COMMUNICATION, AND CYBERSECURITY EVALUATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS WORK WILL RESULT IN APPROACHES TO MEASURE AND QUANTIFY THE PERFORMANCE OF AUTOMATED VEHICLES TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR SAFETY AND SECURITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AUTOMATED VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS AND SYSTEM INTEGRATORS, GOVERNMENT REGULATORS, ORGANIZATIONS THAT TRY TO QUANTIFY THE PERFORMANCE OF AUTOMATED VEHICLES, THE GENERAL PUBLIC THAT USE AUTOMATED VEHICLES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS A SUB-AWARD TO THE GLOBAL CENTER FOR AUTOMOTIVE PERFORMANCE SIMULATION (GCAPS). THEY WILL SURVEY AND DOCUMENT EXISTING OFF-THE-SHELF STATE-OF-THE-ART AI ALGORITHMS FOR INCLUSION IN SIMULATIONS THAT CAN DIRECTLY SUPPORT THE NIST SIMULATION TESTBED.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO INVESTIGATE THE ORIGIN OF THE QUANTIZED ANOMALOUS HALL EFFECT (QAHE) IN TWISTED BILAYER GRAPHENE DEVICES AND ITS ROBUSTNESS FOR METROLOGICAL APPLICATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE QAHE IN TWISTED 2D CRYSTALS RESULTS FROM SPONTANEOUS FERROMAGNETISM, WHICH BREAKS THE TIME-REVERSAL SYMMETRY. TO THOROUGHLY UNDERSTAND THE QAHE PHENOMENA, IT?S IMPERATIVE TO CLARIFY THE NECESSARY INGREDIENTS FOR MAGNETISM SPONTANEOUSLY OCCURRING IN QAHE DEVICES. THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE FIRST PRINCIPLES CALCULATIONS AND CONTINUUM MEAN-FIELD APPROACHES TO DEVELOP EFFECTIVE MODELS THAT CAN BE COMPUTATIONALLY CHEAP, CAN BE USED TO STUDY FLUCTUATIONS AND DISORDERS, AND TO IDENTIFY THE CONDITIONS THAT ENABLE MAGNETIC ORDER FORMATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE DEVELOPED EFFICIENT COMPUTATIONAL APPROACHES WILL ENABLE THE SCREENING OF CONTRIBUTING PHYSICAL PARAMETERS AND WILL GUIDE THE FABRICATION OF RESEARCH DEVICES WITH ROBUST QAHE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ROBUST QAHE DEVICES CAN PROVIDE THE PLATFORM FOR MORE AFFORDABLE AND DEPLOYABLE QUANTUM-BASED STANDARDS SUPPORTING NIST MISSION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE QUASISTATIC AND HIGH RATE TESTING TO UNDERSTAND AND PREDICT BEHAVIORS OF AGED ANDUNAGED HIGH STRENGTH FIBERS FOR USE IN PROTECTIVE APPLICATIONS AND UNDERSTAND HOW WELL THE QUASISTATIC PROPERTIE SPREDICT THOSE AT HIGH RATES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL HELP DEVELOP KOLSKY BAR TESTING METHODOLOGIES FOR MECHANICAL TESTING OF HIGH STRENGTH SINGLEFIBERS. THE RESEARCHERS WILL AGE SAMPLES OF HIGH STRENGTH FIBERS AND PERFORM BOTH QUASISTATIC AND KOLSKY BAR (HIGHRATE) TESTING ON THEM. THEY WILL THEN ANALYZE DATA SETS FROM THESE EXPERIMENTS TO TEST AND VALIDATE MODELS PREDICTING PERFORMANCE. THE RESEARCHERS WILL ALSO PUBLISH THIS DATA THROUGH THE MIDAS DATA REPOSITORY AND MAKE IT FULLY AVAILABLE TO OTHERS WORKING IN THIS FIELD .EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING MEASUREMENT METHODS THAT WILL ADVANCE THE  UNDERSTANDING OF HOW WELL (1) QUASISTATIC MATERIAL PROPERTIES PREDICT HIGHER RATE MATERIAL PERFORMANCE FOR CRITICAL LIFE-SAVING EQUIPMENT SUCH AS BODY ARMOR (2) EXAMINE THE RATE DEPENDENCE OF MATERIAL PROPERTIES FOR HIGH STRENGTH FIBERS AND (3) POTENTIALLY FURTHE RELUCIDATE EXPECTED LIFETIMES FOR ARMOR MATERIALS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESULTS GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BE USED BY ARMOR DESIGNERS AND ARMOR PROCUREMENT OFFICIALS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW TO PREDICT ARMOR LIFETIME EITHER FOR EVALUATION OF NEW MATERIALS OR FOR POTENTIALLY EXTENDING THESERVICE LIFE OF ARMOR CURRENTLY BEING WORN BY LAW ENFORCEMENT AND MILITARY PERSONNEL. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT TO DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE THE NEW PRACTICE OF COMPUTATIONAL METROLOGY, BROKEN INTO THREE PHASES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE FIRST PHASE WILL FOCUS ON DEVELOPING END-TO-END DEMONSTRATIONS OF COMPUTATIONAL METROLOGY, IN AREAS SELECTED WITH THE WORKING GROUP. POTENTIAL TEST CASES INCLUDE:A MECHANICAL TESTER THAT CAN GENERALIZE FROM OBSERVED TESTS TO PREDICT RESULTS FOR UNOBSERVED SAMPLE GEOMETRIES.A MILLING MACHINE THAT CAN DISCOVER HIGH-SPEED TOOLPATHS.A MICROSCOPE THAT CAN DO SPECTROSCOPIES.A NONLINEAR VECTOR NETWORK ANALYZER THAT CAN PROVIDE COMPONENT MODELS.A 3D THERMAL CAMERA THAT CAN DETERMINE HEAT FLOWS AS WELL AS TEMPERATURES.THE SECOND PHASE WILL REVISIT THE TEST CASES TO SEEK INTEGRATED REPRESENTATIONS OF FORM AND FUNCTION, COMBINING ASPECTS CURRENTLY DISTRIBUTED OVER MULTIPLE DOMAIN-SPECIFIC INTERCHANGE FORMATS, INCLUDINGSTEP (CAD)MODELICA (MATHEMATICAL MODELS)PYTHON (ALGORITHMS)ALA (SPATIAL COMPUTING)SPICE (ELECTRONIC SIMULATION)DICE (ELECTRONIC CONSTRUCTION)TCP/IP (NETWORKING)OASIS (IC MASKS)PDB (MOLECULAR DYNAMICS)GLTF (3D GRAPHICS)AMF (ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING)THE THIRD PHASE WILL FOCUS ON DELIVERING CRITICAL APPLICATIONS OF COMPUTATIONAL METROLOGY, POTENTIALLY INCLUDINGEXPANDING USE OF RECYCLED AND RENEWABLE MATERIALS BY ADAPTING DESIGNS, SPEEDS, AND FEEDS TO THEIR VARIABILITY IN ADDITIVE AND SUBTRACTIVE PROCESSES.PROVIDING REPRODUCIBLE REFERENCE VERSIONS OF MEASURING PHYSICS STANDARDS.ENABLING BIOLOGICAL FOUNDRIES TO DISCOVER PRODUCTION PROTOCOLS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:1. THE DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION OF THE DIRECT DETERMINATION OF PREDICTIVE MODELS OF MEASUREMENTS2. THE DEVELOPMENT AND DEMONSTRATION OF INTERCHANGE FORMATS FOR DESCRIBING HOW MEASUREMENTS ARE PERFORMED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:A NUMBER OF BENEFITS WILL REDOUND TO THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY AND THE BROADER PUBLIC IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:SUSTAINABILITY: THE TRANSITION TO A CIRCULAR ECONOMY IS GOING TO REQUIRE EXPANDED USE OF RECYCLED ANDRENEWABLE MATERIALS. THESE CANNOT MEET TIGHT TOLERANCES FOR FEED-FORWARD SPECIFICATIONS OF THEIR PROPERTIES;INSTEAD, APPLICATIONS MUST BE ABLE TO ADAPT TO THEM.MANUFACTURING: ADVANCED MANUFACTURING HAS SEEN A PROLIFERATION OF PROMISING NEW PROCESSES INTRODUCED, BUT EACH OF THESE REQUIRES THE OPTIMIZATION OF UNFAMILIAR PROCESS PARAMETERS. THESE REQUIRE AN ONLINE ABILITY TO MODEL PROCESSES FROM OBSERVATIONS OF THEM. METROLOGY:  COMPUTATIONAL METROLOGY HOLDS THE PROMISE OF REDUCINGTHE NEED FOR MEASUREMENT TRACEABILITY BY EXPANDING USE OF PRIMARY FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICAL STANDARDS.ACCESSIBILITY: METROLOGY IMPACTS EVERYONE, BUT A MUCH SMALLER COMMUNITY IS ACTIVELY INVOLVED IN MAKING MEASUREMENTS. EXPANDING ACCESS TO METROLOGY HAS POTENTIAL IMPACTS RANGING FROM STEM OUTREACH, TO CITIZEN SCIENCE RESPONSES TO POLLUTION AND CLIMATE CHANGE, TO LINKING INDIGENOUS AND MODERN KNOWLEDGE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP SENSING TOOLS TO MEASURE FLOW WITHIN MICROFLUIDIC CHANNELS USING ACOUSTIC WAVES AND COMBINED IT WITH OTHER MICROFLUIDIC TECHNIQUES AND METHODS, ALL WITHOUT DISTURBING OTHER CHIP OPERATIONS. DIFFERENT DESIGN CONFIGURATIONS OF ACOUSTIC TRANSDUCERS WITH MULTIPLE SENSING POINTS IN A CHANNEL WILL BE FABRICATED AND TESTED. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: AS A FIRST APPROACH, AN ARRAY OF INTERDIGITATED TRANSDUCERS FOR LEVERAGING MULTIPLE SENSING POINTS FOR MORE PRECISE FLOW MEASUREMENTS WILL BE DESIGN, FABRICATED AND TESTED.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS SYSTEM WILL HAVE HIGH SENSITIVITY AND A WIDE DYNAMIC MEASUREMENT RANGE. SINCE ACOUSTIC WAVES ARE MOSTLY INVISIBLE AT LOW VOLTAGES TO OTHER OPERATIONS IN MICROFLUIDIC CHANNELS THE DEVICE WILL OPERATE AT SUCH VOLTAGES TO INTEGRATE THE FLOW SENSING CAPABILITY FOR CELL SEPARATIONS ALONG WITH INERTIAL FOCUSING AND DIELECTROPHORETIC STAGES, WHICH ARE LABEL-FREE METHODS AND CAN BE USED WITH BIOLOGICAL SYSTEMS WITHOUT ALTERING THEIR FUNCTIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS RESEARCH WILL PRODUCE TOOLS TO ACCURATELY MEASURE AND UNDERSTAND MICROFLUIDIC FLOW CHARACTERISTICS WITHIN BIOMEDICAL DEVICES AS WELL AS DEVICES IN OTHER TECHNOLOGY INDUSTRIES. BIOTECHNOLOGY, DRUG DEVELOPMENT AND BIOMEDICAL DEVICES INDUSTRIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT OF ACOUSTIC WAVES INTEGRATED IN MICROFLUIDIC-BASED DEVICES FOR FLOW CONTROL MEASUREMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENABLE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT OF HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE ARCHITECTURE PLATFORM TO CHARACTERIZE THE MICROSTRUCTURE AND DEFECTS OF METAL ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING (AM) PARTS IN REAL TIME USING ULTRASOUND NON-DESTRUCTIVE EVALUATION (NDE).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: AN ULTRASOUND NDE SYSTEM INTEGRATED WITH LASER POWDER BED FUSION AM MACHINE WILL ENABLE THE ACQUISITION OF ULTRASOUND RESPONSES AND EDGE COMPUTING FOR DATA ANALYSIS IN REAL-TIME. A COMPREHENSIVE KNOWLEDGE BASE USING MACHINE LEARNING WILL QUANTITIVELY BRIDGE THE ULTRASOUND RESPONSES TO MICROSTRUCTURES AND DEFECTS. PHYSICS-BASED COMPUTATIONAL MODELS FOR SOLIDIFICATION MICROSTRUCTURES AND ULTRASOUND PROPAGATION WILL ESTABLISH A THEORETICAL BASELINE AND A FUNDAMENTAL UNDERSTANDING OF ULTRASOUND RESPONSES. A DATA SCIENCE TOOL TO DEPLOY THE MODELS FROM THE KNOWLEDGE BASE ONTO REAL-TIME COMPUTING SYSTEMS WILL ENABLE THE TIMING DETERMINISTIC IN SITU CHARACTERIZATION OF MICROSTRUCTURE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER AN ULTRASOUND NDE TOOL SPECIFICALLY FOR QUALIFYING AM PARTS AND BUILD A FOUNDATION TO BRIDGE THE GAP BETWEEN EX SITU MEASUREMENT AND ONLINE, REAL-TIME MICROSTRUCTURE AND DEFECTS CHARACTERIZATION DURING LASER POWDER BED FUSION AM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING AND NON-DESTRUCTIVE EVALUATION COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM INSIGHTS INTO HOW MICROSTRUCTURES AT DIFFERENT LENGTH SCALES INTERACT WITH ULTRASOUND AT VARIOUS FREQUENCIES AND AMPLITUDES, PROVIDING A REAL-TIME MONITORING SOLUTION BASED ON PHYSICAL PRINCIPLES TO UNCOVER MICROSTRUCTURAL CHARACTERISTICS.  FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO EMPLOY GRADUATE STUDENTS, WHO WILL BENEFIT BY GAINING EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE IN ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, A GROWING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING PROCESS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA INTENDS TO SUBCONTRACT WITH UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT URBANA-CHAMPAIGN AND AUBURN UNIVERSITY.  THESE UNIVERSITIES WILL DEVELOP A HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE ARCHITECTURE PLATFORM THAT CHARACTERIZES THE MICROSTRUCTURE AND DEFECTS OF METALLIC PARTS IN REAL-TIME USING ULTRASOUND NON-DESTRUCTIVE EVALUATION (NDE) IN THE LASER POWDER BED FUSION AM (LPBFAM) PROCESS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENABLE RESEARCH INTO FLAW-FREE AND CYBERSECURE PRODUCTION OF METAL PARTS MADE USING ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES THROUGH DEVELOPMENT AND APPLICATION OF NOVEL COMPUTATIONAL TOOLS FOR REAL-TIME PROCESS MONITORING AND AUTONOMOUS FLAW CORRECTION BASED ON THE CONCEPT OF EDGE COMPUTING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FAST AND ACCURATE PREDICTION OF THERMAL HISTORY BY REPRESENTING THE PART GEOMETRY IN TERMS OF RANDOMLY SAMPLED NODES, CONSTRUCTING A NETWORK GRAPH BY CONNECTING NODES, AND SIMULATING MELTING OF EACH LAYER TO PREDICT TEMPERATURE DISTRIBUTIONS.  DETECT DRIFTS USING REAL-TIME SENSOR DATA AND SIMULATIONS BY MONITORING THE LAYER TEMPERATURE USING VARIOUS SENSORS, INCORPORATING INSTANTANEOUS MELT POOL TEMPERATURE INTO THE GRAPH THEORY MODEL, AND DETECTING ONSET OF FLAW FORMATION AS THE PART IS BEING BUILT.  CORRECT POTENTIAL FLAWS BY QUANTIFYING THE SEVERITY OF THE PROCESS DRIFT, IDENTIFYING A SAFE PROCESS CORRECTION STRATEGY, AND CHANGE PROCESS PARAMETERS TO CORRECT THE DRIFT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SOFTWARE AND HARDWARE TOOLS THAT ALLOW A PREDICTION-DETECTION-CORRECTION CONTROL LOOP THAT DOES NOT REQUIRE TRANSFERRING DATA BACK AND FORTH FROM THE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MACHINE, THUS ENABLING THE SECURE CREATION OF METAL ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PARTS WITHOUT DEFECTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MANUFACTURERS OF THIRD-PARTY MEASUREMENT TOOLS VENDOR FOR LASER POWDER BED FUSION AND ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MACHINES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE NEW TOOLS TO INTEGRATE INTO NEW AND EXISTING ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MACHINES.  FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO EMPLOY GRADUATE STUDENTS, WHO WILL BENEFIT BY GAINING EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE IN ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, A GROWING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING PROCESS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA-LINCOLN INTENDS TO SUBCONTRACT WITH DREXEL UNIVERSITY AND NAVAJO TECHNICAL UNIVERSITY (NTU).  THESE COLLABORATORS WILL BE FOCUSED ON SEPARATE ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT. DREXEL WILL BE PRIMARILY INVOLVED IN MATERIALS CHARACTERIZATION WHILE NTU?S EFFORT WILL BE AIM AT THE METROLOGY OF THE RESEARCH.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A REAL-TIME, COMPREHENSIVE, IN-SITU SUB-SURFACE AND BULK STRUCTURAL ANALYSIS OF METAL ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PARTS DURING FABRICATION AND INTEGRATION WITH MULTI-MODAL DATA FROM VARIOUS IN-SITU SENSORS, THAT CAN BRIDGE THE CRITICAL KNOWLEDGE GAP BETWEEN PROCESS CONDITIONS AND PROPERTIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DESIGN AND BUILD A CUSTOM IN-SITU TWO-DIMENSIONAL X-RAY DIFFRACTION (2D-XRD) TOOL FOR A DIRECTED ENERGY DEPOSITION (DED) ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MACHINE. ESTABLISH A DATABASE OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESS CONDITIONS, MICROSTRUCTURE, AND PROPERTIES.  INTEGRATE THE 2D-XRD TOOL INTO A DED MACHINE THAT ALREADY INCLUDES TEMPERATURE, FORCE, VIBRATION, AND ACOUSTIC EMISSION SENSORS.  USE DATABASE FOR REAL-TIME PROCESS CONTROL.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REAL-TIME PROCESS CONTROL LEADING TO METAL ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PARTS WITH REDUCED POROSITY, COLUMNAR DENDRITIC GRAINS, AND VARIATION IN MICROSTRUCTURE AND HARDNESS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MEASUREMENT TOOL VENDORS AND ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MACHINE VENDORS WILL BENEFIT FROM PUBLIC DISSEMINATION OF THIS WORK BY PROVIDING NEW TOOLS TO INTEGRATE INTO NEW AND EXISTING MACHINES.  FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT WILL BE USED TO EMPLOY GRADUATE STUDENTS, WHO WILL BENEFIT BY GAINING EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE IN ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, A GROWING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING PROCESS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: UNIVERSITY OF HOUSTON INTENDS TO SUBCONTRACT WITH TEXAS A&M UNIVERSITY. STAFF AT A&M WILL BE WORKING AS CO-PI?S WITH HOUSTON. THEY WILL BE WORKING COLLABORATIVELY THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT SHARING RESOURCES AND RESEARCH.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO STUDY NOVEL QUANTUM PHENOMENA THAT ARE IMPORTANT FOR FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS AND FUTURE APPLICATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE SPECIAL ULTRA-CLEAN HETEROSTRUCTURE DEVICES BASED ON ATOMICALLY THIN VAN DER WAALS MATERIALS THAT DISPLAY A WIDE VARIETY OF EXOTIC CORRELATED AND TOPOLOGICAL PHASES WILL BE FABRICATED. THE DEVICES WILL BE CHARACTERIZED FOR CLEANLINESS BY ATOMIC FORCE MICROSCOPY AND RAMAN SPECTROSCOPY, TESTED BY MAGNETOTRANSPORT MEASUREMENTS AT LOW MEASUREMENTS. FINALLY, THE DEVICES WILL BE STUDIED WITH ATOMIC-SCALE RESOLUTION BY ULTRA-LOW TEMPERATURE SCANNING TUNNELING MICROSCOPY AND SPECTROSCOPY THAT REQUIRES AN EXTRAORDINARY CLEANLINESS OF THE FABRICATION PROCESSES. THE TARGETED PHYSICAL PHENOMENA INCLUDE FRACTIONAL QUANTUM HALL REGIME WITH POTENTIAL FOR NON-ABELIAN QUASIPARTICLE STATISTICS, UNUSUAL SUPERCONDUCTIVITY INDUCED BY PROXIMAL COUPLING OF MATERIALS WITH MAGNETIC ORDERING AND OTHER ENGINEERED TOPOLOGICAL PROPERTIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT CAN HAVE IMPORTANT IMPLICATIONS FOR ADVANCEMENT OF QUANTUM INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS ON-CHIP SUPERCONDUCTING CIRCUITS AND TOPOLOGICAL QUANTUM COMPUTATION. THE BROADER IMPACT IS ENHANCING THE NATIONS? LEADERSHIP IN QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIES AND CREATING A NEW GENERATION OF SCIENTISTS READY TO JOIN THE QUANTUM WORKFORCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BROAD SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY AND GENERAL PUBLIC THROUGH GENERATED FUNDAMENTAL KNOWLEDGE AND FUTURE QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIESSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: TO STUDY THE ACCURACY AND REPRODUCIBILITY OF PROJECTILE COMPARISONS BY FORENSIC FIREARM EXAMINERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS STUDY IS A FULL EVALUATION OF THE CONCLUSIONS MADE BY FIREARMS EXAMINERS IN COMPARING BULLETS. THE ACCURACY AND REPRODUCIBILITY OF BULLET COMPARISONS BY FIREARMS EXAMINERS HAVE NEVER BEEN ESTABLISHED IN A RIGOROUS STUDY. BECAUSE BULLET EVIDENCE IS OF SUCH HIGH PROBATIVE VALUE, THIS IS A NOTABLE GAP IN FORENSIC SCIENCE.  A BULLET BLACK BOX STUDY  RIGOROUSLY ASSESSES THE ACCURACY, REPRODUCIBILITY, AND REPEATABILITY OF CONCLUSIONS MADE BY FIREARMS EXAMINERS IN COMPARING BULLETS. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS STUDY IS TO COMPLETE THE FIRST BLACK BOX STUDY OF PROJECTILE COMPARISONS, IN ORDER TO ESTABLISH THE SCIENTIFIC BASIS OF BULLET COMPARISONS, AND TO PROVIDE NECESSARY INFORMATION ABOUT THE DISCIPLINE TO LABORATORY MANAGERS, TO PRACTITIONERS, AND TO THE LEGAL SYSTEM. THE 2016 PRESIDENT'S COUNCIL OF ADVISORS ON SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY (PCAST) REPORT ON FORENSIC SCIENCE STATED THAT BLACK BOX EVALUATIONS ARE NECESSARY TO ESTABLISH THE VALIDITY OF FORENSIC EXAMINATION METHODS THAT RELY ON HUMAN JUDGMENT. ALTHOUGH BLACK BOX EVALUATIONS OF FORENSIC EXAMINATION OF CARTRIDGE CASES HAVE BEEN AND ARE BEING CONDUCTED, THERE HAS BEEN NO LARGE-SCALE ASSESSMENT OF BULLET COMPARISONS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE ESSENTIAL INFORMATION TO LABORATORY MANAGERS, PRACTITIONERS, AND THE LEGAL SYSTEM, INCLUDING A DETAILED UNDERSTANDING OF THE CAPABILITIES, VARIABILITY, AND LIMITS OF FIREARMS EXAMINERS; 1) THE ASSOCIATIONS BETWEEN FIREARMS EXAMINERS' ABILITIES AND THEIR TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE; 2) THE EXTENT TO WHICH A SINGLE FIREARMS EXAMINER'S CONCLUSION IS LIKELY TO BE ACCURATE AND REPRODUCED BY A SECOND FIREARMS ANALYST; AND 3) THE EXTENT TO WHICH FIREARMS EXAMINERS CONCUR ON WHETHER THE INFORMATION IN A GIVEN PATTERN IS SUFFICIENT TO RENDER A CONCLUSIVE OPINION.  BY THE COMPLETION OF THE GRANT'S PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE, THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL DELIVER A FINAL RESEARCH REPORT TO NIST THAT DETAILS THE RESULTS AND FINDINGS.  THE REPORT WILL BE WRITTEN TO BE SUBMITTED TO A PEER-REVIEWED JOURNAL. RESULTS AND FINDINGS WILL BE PRESENTED AT APPROPRIATE VENUES SUCH AS THE ASSOCIATION OF FIREARM AND TOOLMARK EXAMINERS AND THE AMERICAN ACADEMY OF FORENSIC SCIENCES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FORENSIC LABORATORY MANAGERS, FORENSIC PRACTITIONERS, THE ACADEMIC RESEARCH COMMUNITY, OFFICERS OF THE COURT, THE US PUBLIC, AND THE LEGAL SYSTEM.SUBRECIPIENTS: NO SUBRECIPIENTS ARE PLANNED FOR THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE:  THIS AWARD WILL DEVELOP METHODS TO QUANTIFYING URBAN METHANE EMISSIONS USING SATELLITE-BASED AND SURFACE NETWORK MEASUREMENTS ALONG WITH EVALUATION OF APPROACH EFFECTIVENESS. THE RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE THE ABILITY TO QUANTIFY AND TRACK METHANE EMISSIONS FROM U.S. CITIES, AND THOSE AROUND THE GLOBE, WITH INDEPENDENT GROUND-BASED EVALUATION TO PROVIDE CONFIDENCE IN THE ANALYSIS METHODS AND THEIR RESULTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THIS RESEARCH UTILIZES SATELLITE DATA DERIVED FROM CURRENT AND ONGOING MISSIONS.  IT WILL ALSO BE TRANSLATABLE TO FUTURE SPACED-BASED SENSOR TECHNOLOGIES.  THERE ARE THREE OBJECTIVES:[1] DEVELOP METHOD FOR EVALUATING SPACE-BASED APPROACHES LEVERAGING WELL-INSTRUMENTED CITIES.[2] USING NEW SPACE-BASED METHODS TO QUANTIFY EMISSIONS IN CITIES WITH LITTLE TO NO EXISTING OBSERVATIONAL QUANTIFICATIONS OF URBAN METHANE.[3] DEVELOP APPROACHES THAT EXPAND SPACE-BASED METHODS USING ATMOSPHERIC MODELING AS WELL AS METHODS OF MERGING SATELLITE AND GROUND-BASED DATA IN HIGHLY INSTRUMENTED CITIES SUCH AS THOSE OF NIST'S GHG URBAN MEASUREMENTS TESTBED SYSTEM.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THIS RESEARCH WILL ADVANCE MODELING CAPABILITIES SUPPORTING MEASUREMENT OF METHANE EMISSIONS BY ADDRESSING SEVERAL ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH LINKING GROUND-BASED OBSERVATIONAL DATA WITH THAT TAKEN FROM SATELLITES.  THE FOLLOWING TASK AREAS ARE THE FOCUS OF THE RESEARCH.* COMPARE SPACE-BASED ESTIMATES WITH TOWER CONSTRAINTS FOR THE NORTHEAST CORRIDOR.* EXTEND THE APPROACH TO LOS ANGELES* EXTENSION TO SELECTED CITIES GLOBALLY* EXPLORE THE XSTILT MODEL APPLICABILITY FOR SPACE-BASED OBSERVATIONS.* EXPLORE INTEGRATION OF TOWER AND SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS* CONSIDER THE APPLICABILITY OF THESE APPROACHES TO FUTURE ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION MEASURING SATELLITES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  FEDERAL AGENCIES, LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS, AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR SEEKING TO USE SATELLITE DATA TO DETERMINE EMISSIONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS INVESTIGATING THE TIMEFRAME FOR THE DETERIORATION OF CONCRETE SAMPLES CONTAINING REACTIVE IRON-SULFIDE BEARING AGGREGATES BY USING A TEST METHOD THAT ACCELERATES THE DETERIORATION.  AN ACCELERATED TESTING PROCEDURE WILL BE USED TO PERFORM THIS INVESTIGATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RESEARCH EFFORTS WILL FOCUS ON ADAPTING AND VALIDATING A TEST PROCEDURE THAT ACCELERATES THE DETERIORATION OF CONCRETE CONTAINING REACTIVE IRON-SULFIDE BEARING AGGREGATES, FIELD TESTING OF CONCRETE FROM COMPROMISED STRUCTURES, AND ADVANCING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A RISK ASSESSMENT TOOL FOR STRUCTURAL DAMAGE DUE TO REACTIVE SULFUR SPECIES IN CONCRETE FOUNDATIONS UNDER A GIVEN SET OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL LEVERAGE THE TEST RESULTS TO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING THE RATE OF DETERIORATION DUE TO PRESENCE OF SULFUR-BEARING CONSTITUENTS IN THE CONCRETE.  THIS TEAM WILL IMPROVE UPON THE FUNDAMENTAL UNDERSTANDING FOR THE DETERIORATION TIMEFRAME BY COMPARING ACCELERATED TESTS TO FIELD DATA.  THEY WILL IDENTIFY THE KEY PARAMETERS INFLUENCING DETERIORATION, AND THEY PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON HOW EFFECTIVE POTENTIAL MITIGATIONS ARE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS RESEARCH EXPANDS UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT?S EXPERTISE IN CONCRETE ASSESSMENT AND RISK TOOL DEVELOPMENT.  A FRAMEWORK TO ASSESS THE RISK OF FAILURE WILL PLACE HOMES IN RISK CATEGORIES THAT CORRESPOND TO DIFFERENT LEVELS AND TIMEFRAMES FOR INTERVENTION. IT IS EXPECTED THAT THIS WILL HELP REDUCING OVERALL COSTS, AS WELL AS STRESS AND UNCERTAINTY ASSOCIATED WITH LIVING IN AN IMPACTED HOME.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THIS AWARD WILL INCREASE AND IMPROVE MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES THAT IMPROVE CAPABILITIES OF THE STAKEHOLDER COMMUNITY TO OBTAIN QUANTITATIVE KNOWLEDGE OF CO2 AND METHANE EMISSION FLUXES FOR CITIES AND REGIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THIS RESEARCH WILL BE PERFORMED ALONG THE NORTHEAST URBAN CORRIDOR, SPECIFICALLY, IN NIST'S GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) NORTHEAST CORRIDOR MEASUREMENTS TESTBED AND INCLUDE THE CITIES OF WASHINGTON, DC, BALTIMORE, MD, PHILADELPHIA, PA, AND NEW YORK CITY, NY.  AIRCRAFT OBSERVATIONS, MODEL DEVELOPMENT AND ANALYSIS EFFORTS ARE AIMED AT THE CONTINUED IMPROVEMENT OF MEASUREMENT AND ANALYSES THAT IMPROVE QUANTIFICATION OF GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSION AND UPTAKE FLUX RATES FROM URBAN ENVIRONMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  REFINEMENT OF MEASUREMENT METHODOLOGIES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE GHG MEASUREMENT SCIENCE COMMUNITY'S MEASUREMENT TOOL SET AND INCREASE PUBLIC CONFIDENCE IN THE SCIENCE UNDERLYING GHG EMISSIONS QUANTIFICATION IN URBAN AREAS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  LOCAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT WILL ESTABLISH A SUBAWARD OF FUNDS FOR ACTIVITIES AT PURDUE UNIVERSITY RELATED TO OPERATIONS, MODIFICATIONS, AND MAINTENANCE OF THE BEECHCRAFT DUCHESS AIRCRAFT AS INDICATED IN THE APPLICATION DOCUMENTATION.

PURPOSE:THE FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS OF FERROELECTRICS AND RELATED MATERIALS WORKSHOP IS THE FOREMOST SCIENTIFIC MEETING DEDICATED TO BASIC RESEARCH IN FERROELECTRICS IN NORTH AMERICA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE 2023 WORKSHOP ON FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS OF FERROELECTRICS AND RELATED MATERIALS (FERRO2023) WILL PROVIDE AN ESSENTIAL FORUM IN WHICH WORLD-LEADING RESEARCHERS WILL DISCUSS AND SHARE THEIR MOST RECENT SCIENTIFIC ADVANCES AND IDEAS THROUGH A COMBINATION OF INVITED TALKS, CONTRIBUTED TALKS, AND POSTER SESSIONS.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS OF FERROELECTRICS AND RELATED MATERIALS WORKSHOP IS TYPICALLY ATTENDED BY 90 TO 120 PARTICIPANTS.  APPROXIMATELY A THIRD OF WORKSHOP PARTICIPANTS ARE STUDENTS OR POSTDOCS WHO DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM THE OPPORTUNITY TO INTERACT AND NETWORK WITH THE LEADING SCIENTISTS IN THEIR FIELDS.  ONE OF THE WORKSHOP?S STRONGEST ASSETS IS THE FACT THAT BOTH THEORY AND EXPERIMENT ARE EQUALLY REPRESENTED. THIS SERIES OF WORKSHOPS HAS PLAYED A SIGNIFICANT ROLE IN FOSTERING MULTI-INSTITUTIONAL COLLABORATIONS ON RESEARCH DEVOTED TO UNDERSTANDING THE FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS OF THESE COMPLEX AND VERSATILE MATERIALS, WHICH ARE USED IN COUNTLESS APPLICATIONS SUCH AS MEDICAL IMAGING, DATA STORAGE, SONAR, AND ENERGY HARVESTING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE FERROELECTRICS COMMUNITY AND NEUTRON SCATTERING COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB AWARD FUNDS

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ASSESS THE CURRENT STATE OF RECYCLING AND REUSE IN THE ELECTRONICS SECTOR AND PROVIDE AN ARCHITECTURE FOR THE TRANSITION TOWARDS A CIRCULAR ECONOMY IN ELECTRONICS SECTOR WITH SPECIAL ATTENTION TO INTEGRATED CIRCUITS END OF LIFE TREATMENT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL COMBINE LITERATURE RESEARCH WITH EXPERT INTERVIEWS TO UNDERSTAND TYPICAL ELECTRONIC WASTE HANDLING INCLUDING TRADITIONAL DISPOSAL, FORMAL RECYCLING, AND INFORMAL DISPOSAL. THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND REFINE A SET OF ADVANCED, MULTIDIMENSIONAL ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL METRICS (ECONOMICS BY STAKEHOLDER, GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS, WATER SCARCITY, RESOURCE USE, WASTE GENERATION,), TO ASSESS THE CURRENT LEVEL OF CIRCULARITY ON ELECTRONIC CHIPS. THE RESEARCH WILL ASSESS THE CURRENT STATE OF TRANSITION TOWARDS THE CIRCULAR ECONOMY WITH RESPECT TO THE REUSE OF CHIPS IN THE U.S. AND ANALYZE POSSIBLE TRANSITION SCENARIOS, AS WELL AS THEIR OUTCOMES AND IMPACTS. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE REUSE OF CHIPS. IT WILL CONSIDER WHERE REUSE IS ALREADY OCCURRING AND IDENTIFY AND TEST THE POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL AND ECONOMIC IMPACTS OF CIRCULARITY IN THE REUSE OF CHIPS AND KEY DETERMINANTS IN THE U.S. FINALLY, THE PROJECT WILL ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY, FUNCTIONAL CHARACTERISTICS OF STANDARDS THAT NEED TO BE PUT IN PLACE TO ENABLE THE REUSE OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROJECT WILL INFLUENCE THE TRANSITION TO CIRCULARITY IN THE ELECTRONICS SECTOR BY BOTH DESIGNING AND TESTING THE ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPLICATIONS OF THE REUSE OF ELECTRONIC CHIPS. THE OUTCOMES OF THESE ANALYSES WILL PROVIDE TANGIBLE EVIDENCE AND ARGUMENTS FOR THE REUSE OF THOSE CHIPS. FINALLY, THE PROJECT WILL COMPILE THE KEY MULTI-DIMENSIONAL INDICATORS AND METRICS WHICH WILL BE NEEDED TO DEVELOP SYSTEMS AND STANDARDS FOR THE END OF LIFE OF ELECTRONIC CHIPS. CHOOSING APPROPRIATE INDICATORS AND METRICS WILL FACILITATE A CONSISTENT AND SMOOTH TRANSITION TOWARDS THE REUSE OF ELECTRONICS COMPONENTS AS IT WILL ENABLE A THOROUGH MANAGEMENT OF THE PROCESS UP TO END OF LIFE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT U.S. MANUFACTURERS AND CONSUMERS BY IMPROVING REUSE AND RECYCLING OF CONSUMER ELECTRONICS ? SAVING ENERGY AND REDUCING EMISSIONS. A TRANSITION TO A CIRCULAR ECONOMY THROUGH THE REUSE OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS ALSO ENTAILS SYSTEMIC TRANSFORMATION OF THE DESIGN, PRODUCTION, AND CONSUMPTION PHASES, SO THAT THE VALUE OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS CAN BE MAINTAINED IN THE ECONOMY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, WHILE REDUCING ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT AN IMPROVED MEASUREMENT OF THE LIFETIME OF THE NEUTRON, WHICH IS A FUNDAMENTAL CONSTANT LIMITING SOME IMPORTANT ISSUES IN ASTROPHYSICS AND COSMOLOGY, SUCH AS THE AMOUNT OF PRIMORDIAL HELIUM ARISING FROM BIG BANG NUCLEOSYNTHESIS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED WORK WILL MEASURE THE NEUTRON LIFETIME BY OBSERVING THE NEUTRON DECAY INTO A PROTON WHILE IN FLIGHT THROUGH A PENNING ION TRAP.  THIS NON-DESTRUCTIVE METHOD CAPTURES THE PROTON FROM THE DECAY AND COUNTS THE STORED PROTONS IN-SITU VIA THE RADIO-FREQUENCY CURRENT INDUCED BY THEIR MOTIONS, PROVIDING AN INDEPENDENT CALIBRATION OF THE EXTERNAL DETECTOR FOR COUNTING THE PROTONS WHEN THEY ARE DUMPED FROM THE ION TRAP.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  SUCCESS IS EXPECTED TO ESTABLISH THE MEASUREMENT OF THE NEUTRON LIFETIME (ABOUT 878 S) WITH AN UNCERTAINTY WELL BELOW 1 S.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS WORK WILL BENEFIT METROLOGICAL INSTITUTES VIA IMPROVED STANDARDS FOR RADIATION DETECTION.  RESOLUTION OF THE DISCREPANCY (ABOUT 15 STANDARD DEVIATIONS) BETWEEN THE 'BEAM' AND 'BOTTLE' TECHNIQUES FOR NEUTRON LIFETIME MEASUREMENT WILL BENEFIT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER LEARNING BECAUSE OF ITS CENTRAL ROLE IN MANY PHENOMENA/PROJECTS IN NUCLEAR AND PARTICLE PHYSICS, IN ASTROPHYSICS AND IN COSMOLOGY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS IN THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE:THIS AWARD WILL INCREASE THE SCIENTIFIC VALUE OF ASSESSMENTS FROM THE NORTHEAST CORRIDOR TESTBED PROJECT OF NIST URBAN GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) MEASUREMENTS TESTBED SYSTEM. THE RESEARCH WILL ADVANCE CAPABILITIES AND PROMOTE TRANSPARENCY IN MEASUREMENT SCIENCE METHODOLOGIES APPLIED TO GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS QUANTIFICATION, PARTICULARLY IN URBAN APPLICATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:AIRBORNE SAMPLING OF THE ATMOSPHERE IN AND AROUND THE BALTIMORE-WASHINGTON, D.C. REGION WILL SAMPLE ATMOSPHERIC CONCENTRATIONS OF GHGS AND AIR POLLUTANTS. SOME OF THESE FLIGHTS WILL BE CONDUCTED SIMULTANEOUS WITH AN AIRCRAFT OF STONY BROOK UNIVERSITY (SBU) AND PERDUE UNIVERSITY. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED WITH THE AIRBORNE, AND AUXILIARY, DATA COLLECTED ARE:* CALCULATE FLUX VIA MASS BALANCE (AUGMENTED WITH MODEL BACKGROUND EVALUATION) FOR GHGS, CO, NOX/NOY, AND BC USING OBSERVED WINDS AND CONCENTRATIONS, THEN COMPARE TO MODEL RESULTS AND INVENTORIES.* SUPPORT SBU AND NIST STAFF PERFORMING MODEL INVERSIONS TO CALCULATE CO AND GHG FLUXES AND FOR UMD WHO WILL PERFORM EULERIAN MODEL CALCULATIONS.* EXAMINE THE CHANGE IN THE VALUE OF CO, BC, OR NOY TO CO2 TO ENHANCE AND EXPAND FLUX CALCULATIONS AND TO QUANTIFY, FOR EXAMPLE, THE IMPACT OF REDUCED VEHICLE TRAFFIC ON CO, BC, AND NOX EMISSIONS.* COMPARE RUNS OF CMAQ (FUNDED SEPARATELY) WITH AND WITHOUT ESTIMATED EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS AND EVALUATE THESE WITH OBSERVED POLLUTANT TRACE GASES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FROM THIS RESEARCH ARE:1. ATMOSPHERIC GHG (CARBON DIOXIDE AND METHANE) AND SHORT-LIVED POLLUTANT (NITROGEN OXIDES, CARBON MONOXIDE, BLACK CARBON PARTICULATES, VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS AND SULFUR DIOXIDE) CONCENTRATION MEASUREMENT DATA FOR USE IN MASS BALANCE AND ATMOSPHERIC INVERSION MODELING. AT TIMES FLIGHTS ARE PLANNED AND SIMULTANEOUS WITH THOSE TO BE CONDUCTED BY STONY BROOK UNIVERSITY (SBU).2. COMPARISON WITH NOAA'S HYSPLIT/STILT MODEL (RUN BY NIST AND SBU) INVERSION ANALYSES TO EVALUATE MASS BALANCE RESULTS AND TO DETERMINE IF FLYING TWO AIRCRAFT ON THE SAME DAY YIELDS GREATER PRECISION THAN ONE AIRCRAFT ON EACH OF TWO DAYS.3. COMPARE DERIVED GHG EMISSION FLUXES WITH AIR POLLUTANT GASES TO INVESTIGATE THE VALIDITY OF THESE RATIOS FOR USE OF POLLUTANT GASES AS PROXIES FOR GHGS IN SOME INSTANCES.4. PROVIDE DATA SETS TO COMPARE LAGRANGIAN AND EULERIAN MODELS.5. TWO GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BE SUPPORTED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:ADVANCING GREENHOUSE GAS MEASUREMENT TOOLS SUPPORTING US MITIGATION EFFORTS WILL BENEFIT THE PUBLIC, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS WHO NEED ACCURATE EMISSIONS INFORMATION THAT IDENTIFIES PARTIES RESPONSIBLE FOR EMISSIONS AND UPTAKE OF CO2 AND METHANE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB AWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO TEST THE LAWS OF PHYSICS OPERATING IN MANY-ELECTRON ATOMS AT THE LEVEL OF PRECISION MADE POSSIBLE BY OPTICAL FREQUENCY COMBS, DEVELOPING THE FOUNDATIONS FOR MORE SENSITIVE PROBES IN SEARCHING FOR PHYSICS BEYOND THE STANDARD MODEL OF NATURE AS WE KNOW IT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL PERFORM FREQUENCY-COMB BASED MEASUREMENTS OF THE 2P FINE STRUCTURE INTERVALS (D-LINES) IN THE LASER SPECTROSCOPY OF 7,9,10BE+ IONS THAT ARE CONFINED IN A PAUL (RADIO-FREQUENCY) TRAP.  IN ADDITION, THE PROPOSED WORK WILL ALSO DEVELOP QUANTUM-LOGIC SPECTROSCOPY TO STUDY HIGHLY CHARGED IONS USING 7BE+ AS THE LOGIC ION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  SUCCESS IS EXPECTED TO PROVIDE IMPROVED VALUES OF THE 2P FINE STRUCTURE INTERVAL IN SINGLY-IONIZED BERYLLIUM 7,9,10BE+ WITH ATOMIC MASSES 7, 9 AND 10, TESTING MANY-BODY QUANTUM ELECTRODYNAMICS AT THE 5 PARTS IN 1011 LEVEL OF ACCURACY. THIS CAN BE USED TO OBTAIN MORE PRECISE RELATIVE NUCLEAR RADII FOR THESE ISOTOPES OF BERYLLIUM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER LEARNING WILL BENEFIT FROM PRECISELY TESTING THE BASIC LAWS OF NATURE.  METROLOGICAL INSTITUTES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE STUDY OF HIGHLY CHARGED IONS IN QUANTUM-LOGIC SPECTROSCOPY AS A POTENTIAL CANDIDATE FOR DEVELOPING OPTICAL ATOMIC CLOCKS AND FREQUENCY STANDARDS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS IN THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ENHANCE THE CO-SIMULATION PLATFORM, THE UNIVERSAL CYBER-PHYSICAL SYSTEMS (CPS) ENVIRONMENT FOR FEDERATION (UCEF), WITH ADDITIONAL CAPABILITIES FOR INTEGRATING SIMULATIONS PARTICULARLY NETWORKED INFRASTRUCTURES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH PLAN INCLUDES (A) CREATING FOCUSED, DOMAIN-SPECIFICMODEL-INTEGRATED SIMULATION ENVIRONMENTS, (B) USING THESE ENVIRONMENTS FOR CONDUCTING SYSTEM-OF-SYSTEMS LEVEL INTEGRATED EVALUATION OF NETWORKED SMART INFRASTRUCTURES, (C) GENERATING INTEGRATED SIMULATION-BASED TRAINING DATA FOR ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE-BASED DECISION-SUPPORT ALGORITHMS, AND (D) ENABLING CREATION OF LIBRARIES OF REUSABLE (AND INTEROPERABLE) PLATFORMCOMPONENTS. THE PLANNED TASKS ARE IMPORTANT CONCEPTS FOR IMPROVING THE CO-SIMULATION PLATFORM FOR CPS EXPERIMENTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH IF SUCCESSFUL CAN HAVE POTENTIAL FOR BROAD IMPACT SINCE IT ADDRESSES AN IMPORTANT CHALLENGE IN CPS SIMULATION RELATED TO TOOL INTEGRATION ACROSS MULTIPLE DOMAINS. THERE IS A NEED TO PROVIDE IMPROVED CO-SIMULATION CAPABILITIES TO ADDRESS CPS DEVELOPMENT, DEPLOYMENT, AND OPERATION. THE PLANNED RESEARCH WILL ENHANCE THE UCEF FEATURES SET AND IMPROVE ITS CAPABILITIES. THE ABILITY TO SUPPORT INTEGRATION OF MULTIPLE SIMULATED COMMUNICATION NETWORKS AS WELL AS MULTIPLE INTEGRATED SIMULATIONS WILL ENHANCE THE TOOL?S PERFORMANCE. THE RESULTS WILL ENABLE UCEF TO SUPPORT THE BROADER RESEARCH COMMUNITY TO DEVELOP DOMAIN-SPECIFIC MODELS THAT CAN BE INTEGRATED IN A CO-SIMULATION PLATFORM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS RESEARCH WOULD CREATE A LEADING CPS SIMULATION-TESTBED RESEARCH PLATFORM THAT WILL SUPPORT NEW FUNCTIONALITY AND ANALYSES OF CPS DEVELOPMENT, DEPLOYMENT AND OPERATION. BY CREATING AN ACCESSIBLE OPEN-SOURCE BASED SIMULATION TOOL, IT CAN REDUCE MARKET BARRIERS FOR SMALL CPS ENTERPRISES AND PROMOTE COMPETITION FOR CONSUMERS. IN ADDITION, IT COULD LEAD TO MORE RELIABLE CPS/INTERNET OF THINGS PRODUCTS FOR CONSUMERS INTERESTED IN NEW TECHNOLOGIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

BY CREATING AN ACCESSIBLE OPEN-SOURCE BASED SIMULATION TOOL, IT CAN REDUCE MARKET BARRIERS FOR SMALL CPS ENTERPRISES AND PROMOTE COMPETITION FOR CONSUMERS. IN ADDITION, IT COULD LEAD TO MORE RELIABLE CPS/INTERNET OF THINGS PRODUCTS FOR CONSUMERS INTERESTED IN NEW TECHNOLOGIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PRODUCE CRITICAL DATA AND CONCEPTS REGARDING THE CRYSTALLIZATION AND PROCESSING OFMIXED POLYOLEFIN BLENDS IN ORDER TO DEVELOP STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE THE MECHANICAL PROPERTIES OF RECYCLED PLASTICSFROM MIXED WASTE STREAMS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE PROPOSED RESEARCH SEEKS TO UNDERSTAND THE COMPLEX PROCESSING-MORPHOLOGY-PROPERTY RELATIONSHIP IN POLYOLEFINBLENDS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL, THE RESEARCHERS WILL FOCUS ON TWO THRUSTS: QUANTIFYING THE EFFECTS OF SHEAR RATE ON THECRYSTALLIZATION KINETICS AND STRUCTURE OF PE/PP BLENDS UNDER A CONTROLLED ENVIRONMENT, AND THEN EXPANDING TO REALWORLDPROCESSING CONDITIONS. THE FORMER WILL UTILIZE A RECENTLY DEVELOPED RHEO-RAMAN MICROSCOPE, ENABLINGSIMULTANEOUS MEASUREMENT OF RHEOLOGICAL PROPERTIES AND CRYSTALLIZATION VIA RAMAN SPECTROSCOPY AND OPTICALMICROSCOPY, ALONG WITH A LINKAM SHEAR CELL COUPLED TO A POLARIZED OPTICAL MICROSCOPE FOR DIRECT OBSERVATION OFBLEND MORPHOLOGY. THE RESEARCH WILL FOCUS ON THE EFFECT OF SHEAR RATE ON THE CRYSTALLIZATION BEHAVIOR IN THESE BLENDEDMELTS AND THE KINETICS OF FLOW-INDUCED CRYSTALLIZATION ON EACH BLEND COMPONENT. THE SECOND PART WILL UTILIZE MATERIALEXTRUSION ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING AS A PROCESSING TOOL TO FURTHER UNDERSTAND CRYSTALLIZATION EVENTS IN MULTICOMPONENTBLENDS. USING IN SITU RAMAN SPECTROSCOPY DURING THE PRINTING PROCESS, THEY WILL MEASURE EFFECTS OF NOZZLETEMPERATURE AND SHEAR RATE ON THE CRYSTALLINITY AND CRYSTALLIZATION KINETICS IN THE BLEND COMPONENTS. THIS WILL ALLOWFOR CORRELATIONS BETWEEN PROCESSING CONDITIONS AND ULTIMATE MATERIAL PROPERTIES, PROVIDING THE KNOWLEDGE TO IMPROVEMECHANICAL PROPERTIES AND FURTHERING THE USABILITY OF RECYCLED POLYMER BLENDS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MML HAS A CRITICAL PROGRAM IN THE AREA OF CIRCULAR ECONOMY, AND THE FIRST PRIORITY WITHIN THIS PROGRAM IS PLASTICSCIRCULARITY. MORE SPECIFICALLY THERE IS A FOCUS ON PLASTICS RECYCLING. THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO DEAL WITH ONE OF THETHORNIEST AREAS OF PLASTICS RECYCLING, NAMELY THE RECYCLING OF MIXED POLYOLEFIN BLENDS WHERE POOR FINAL MECHANICALPROPERTIES LIMIT APPLICATIONS. THE PROPOSAL AIMS TO SHED IMPORTANT LIGHT ON THE PROCESSING-MORPHOLOGY-PROPERTYRELATIONSHIPS IN SUCH MATERIAL, WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON HOW CRYSTALLIZATION OCCURS DURING PROCESSING. THE EXPECTEDOUTCOME OF THIS WORK IS AN UNDERSTANDING OF HOW SHEAR AND PROCESSING AFFECTS THE CRYSTALLIZATION PROCESS IN TWOCOMPONENTIMMISCIBLE BLENDS. DATA WILL BE GENERATED RELATING THE INCOMING MATERIAL PROPERTIES (E.G. MOLAR MASSDISTRIBUTION, COMPLEX VISCOSITIES, COMPOSITION INCLUDING COMPATIBILIZERS, VISCOSITY, THERMAL PROPERTIES) WILL BECOMBINED WITH PROCESSING DATA (TEMPERATURE, SCREW TYPE AND SPEED), AND FINAL PROTOCOLS (SHEAR AND TEMPERATURE PROTOCOLS) TO MEASURE THE CRYSTALLIZATION KINETICS. THIS DATA WILL BE COMPARED TO THEORETICAL MODELS UNDERDEVELOPMENT BOTH WITHIN NIST AND WITH EXTERNAL COLLABORATORS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE DATA, THE MEASUREMENT METHODS AND THE CONCEPTS GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THECOMMUNITY OF ENGINEERS AND RESEARCHERS WORKING TO MORE EFFICIENTLY PROCESS PLASTIC WASTE VIA MECHANICAL RECYCLING.AS THE DATA, METHODS AND CONCEPTS ARE ADOPTED, IT WILL BENEFIT MUNICIPAL RECYCLING FACILITIES, AS WELL AS THE GENERALPUBLIC, BY INCREASING THE RECYCLING RATES, AND REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF PLASTIC THAT ENDS UP IN LANDFILLS OR ENDS UP ASPOLLUTION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: TO DEVELOP A PLATFORM FOR MANUFACTURING MINIATURE ATOMIC VAPOR CELLS COMPATIBLE WITH CMOS AND INTEGRATED PHOTONIC ELEMENTS AND DEMONSTRATE THEIR IMPLEMENTATION IN A PROTOTYPE DEVICE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP A NOVEL MICROFABRICATION PROCESS TO ENABLE THE ENCAPSULATION OF ATOMIC VAPORS INSIDE GLASS CAVITIES. THESE CAVITIES WOULD BE COMPATIBLE WITH THE SEMICONDUCTOR PROCESSES USED TO BUILD CMOS ELECTRONICS AND PHOTONIC INTEGRATED CIRCUITS. WE WILL IMPLEMENT A WAFER BONDING PROCESS INVOLVING A TRIPLE STACK OF WAFERS. THE MIDDLE WAFER WOULD BE PATTERNED USING ETCHING TECHNOLOGIES SUCH AS DRIE AND LASER ETCHING. THE OPTICAL CHARACTERIZATION OF THE VAPOR CELLS WILL BE CONDUCTED AT NIST (BOULDER).EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A NOVEL METHODOLOGY TO FABRICATE SCALABLE DIELECTRIC VAPOR CELLS WITH MULTIPLE GEOMETRIES INCORPORATING ONLY DIELECTRIC MATERIALS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY DEVELOPING ROOM TEMPERATURE QUANTUM SENSORS WITH RYDBERG ATOMS. THE POSSIBILITY OF HAVING ACCESS TO RELIABLE FABRICATION OF ATOMIC VAPOR CELLS WOULD DIRECTLY IMPACT A BROAD RANGE OF APPLICATIONS, SUCH AS MAGNETOMETERS, QUANTUM ANTENNAS, TIMING, AND LENGTH AND ROTATION SENSING. MOREOVER, INTEGRATING PHOTONICS AND ELECTRONICS ELEMENTS WITH QUANTUM VAPOR CELLS WOULD PROVIDE A PATH TOWARD LOW-COST MANUFACTURING OF QUANTUM-BASED SENSORS ENABLING SELF-CALIBRATING SYSTEMS WITH ZERO-CHAIN TRACEABILITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MEASURE NANOSCALE HETEROGENEITIES IN EPOXY CHEMISTRY NEAR A SOLID SILICA SURFACE USING SCANNING TRANSMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPY (STEM) AND RESONANT SOFT X-RAY SCATTERING (RSOXS). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: SAMPLES WILL BE FABRICATED THAT ARE CROSS-COMPATIBLE WITH THE STEM AND RSOXS MEASUREMENT REQUIREMENTS. THE SAMPLES WILL BE THIN FILMS OF EPOXY CONTAINING 80 NM DIAMETER SILICA NANOPARTICLES. VARIATIONS IN EPOXY STOICHIOMETRY AND TIME / TEMPERATURE OF CURE WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP A SAMPLE LIBRARY. THE SAMPLES WILL BE MEASURED WITH STEM AND WITH RSOXS. THE STEM RESULTS WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP MODELS FOR SIMULATING RSOXS PATTERNS. COMPARISONS OF HETEROGENEITIES IN EPOXY CHEMISTRY WILL BE MADE ACROSS THE TECHNIQUES AND ACROSS THE SAMPLE LIBRARY. MANUSCRIPTS WILL BE WRITTEN AND SUBMITTED FOR PUBLICATION IN PEER-REVIEW JOURNALS DESCRIBING THE RESULTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A QUANTITATIVE DESCRIPTION OF CHEMICAL HETEROGENEITY AT THE EPOXY-SILICA INTERFACE, AND INFORMATION ON HOW THAT HETEROGENEITY VARIES WITH FORMULATION AND CURE PROCESS CHOICES. SUCH OUTCOMES WOULD FORM SCIENCE-BASED GUIDELINES FOR EPOXY CURING THAT ARE BASED ON HIGHLY SPATIALLY RESOLVED CHEMISTRY MEASUREMENTS USING THESE TWO TECHNIQUES. THE RESULTS WOULD ALSO ADVANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND APPLICATION OF THE RSOXS TECHNIQUE WHICH HAS RECEIVED SIGNIFICANT INVESTMENT AT NIST DUE TO ITS UNIQUE CAPABILITY TO MEASURE MOLECULAR ORIENTATION AT THE NANOSCALE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THESE GUIDELINES WOULD ACCELERATE COMPOSITE PROCESS DEVELOPMENT AND COMPOSITE MATERIAL DEPLOYMENT IN INDUSTRIES WHERE COMPOSITES ARE ROUTINELY DEVELOPED AND USED, INCLUDING AEROSPACE, AUTOMOTIVE, AND CIVIL ENGINEERING APPLICATIONS. THE FRAMEWORK COULD GUIDE NANOSCALE MEASUREMENTS ACROSS A RANGE OF FIELDS INCLUDING OTHER NANOCOMPOSITES, SEMICRYSTALLINE COMMODITY PLASTICS, AND BIOMATERIALS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP, TEST, AND DEPLOY ADVANCED DATA ANALYTICS FOR THE MONITORING OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES AND ASSESSMENT OF MANUFACTURED PRODUCT QUALITY. SPECIFICALLY, THE RESEARCH FOCUSES ON DEVELOPING ADVANCED DATA-DRIVEN, MACHINE LEARNING METHODS FOR THE CHARACTERIZATION OF MELT POOLS AND X-RAY SCAN DATA ASSOCIATED WITH POWDER BED FUSION PROCESS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A NOVEL DEEP LEARNING BASED FRAMEWORK FOR SPATIALLY REGISTERING MELT POOL IMAGES WITH THE XCT SCANNING DATA, AND PROVIDE A QUANTITATIVE CHARACTERIZATION OF THE PART QUALITY USING BOTH DATA SOURCES BY LEVERAGING THE DATA REGISTRY ALREADY IMPLEMENTED IN NIST. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH INCLUDES THREE FUNDAMENTAL TASKS. DEVELOP A DEEP LEARNING BASED DATA REGISTRATION BETWEEN MELT POOL AND XCT DATA; DEVELOP PART QUALITY CHARACTERIZATION USING MELT POOL AND XCT DATA; VALIDATE APPROACH USING NIST ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING TESTBED AND DATASET.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A NOVEL DEEP LEARNING BASED FRAMEWORK FOR SPATIALLY REGISTERING MELT POOL IMAGES WITH THE XCT SCANNING DATA, AND PROVIDE A QUANTITATIVE CHARACTERIZATION OF THE PART QUALITY USING BOTH DATA SOURCES. THIS WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF STANDARD REPRESENTATION OF PREDICTIVE MODEL WILL BE USED BY MANUFACTURERS TO IMPROVE PRODUCTION PROCESSES AND PRODUCT RELIABILITY. FURTHERMORE, THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENTS WILL BE PUBLISHED AND MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE. COLLABORATION WITH RESEARCHERS AT NIST AND INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS WILL ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW MACHINE LEARNING MODELS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM BEING ABLE TO PROCESS DATA COLLECTED DURING PRODUCTION OPERATIONS TO IDENTIFY AND INVESTIGATE POTENTIAL EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP, TEST, AND DEPLOY ADVANCED DATA ANALYTICS FOR THE MONITORING OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES AND ASSESSMENT OF MANUFACTURED PRODUCT QUALITY. SPECIFICALLY, THE RESEARCH FOCUSES ON DEVELOPING ADVANCED DATA-DRIVEN, MACHINE LEARNING METHODS FOR THE CHARACTERIZATION OF MELT POOLS AND X-RAY SCAN DATA ASSOCIATED WITH POWDER BED FUSION PROCESS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED EFFORT WILL DEVELOP PREDICTIVE MODELS FOR THE POWDER BED FUSION ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESS. THREE TASKS ARE PROPOSED: (1) DEVELOP AN INFORMATION FUSION PROCESS FOR ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING DATA, (2) MODEL ASSESSMENT AND ERROR QUANTIFICATION, AND (3) UNCERTAINTY AGGREGATION AND EXTRAPOLATION TO THE TARGET PRINTING CONFIGURATION AND PRODUCT. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED IN CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH NIST PERSONNEL, INDUSTRY AND TRADE ORGANIZATIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND TEST PREDICTIVE MODELS FOR ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES. THIS WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF STANDARD REPRESENTATION OF PREDICTIVE MODEL WILL BE USED BY MANUFACTURERS TO IMPROVE PRODUCTION PROCESSES AND PRODUCT RELIABILITY. FURTHERMORE, THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENTS WILL BE PUBLISHED AND MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE. COLLABORATION WITH RESEARCHERS AT NIST AND INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS WILL ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW MACHINE LEARNING MODELS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM BEING ABLE TO PROCESS DATA COLLECTED DURING PRODUCTION OPERATIONS TO IDENTIFY AND INVESTIGATE POTENTIAL EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO CREATE, VALIDATE, AND IMPLEMENT A THERMAL ERROR COMPENSATION METHOD FOR MACHINE TOOLS THAT CAN QUICKLY (I.E., WITH FIVE MINUTES) MEASURE THERMAL-INDUCED MACHINE TOOL DEFORMATION AND POPULATE COMPENSATION TABLES TO CORRECT FOR THE GEOMETRIC ERRORS CAUSED BY THIS DEFORMATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS WORK WILL CREATE A QUICK THERMAL ERROR COMPENSATION METHODOLOGY THAT WILL CONSIST OF THREE COMPONENTS: QUICK MEASUREMENT. QUICK MEASUREMENTS USING AN OPTICAL CAMERA MOUNTED IN THE SPINDLE OF VARIOUS LOCATIONS ON THE MACHINE TOOL, THERMAL DEFORMATION MODELS BASED ON FINITE ELEMENT ANALYSIS TO PROVIDE AN ESTIMATE OF STRUCTURAL ESTIMATION FIELDS, AND THE POPULATION OF MACHINE TOOL COMPENSATION TABLES BASED ON THE MEASUREMENTS AND MODELS. THE THERMAL ERROR COMPENSATION METHODOLOGY WILL BE VALIDATED IN A LABORATORY SETTING AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IN INDUSTRIAL SETTINGS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: REDUCTION IN THERMALLY INDUCE MACHINE TOOL ERRORS WILL ENABLE THE U.S. MANUFACTURING BASE TO BE MORE COMPETITIVE BY INCREASING OPERATION PRODUCTIVITY AND ENABLING HIGHER QUALITY PART.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE TO THE PUBLIC BECAUSE IT WILL CREATE A RELATIVELY INEXPENSIVE THERMAL ERROR COMPENSATION METHOD TO SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE MACHINING ERRORS CAUSED BY THE THERMALLY INDUCED STRUCTURAL DEFORMATIONS. REDUCTION IN THESE ERRORS WILL ENABLE THE U.S. MANUFACTURING BASE TO FULLY UTILIZE THEIR EQUIPMENT AND INCREASE PROCESS REPEATABILITY, THEREBY INCREASING OPERATION PRODUCTIVITY AND MANUFACTURING COMPETITIVENESS. THERE WILL ALSO BE AN IMPORTANT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT COMPONENT TO THE PROJECT THROUGH THE TRAINING OF A GRADUATE STUDENT ASSISTANT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RESEARCH, DEVELOP, AND PUBLISH METHODS AND DESIGNS FOR THE MEASUREMENT OF ULTRA-LOW, SINGLE DEFECT LEVEL CAPACITANCES, CHARGE PUMPING OF TRANSISTORS, AND FOR THE TESTING OF RANDOM NUMBER GENERATION FROM STOCHASTIC NANODEVICES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THREE DIFFERENT CLASSES OF ELECTRONIC MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS WILL BE BUILT. FIRST ARE INTEGRATED VOLTAGE CONTROLLED OSCILLATORS FOR HIGH FREQUENCY CAPACITANCE-VOLTAGE MEASUREMENTS OF INTEGRATED CIRCUITS. SECOND IS A SIMILAR SET OF OSCILLATORS, BUT THIS CIRCUITRY WILL BE SPECIFICALLY BUILT FOR CHARGE PUMPING. THE FIRST VERSIONS WILL BE DESIGNED WITH A SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON DEVELOPING A QUANTUM CURRENT STANDARD IN SILICON. SUBSEQUENT VERSIONS WILL BE DEVELOPED TO FOCUS ON THIN FILM TRANSISTORS IN THE BACK END OF LINE. THE FINAL CIRCUIT IS TEST STRUCTURES FOR DOING RANDOM NUMBER GENERATION FROM NANOELECTRONIC DEVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECT OUTCOMES OF THIS RESEARCH ARE DESIGNS FOR AND THE TAPING OUT OF SEMICONDUCTOR CHIPS SPECIFICALLY FOR MONOLITHIC INTEGRATION WITH NANOELECTRONIC DEVICES AND HAVING THEM BE MEASURABLE WITH CV MEASUREMENTS, CHARGE PUMPING, AND DIGITIZATION INTO BIT STREAMS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE, FIRSTLY, NIST RESEARCHERS WHO ARE ABLE TO EMPLOY THESE CIRCUITS IN THEIR EXPERIMENTS, ESPECIALLY EXPERIMENTS RELATED TO CHARGE PUMPING.
