ON CHIP CHARGE PUMP SOURCES WILL ENABLE A 1,000X INCREASE IN PERFORMANCE. SECONDLY, BENEFICIARIES ARE OTHER RESEARCHERS WHO WOULD LIKEWISE LIKE TO USE THE DESIGNED SYSTEMS/CIRCUITS TO ENHANCE THEIR METROLOGY OF DEVICES. FINALLY, INDUSTRIAL RESEARCHERS AND PARTNERS WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO USE CIRCUITS SUCH AS THESE FOR ENHANCED MEASUREMENT. SINCE THE RESEARCHERS INTEND TO OPEN SOURCE THE DESIGNS AND STORE THEM ON GITHUB, THEY WILL BE GENERALLY AVAILABLE.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE AIM OF THIS ONE-YEAR FEASIBILITY STUDY IS TO SHOW THAT IT IS POSSIBLE TO DEVELOP AND RUN AN MPM (MATERIAL POINT METHOD) MODEL OF THE UINTAH SOFTWARE FOR ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING. THIS FEASIBILITY STUDY PROVIDES A START TOWARDS THE GOAL OF USING THE NIST HEDGEHOG SOFTWARE AS THE COMPUTE ENGINE FOR VERY RAPID ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING SIMULATIONS ON MULTIPLE GPUS OF DIFFERENT TYPES, WITH THE AIM OF PROVIDING A COMPARISON BOTH AT PARTICLE FINE SCALE AND OBJECT-SHAPE COARSE SCALE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY A GRADUATE STUDENT WHO HAS A BACKGROUND IN MECHANICAL ENGINEERING, COMPUTER SCIENCE, AND SIMULATION. A PROTOTYPE UINTAH APPLICATION WILL BE DEVELOPED THAT WILL SHOW IF IT IS POSSIBLE TO ACCURATELY MODEL AND SIMULATE THERMO-MECHANICAL PROCESSES AND RELEVANT PHENOMENA IN THE CONTEXT OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING USING THE MATERIAL POINT METHOD.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSED WORK WILL HELP ADVANCE THE STATE OF THE ART IN ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING BY ENABLING HIGH-PERFORMANCE COMPUTING SIMULATION OF THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS THROUGH THE USE OF PARALLEL COMPUTATIONS ON SMALL CLUSTERS OF COMPUTERS. THE GENERAL OUTCOMES INCLUDE GRADUATE STUDENT EDUCATION, DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION VIA PUBLICATIONS, PRESENTATIONS, AND SOFTWARE WITH BENEFITS FOR THE BROADER COMMUNITIES OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, MODELING AND SIMULATION AND RUNTIME SYSTEMS FOR INTERACTIVE STEERING, CONTROL, AND SIMULATION OF DATA-RICH APPLICATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE GENERAL COMPUTER SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING AUDIENCES AND BY EXTENSION ANY DOMAIN WHERE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING IS USED WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS DEMONSTRATION OF NOVEL REAL TIME PARALLEL COMPUTATIONAL ANALYSIS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO DEVELOP INFORMATIONAL AND TECHNICAL RESOURCES FOR STATE UTILITY REGULATORS ON SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION, CYBERSECURITY, AND RELATED TOPICS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH PLAN INCLUDES THREE TASKS DEVELOPING PUBLICLY AVAILABLE LEARNING MODULES ON INTEROPERABILITY AND CYBERSECURITY CONCEPTS, DEVELOPING A POLICY BRIEF ON PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION (PUC) APPROACHES TO SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY AND/OR CYBERSECURITY, AND PROVIDING STATE UTILITY REGULATORS? PARTICIPATION IN TECHNICAL WORKING GROUPS AND RELATED EVENTS. THE PLANNED DEVELOPMENT OF LEARNING MODULES AND POLICY BRIEFS ON INTEROPERABILITY, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION, AND CYBERSECURITY DESIGNED FOR STATE REGULATORS IS OF CRITICAL IMPORTANCE AS REGULATORS OVERSEE THE DEPLOYMENT OF SMART GRID TECHNOLOGIES BY UTILITIES. THE RESEARCH ADDRESSES ANOTHER IMPORTANT INFORMATION DISSEMINATION GOAL BY ENABLING REGULATORS AND STAFF TO PARTICIPATE IN TECHNICAL WORKING GROUPS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSED OUTPUTS OF THIS PROJECT SUCH AS LEARNING MODULES AND POLICY BRIEFS WILL HAVE IMPACT ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION, AND CYBERSECURITY. THE PROPOSED TASKS CAN GENERATE USEFUL INFORMATION TO INFORM STATE PUCS AS WELL AS OTHER POLICY AND REGULATION STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT THE STATE OF TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT, INCLUDING INTEROPERABILITY, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION, AND CYBERSECURITY CHALLENGES AND SOLUTIONS. THROUGH THE PROPOSED LEARNING MODULES AND POLICY BRIEFS, STATE REGULATORS AND STAFF WILL HAVE ACCESS TO TECHNICAL RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT THEIR INDEPENDENT ANALYSES OF SMART GRID DEPLOYMENTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE USEFUL INFORMATION TO STATE PUCS AS WELL AS OTHER POLICY AND REGULATION STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT THE STATE OF TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT AND DEPLOYMENT, INCLUDING INTEROPERABILITY, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION, AND CYBERSECURITY CHALLENGES AND SOLUTIONS. NARUC MEMBERS OVERSEE THE PLANNING, SITING, AND DEPLOYMENT OF ENERGY RESOURCES, MANAGE ENERGY MARKETS, CREATE INCENTIVES, AND APPROVE THE COST RECOVERY OF UTILITY INVESTMENTS. THROUGH THE PROPOSED LEARNING MODULES AND POLICY BRIEFS, STATE REGULATORS AND STAFF WILL HAVE ACCESS TO TECHNICAL RESOURCES THAT SUPPORT THEIR INDEPENDENT ANALYSES OF SMART GRID DEPLOYMENTS. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE NARUC TO CONTINUE PROVIDING STATE PUCS WITH INFORMATION ABOUT TRANSFORMATIVE TECHNOLOGIES TO HELP SHAPE THE STANDARDS, METRICS, AND PROGRAMS THAT DETERMINE HOW THEY WILL BE DEPLOYED, WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY AID WITH MODERNIZING THE ELECTRIC GRID WHILE MAINTAINING RELIABLE SERVICE.  THIS WILL MORE INFORMED DECISION MAKING FROM PUBLIC COMMISSIONS THAT COULD ENHANCE BENEFIT REALIZED FROM PUBLIC SMART GRID INVESTMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO SUPPORT TECHNICAL REVIEW OF MATERIALS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A SOFTWARE TOOLS FOR CO-SIMULATION OF FACTORY PROCESSES WITH INDUSTRIAL WIRELESS NETWORKS THAT LEVERAGE MEASUREMENT DATA TAKEN FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THE PROPOSED WORK INCLUDE THE 1) THE CONTINUATION OF DEVELOPMENT OF THE EPAIS SOFTWARE TOOL USED FOR CO-SIMULATION OF THE PHYSICAL AND WIRELESS ENVIRONMENTS TAKING INTO ACCOUNT ONE OF THE NIST INDUSTRIAL WIRELESS TESTBED SCENARIOS, 2) THE INCORPORATION OF WIRELESS INDUSTRIAL CHANNEL SELECTION WHILE TAKING INTO ACCOUNT DATA FROM ELECTROMAGNETIC RAY TRACING TOOLS, AND 3) THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE SOFTWARE TOOL THROUGH SOFTWARE REPOSITORIES AND CONFERENCE VENUES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY INCORPORATING RAY TRACING INTO THE CO-SIMULATION FRAMEWORK, USERS WILL BE ABLE TO SELECT MULTI-PATH CHANNEL TYPES MORE ACCURATELY FOR A GIVEN TIME STEP AND LOCATION OF A WIRELESS DEVICE WITHIN THE SIMULATED ENVIRONMENT. BY MIRRORING THE NIST TESTBED, THE SIMULATION TOOL MAY SERVE AS A DIGITAL TWIN OF THE PHYSICAL TESTBED.  SOCIALIZATION OF THE SIMULATION TOOL THROUGH CONFERENCES AND OTHER VENUES WILL ALSO RESULT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFIT OF THE EPAIS SIMULATION TOOL IS TO PROVIDE RESEARCHERS AND INDUSTRY A TOOL THAT MAY BE USED TO VALIDATE THEIR WIRELESS NETWORK DESIGNS FOR GIVEN INDUSTRIAL SCENARIOS OR SERVE AS A PLATFORM FOR ADVANCED ENGINEERING RESEARCH IN THE AREA OF INDUSTRIAL WIRELESS NETWORKING. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO ADDRESS THE CONTROL CHALLENGE ASSOCIATED WITH THE INTEGRATION OF DISTRIBUTED ENERGY RESOURCES (DERS) TO THE ELECTRIC GRID DUE TO THE INTERMITTENT NATURE OF DERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH FOCUSES ON AN IMPORTANT CONTROL CHALLENGE ASSOCIATED WITH THE INTEGRATION OF DERS TO THE ELECTRIC GRID DUE TO THEIR INTERMITTENT NATURE. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH PLAN IS TO APPLY TIME-VARYING CONSTRAINTS AND UNCERTAINTIES TO CREATE CONTROL STRATEGIES FOR DER THAT ENSURE RELIABLE ELECTRIC GRID OPERATIONS. THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS TO DETERMINE HOW DIFFERENT SOURCES OF GRID UNCERTAINTIES WILL AFFECT THE CONTROL STRATEGIES AND LEAD TO IMPROVED DER CONTROLLER DESIGN.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH IF SUCCESSFUL CAN PROVIDE USEFUL INPUTS FOR THE INDUSTRY ON HOW DIFFERENT UNCERTAINTIES CAN AFFECT DER CONTROLLER DESIGN.  THE OUTCOME OF THE PROPOSED WORK CAN HAVE POTENTIAL APPLICATION BEYOND THE ELECTRIC GRID. THE CONTROL TECHNIQUE COULD BE APPLICABLE FOR OTHER CYBER-PHYSICAL SYSTEMS THAT INCLUDE DISTRIBUTED DEVICES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TECHNOLOGIES THAT ARE DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS PROJECT COULD BE APPLIED TO DEVELOPMENT AND PUBLICATION OF CONTROL STRATEGIES TO ENHANCE THE OPERATION AND INTEGRATION OF DERS THAT CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVING RELIABILITY AND RESILIENCY IN THE NATION?S ELECTRIC GRID INFRASTRUCTURE. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH CAN PROVIDE USEFUL INPUTS FOR THE INDUSTRY ON HOW DIFFERENT UNCERTAINTIES CAN AFFECT DER CONTROLLER DESIGN. THE OUTCOME OF THE PROPOSED WORK CAN HAVE POTENTIAL APPLICATION BEYOND THE ELECTRIC GRID. THE CONTROL TECHNIQUE COULD BE APPLICABLE FOR OTHER CYBER-PHYSICAL SYSTEMS THAT INCLUDE DISTRIBUTED DEVICES. FURTHER, THIS WORK COULD CONTRIBUTE TO ADDITIONAL CAPACITY FOR DERS IN THE GRID BY ENABLING EFFECTIVE CONTROL AND UTILIZATION OF THESE ASSETS BY UTILITIES.  THIS COULD ENABLE THE CONSUMER TO REAP GREATER BENEFIT AND VALUE FROM THEIR DERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE USE OF A MICROFLUIDIC PLATFORM WITH ELECTRONIC MANIPULATION AND MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES FOR THE DETERMINATION OF CELL MIGRATION RATES IN CANCER CELLS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHER WILL DESIGN, FABRICATE, AND TEST MICROFLUIDIC DEVICES WITH INTEGRATED METALIZED POROUS POLYESTER (PET) MEMBRANES FOR DIELECTROPHORETIC (DEP) TRAPPING AND IMPEDANCE MEASUREMENTS OF CELLS ON BOTH SIDES OF THE PET MEMBRANE. THE RESEARCHER WILL TROUBLESHOOT ALL THE ASPECTS OF THE FABRICATION AND ASSEMBLY OF THE DEVICES AS WELL AS THE ELECTRICAL TOOLS USE TO CARRY OUT THE MEASUREMENTS TO OBTAIN THE OPTIMAL CONDITIONS FOR THE MEASUREMENTS OF CELL BEHAVIOR UNDER CONTROL AND PERTURBATION CONDITIONS.  THE DATA OBTAINED WILL BE ANALYZED AND REPORTS WILL BE WRITTEN TO BE PRESENTED AT CONFERENCES AND SUBMITTED FOR PUBLICATION IN PEER-REVIEW JOURNALS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHER WILL DEVELOP THE REQUIRE METHODOLOGY TO DEPOSIT GOLD ON PET MEMBRANES THAT WILL SERVE AS THE ELECTRODES TO CARRY OUT DEP AND TO TAKE IMPEDANCE MEASUREMENTS OF THE CELLS WITHIN THE MICROFLUIDIC CHANNELS.  METHODS TO ASSEMBLE THE DEVICES WILL ALSO BE DEVELOPED IN ORDER TO OBTAIN ROBUST BONDING BETWEEN THE SUBSTRATES CONTAINING THE MICROCHANNELS AND THE PET MEMBRANE.  CELL MIGRATION ASSAYS WILL BE ESTABLISHED TO DETERMINE THE MIGRATION RATES OF CANCER CELLS WITH DIFFERENCES IN MIGRATION ABILITY.  THE DEVICES AND THE DATA OBTAINED FROM THEM ARE EXPECTED TO PROVIDE NEW INSIGHTS OF THE DIFFERENCES IN CELL MIGRATION OF THE DIFFERENT CELLS IN A TUMOR.  AT LEAST ONE PRESENTATION PER YEAR AND ONE JOURNAL PEER-REVIEW ARTICLE ARE EXPECTED AT THE END OF EACH YEAR.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PLATFORM THAT WILL BE DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO, ULTIMATELY, BE USED IN R&D LABS IN BIOPHARMACEUTICAL COMPANIES FOR TOXICOLOGY AND DRUG SCREENING, SPECIFICALLY IN PRECLINICAL IN VITRO TESTING.  ALSO, THIS PLATFORM WILL BENEFIT RESEARCHERS IN THE ACADEMIA AND OTHER RESEARCH FACILITIES BY PROVIDING A QUANTITATIVE APPROACH TO MEASURE CONTINUOUSLY AND IN REAL-TIME MIGRATION OF CANCER CELLS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO DEVELOP A SIMULATION OF RESIDENTIAL ENERGY USE INTEGRATING INFRASTRUCTURE, CONSUMER, DISTRIBUTED GENERATION, AND RESPONSIVE PRICING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH PLAN INCLUDES TWO TASKS SCALABLE CO-SIMULATION AND ENERGY FAIRNESS. THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL INVESTIGATE THE EFFECTS OF RESIDENTIAL HVAC CONTROL ALGORITHMS ON ENERGY USAGE AND CONSUMER SATISFACTION. ADDITIONALLY, THE TEAM WILL INVESTIGATE FAIRNESS OF ENERGY DISTRIBUTION AND CONSUMPTION ACROSS DIFFERENT HOUSEHOLD INCOME LEVELS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL HELP ENABLE THE USE OF RESIDENTIAL ENERGY-SAVING DEVICES, NOT JUST THROUGH DEMONSTRATION OF THE VALUE OF THESE DEVICES, BUT ALSO IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TOOL AND METHODOLOGY FOR VERIFYING SUCH PROJECTS.  IT WILL PROVIDE AN EXPERIMENTAL PLATFORM TO VALIDATE VARIOUS DATA-DRIVEN MODELS TO SAVE ENERGY ACROSS THE BUILDINGS SECTOR. THE RESULTS CAN PROVIDE BETTER GUIDANCE FOR THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY TO FURTHER OPTIMIZE CONTROL OF BUILDING ENERGY CONSUMPTION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH WILL HELP TO ADDRESS ENERGY SAVINGS POTENTIAL IN BUILDINGS.  THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MODELS AND ALGORITHMS FOR VERIFYING BUILDING ENERGY SAVINGS, WHICH IS AN IMPORTANT ISSUE IN DATA DRIVEN CONTROL APPROACHES. IT WILL EXPEDITE THE DEVELOPMENT OF ENERGY-SAVING DEVICES IN A RESIDENTIAL HOUSE BY PROVIDING A SIMULATION PLATFORM. IN ADDITION, IT COULD LEAD TO MORE RELIABLE CPS/INTERNET OF THINGS PRODUCTS FOR CONSUMERS INTERESTED IN NEW TECHNOLOGIES FOR ENERGY SAVINGS AND EFFICIENCY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUB AWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ADDRESS DEFICIENCIES IN THE CURRENT STANDARDS FOR GEOMETRY, TOPOLOGY, AND GEOMETRIC MODELLING VIA ACTIVE EFFORTS WITHIN THE INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION FOR STANDARDIZATION (ISO) STANDARDS CHANGE PROCESS. ISO 10303, INFORMALLY REFERRED TO AS "STEP" (STANDARD FOR THE EXCHANGE OF PRODUCT MODEL DATA), IS AN ISO STANDARD FOR THE DIGITAL EXCHANGE OF 3D OBJECTS IN COMPUTER-AIDED DESIGN (CAD), COMPUTER-AIDED ENGINEERING (CAE), AND COMPUTER-AIDED MANUFACTURING (CAM), AS WELL AS PRODUCT MANUFACTURING INFORMATION (PMI). ISO 10303 IS DEVELOPED AND MAINTAINED BY THE ISO TECHNICAL COMMITTEE TC184, AUTOMATION SYSTEMS, INTEGRATION, SUB-COMMITTEE SC4, AND INDUSTRIAL DATA. TO PROPERLY SERVE THE INDUSTRY, THE ISO 10303 STANDARD MUST BALANCE CONSISTENCY AND ROBUSTNESS WITH VITAL MODERNIZATION. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS AWARD FOCUSES ON GEOMETRIC AND TOPOLOGICAL ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ISO 10303 STANDARD. PLANNED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:-	LEAD ISO TC184 / SC4 / WG12 T1 GEOMETRY AND TOPOLOGY TEAM TECHNICAL WORK AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES.-	MODERNIZE ISO 10303-42 GEOMETRIC AND TOPOLOGICAL REPRESENTATION (PART 42):	REORGANIZE PART 42 AND ALIGN IT TO THEORY, ADD SUPPORT FOR HYBRID MODELING, AND MIGRATE CONTENT OF DEPRECATED PARTS OF ISO 10303 INTO PART 42.-	DEVELOP ISOGEOMETRIC ANALYSIS (IGA) SUPPORT IN ISO 10303EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPUTATIONAL ENGINEERING DESIGN, ANALYSIS, MANUFACTURING, AND INSPECTION ARE VITAL INDUSTRIAL TECHNOLOGIES UTILIZED BY FIELDS AS DIVERSE AS GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEERING AND BIOMECHANICS. THE EVER-CHANGING AND GROWING STATE-OF-THE-ART IN THIS FIELD REQUIRES UPDATES TO STANDARDS AND CODES CRITICAL FOR TRANSLATING, TRANSMITTING, AND STORING SUCH ELECTRONIC DATA IN A COMPLETE AND RELIABLE MANNER FOR ALL SUCH VARIED USERS. THE WORK PROPOSED HEREIN ALLOWS FOR ESSENTIAL DEVELOPMENTS IN THE INDUSTRIAL STANDARDS COMMUNITY THAT ARE CURRENTLY UNAVAILABLE, SUCH THAT THEY WILL BE REFLECTED AND ACCESSIBLE IN WELL VETTED, CODIFIED STANDARDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD ARE STANDARDS DEVELOPERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR'S EXPERTISE IN THE FIELDS OF DESIGN AND ENGINEERING, COMPUTER-AIDED DESIGN (CAD) AND COMPUTER-AIDED ENGINEERING (CAE), AND COMPUTATIONAL ANALYSIS. IMPLEMENTERS OF STEP WILL BENEFIT FROM THE HIGH QUALITY OF STANDARDS SPECIFICATIONS THEY ARE IMPLEMENTING AND TESTING. USERS OF CAD SOFTWARE WILL BENEFIT THROUGH INCREASINGLY CAPABLE COMMUNICATION OF INFORMATION BETWEEN CAD SYSTEMS AND TO DOWNSTREAM MANUFACTURING PROCESSES. SMALL TO MEDIUM SIZED MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM BEING ABLE TO PARTICIPATE IN DIGITAL SUPPLY CHAIN ECOSYSTEMS. ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE EXPANDED BASE OF SUPPLIERS, MORE CAPABLE DIGITAL MODELS, IMPROVED PRODUCT QUALITY. CONSUMERS WILL BENEFIT FROM LOWER-COST PRODUCTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS AWARD.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ADVANCE SEMANTIC INTERPRETATION OF DIGITAL ARTIFACTS COMMONLY USED IN PRODUCT DESIGN AND MANUFACTURING AND RELATED SOFTWARE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP ONTOLOGY OF DIGITAL ARTIFACTS FOR INDUSTRIAL APPLICATIONS DOMAIN. THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED BE GENERATING REFERENCE ONTOLOGIES FOR VARIOUS SUBDOMAINS OF INDUSTRIAL LANDSCAPE. IT HAS BEEN APPARENT THAT THERE IS A NEED TO PERFORM RESEARCH IN DOMAIN OF DIGITAL ARTIFACTS (OBJECTS) IN ORDER TO ESTABLISH FUNDAMENTAL CLASSES AND RELATION BETWEEN THOSE OBJECTS. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THOSE CLASSES AND RELATIONS AND ESTABLISH THEIR MAPPING TO ACTUAL ARTIFACTS PRESENT DURING ANY INDUSTRIAL PROCESS. THE APPROACH WILL BE BASED ON MODERN ONTOLOGY DEVELOPMENT PROCESS: IDENTIFICATION OF USE CASES, POSING COMPETENCY QUESTIONS, PROPOSING CLASSES AND RELATIONS USING NATURAL LANGUAGE DEFINITIONS AND THE CONVERSION OF THOSE INTO LOGIC LANGUAGES, SUCH AS OWL AND FOL. THIS WILL BE AN ITERATIVE PROCESS IN WHICH WE WILL TEST DEFINITIONS AGAINST USE CASES THAT INCLUDE PRODUCT DESIGN, PROCESS AND PRODUCTION PLANNING, AND SCHEDULING. VERIFICATION WITH SEVERAL SOFTWARE TOOLS WILL BE ALSO PART OF THE PROJECT.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THIS RESEARCH WILL RESULT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF ONTOLOGY DEFINITIONS OF DIGITAL ARTIFACTS AS REPRESENTATION OF FUTURE PRODUCTS. ONTOLOGY DEFINITIONS WILL INCLUDE ARTIFACTS THEMSELVES AND RELATIONS BETWEEN THOSE ARTIFACTS AS WELL AS RELATIONS BETWEEN DIGITAL ARTIFACTS AND FUTURE REAL ARTIFACTS THAT RESULT FROM PRODUCTION PROCESS WITH DIRECTION FROM DIGITAL ARTIFACTS. THE RESULTS OF THE PROJECT WILL BE PUBLISHED AT THE CONFERENCES AND JOURNALS IN THE AREA OF APPLIED ONTOLOGY, SEMANTIC WEB, AND KNOWLEDGE-BASED ENGINEERING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT U.S. MANUFACTURERS BY PROVIDING NEW ANALYTICAL METHODS TO ADVANCE SEMANTIC INTERPRETATION OF DIGITAL ARTIFACTS COMMONLY USED IN PRODUCT DESIGN AND MANUFACTURING AND RELATED SOFTWARE. THIS WORK IS RELEVANT FOR MOST INDUSTRIAL COMPANIES. THE RESULTS WILL ALSO PROVIDE MEANS FOR FURTHER REDUCTION IN SUPPLY CHAIN CYCLES BY FURTHER EXTENDING THEIR PRINCIPLES TO MEMBERS/COLLABORATORS IN SUPPLY CHAINS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A NEW AGRI-FOOD ONTOLOGY AND TRACEABILITY TOOL BASED ON MORE COMPREHENSIVE USE CASES AND TO UTILIZE DOMAIN EXPERTS IN VALIDATING AND EXTENDING THE ONTOLOGY AND THE TRACEABILITY TOOL. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ONE OF THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE DIVERSE DATASETS TO EXPERIMENTALLY VALIDATE THE NEW ONTOLOGY AND TRACEABILITY TOOL. MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EXTENDING THE SCT ONTOLOGY WITH MORE SPECIALIZED CLASSES SO THAT THE ONTOLOGY CAN COVER A WIDER RANGE OF TRACEABILITY USE CASES, CREATING FULLY AXIOMATIZED ONTOLOGY TO SUPPORT INFERENCE AND REASONING, CREATING A REUSABLE RO MODULE BASED ON THE CURRENT APPLICATION ONTOLOGY, AND VALIDATING THE DEVELOPED FRAMEWORK WITH THE PARTICIPATION OF DOMAIN EXPERTS BASED ON HETEROGENEOUS DATASETS.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THIS RESEARCH WILL RESULT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE IT COMPONENTS NECESSARY FOR ENABLING PRODUCT TRACEABILITY IN AGRI-FOOD SUPPLY CHAINS. THE FINDINGS CAN BE USED FOR ENHANCING THE INTELLIGENCE OF LOGISTICS AND TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMSINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US GRAIN PRODUCERS, PROCESSORS, SHIPPERS, AGRI-FOOD EQUIPMENT SUPPLIERS, AND ACADEMIC RESEARCHERS WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED PRODUCT TRACEABILITY METHODS AND EXPERIMENTAL DATA. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: FORENSIC FACIAL EXAMINERS RECEIVE EXTENSIVE TRAINING AT COMPARING IMAGES OF TWO FACES. WHEN COMPARING FACE IMAGES, FACIAL EXAMINERS DECIDE HOW LIKELY THE FACES IN THE IMAGES ARE THE SAME PERSON. THE RESULTS OF EXAMINERS? COMPARISONS CAN BE USED IN LEGAL PROCEEDINGS. A RECENT PAPER PUBLISHED RESULTS SHOWING THAT EXAMINERS ARE VERY ACCURATE, AND THEY HAVE PERFORMANCE SUPERIOR TO THE GENERAL POPULATION. FOR MOST OF THE COMPARISONS IN THE PAPER, THE RACE OF THE EXAMINER AND FACE WERE THE SAME. PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL MEASURE ACCURACY WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. FOR NUMEROUS APPLICATIONS, FACE RECOGNITION SYSTEMS REQUIRE HUMAN OVERSIGHT. PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE METHODS FOR COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES THAT INCREASE SYSTEM OVERSIGHT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE WITH NIST EFFORTS TO STUDY THE EFFECT OF CROSS RACE IN FACIAL COMPARISONS AND COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES FOR FACE RECOGNITION. FOR FORENSIC COMPARISONS, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL FIRST FOCUS ON FINDING TEST COMPARISONS THAT WILL BE CHALLENGING FOR FACIAL EXAMINERS. NEXT, THE TEAM WILL GIVE FACIAL EXAMINERS THE TEST COMPARISONS AND THE EXAMINERS WILL RETURN THEIR CONCLUSIONS TO THE TEAM. THE STARTING POINT FOR STUDYING COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES WILL BE THE FINDING THAT FUSING THE BEST HUMANS AND BEST ALGORITHMS PRODUCE DECISIONS THAT ARE BETTER THAN EITHER HUMAN OR ALGORITHM ALONE. THEN BASED ON THE PSYCHOLOGY AND THE DECISION-MAKING LITERATURE, THE PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE METHODS THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR IMPROVING ACCURACY AND OVERSIGHT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FOR FORENSIC SCIENCE, THIS RESEARCH WILL PRODUCE KNOWLEDGE OF FACIAL COMPARISONS WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. THE STUDIES ON COMBINING HUMANS AND ALGORITHMS WILL PRODUCE INSIGHT INTO CREATING EFFECTIVE OVERSIGHT OF SYSTEMS. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PRESENTED IN OPEN SCIENTIFIC FORUMS AND PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FORENSIC EXAMINERS, LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE LEGAL SYSTEM WILL BENEFIT FROM KNOWING THE ACCURACY OF COMPARISONS WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. THIS KNOWLEDGE WILL FACILITATE INVESTIGATORS, LAWYERS, AND JUDGES INTERPRETING THE RESULTS OF THESE FACIAL COMPARISONS. FORENSIC SCIENTISTS, PSYCHOLOGIST, AND NEUROSCIENTIST WILL HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF METHODS AND TECHNIQUES FOR MEASURING THE PERFORMANCE OF FORENSIC EXAMINERS. ENGINEERS, FORENSIC SCIENTISTS, AND PSYCHOLOGISTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ADDITIONAL INSIGHT INTO DESIGNING FACE RECOGNITION SYSTEMS THAT REQUIRE HUMAN OVERSIGHT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO FACILITATE AN INTEROPERABILITY STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT ECOSYSTEM TO SUPPORT A SMART AND SECURE ELECTRIC GRID BY CONVENING INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS TO COLLABORATE ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES, TESTING AND CERTIFICATION (T&C) PROGRAMS, AND CYBERSECURITY REQUIREMENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANTEE WILL CONTINUE THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES THAT SUPPORT GRID MODERNIZATION. THE INTEROPERABILITY PROFILE UNDER DEVELOPMENT IS FOCUSED ON ELECTRIC VEHICLE (EV) FLEET MANAGED CHARGING. THE GRANTEE WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT A TESTING AND CERTIFICATION WORKING GROUP, WHICH INCLUDES DEVELOPMENT OF INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES AND A CATALOG OF TEST PROGRAMS. THE TECHNICAL APPROACH TO SUPPORTING TESTING AND CERTIFICATION FOR GREATER INTEROPERABILITY INCLUDES EXPLAINING THE IMPORTANCE AND VALUE OF T&C, TRACKING ISSUES RELATED TO T&C, AND PROVIDING FEEDBACK ON T&C TO OTHER WORKING GROUPS. THE GRANTEE WILL ADDRESS AND MANAGE CYBERSECURITY RISKS BY DEVELOPING GUIDELINES AND BEST PRACTICES FOR SECURING PRIORITY INTERFACES. ADDITIONALLY, THE GRANTEE WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT AND ADD NEW ENTRIES TO THE CATALOG OF STANDARDS AND CATALOG OF TEST PROGRAMS. THESE CATALOGS PROVIDE IMPORTANT RESOURCE FOR USE BY INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS IN ADOPTING STANDARDS AND TEST PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT THEIR REQUIREMENTS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESULTS OF THE RESEARCH PLAN COULD HELP ACCELERATE THE INDUSTRY?S ADOPTION OF SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY AND CYBERSECURITY STANDARDS. THROUGH SEPA BROAD INDUSTRY MEMBERSHIP AND INDUSTRY ENGAGEMENT, THERE IS POTENTIAL TO PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS TO STAKEHOLDERS IN ENABLING INTEROPERABILITY AND CYBERSECURITY THROUGH TESTING, STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT, AND CONTINUOUS INDUSTRY INNOVATION. THE TECHNICAL WORK PLAN LEVERAGES THE EXPERTISE OF THE APPLICANT?S INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS. THE WORK ON THE CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES FOR SMART GRID MODERNIZATION IS ALSO EXPECTED TO ACCELERATE ADOPTION OF INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES BY THE INDUSTRY. THE FOCUS ON EV FLEET MANAGED CHARGING IS TIMELY AS THE ADOPTION OF EV IS ACCELERATING. THE GRANTEE?S PLAN TO CONVENE AND SUPPORT THE TESTING AND CERTIFICATION WORKING GROUP AND CYBERSECURITY WORKING GROUP WILL HAVE A POSITIVE IMPACT ON THE INDUSTRY ADOPTION OF THE SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY AND CYBERSECURITY STANDARDS. THE ONGOING EFFORT TO HOST AND EXTEND THE CATALOG OF STANDARDS AND CATALOG OF TEST PROGRAMS PROVIDES A CONVENIENT SOURCE OF INFORMATION AS TO WHICH STANDARDS ARE ADOPTED BY ELECTRIC INDUSTRY TEST PROGRAMS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE THE ACCELERATION AND HARMONIZATION OF SMART GRID INTEROPERABILITY STANDARDS, ENABLING THE DEPLOYMENT OF A SMART GRID IN A TIMELY WAY TO ENSURE A RELIABLE AND SECURE ELECTRIC GRID.  THE TECHNICAL WORK ON INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES WILL LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF ADDITIONAL TESTING AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS FOR SMART GRID STANDARDS THAT CAN HELP IMPROVE INTEROPERABILITY OF SMART GRID DEVICES FOR CONSUMERS. THE CATALOG OF STANDARDS AND CATALOG OF TEST PROGRAMS WILL PROVIDE A CONVENIENT SOURCE OF INFORMATION FOR PURCHASERS AND IMPLEMENTERS ON WHICH STANDARDS ARE RELEVANT TO SMART GRID AND IDENTIFY THOSE THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY INDUSTRY TESTING AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT WILL SUBAWARD FUNDS FOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT ON THE CATALOG OF STANDARDS CANDIDATES TECHNICAL ANALYSIS AND INTEROPERABILITY PROFILES DEVELOPMENT.

BENEFIT TO NIST: THIS RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE A NOVEL AND POTENTIALLY VIABLE FIRE-RESISTANT TECHNOLOGY FOR WUI WOOD APPLICATION, WHICH IS EXPECTED TO ADVANCE OUR INTERNAL PARALLEL FIRE RESISTANT TECHNOLOGY FOR WUI WOOD RESEARCH AND ACCELERATE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF OUR PERFORMANCE TESTING METHODS AND GUIDANCE INTO WUI STANDARDS, REGULATIONS AND CODES.PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP AN INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY PLATFORM TO DECREASE THE FIRE HAZARD OF WOOD PRODUCTS USING IN WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) COMMUNITIES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RESEARCHER WILL PREPARE AND TEST THE FLAMMABILITY AND WEATHERING PERFORMANCES OF BIO-BASED COATING FORMULATIONS WITH A PROTECTIVE EPOXY TOPCOAT.  INITIALLY, THE RESEARCHER WILL WORK AT MICROGRAM SCALE TO UNDERSTAND WHAT FORMULATIONS YIELD THE BEST PERFORMANCES AND SHOULD BE SCALED UP TO TEST ON ACTUAL WOOD.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A NEW FIRE-RESISTANT TECHNOLOGY TO THAT DECREASES THE FREQUENTLY AND SEVERITY OF FIRE INVOLVING WOOD PRODUCTS IN WUI COMMUNITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: WUI HOMEOWNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT IN LOWER INSURANCE COSTS, AND THE SLOWER/SMALLER FIRES ALLOW FOR MORE TIME TO MITIGATE FIRES AND ESCAPE (SAVES MONEY AND LIVES). SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCE IS CRITICAL, AS DEMONSTRATED BY WIDESPREAD COVID-19 SUPPLY CHAIN DISRUPTIONS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT AIMS TO DEVELOP A METHODOLOGY BASED ON CPS FRAMEWORK TO CHARACTERIZE THE SUPPLY CHAIN, IDENTIFY SUPPLY CHAIN ISSUES AND SUGGEST SYSTEM REPAIRS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE APPLICANTS PROPOSED TO DEVELOP A PRECISELY-DEFINED SUPPLY CHAIN FRAMEWORK BASED ON THE CPS FRAMEWORK TO IDENTIFY ISSUES IN THE SUPPLY CHAIN AND PROVIDE SOLUTIONS TO THE PROBLEMS. THEY ALSO PLAN TO DEVELOP A FOCUSED DATASET BASED ON DATA FROM THE OBSERVATORY OF ECONOMIC COMPLEXITY AND DEVELOP A COMPLETE REASONING AGENT FOR SUPPORTING INFORMED DECISION-MAKING FOR THE SUPPLY CHAIN. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO RESULT IN A PROTOTYPE DEMONSTRATING THE APPLICATION OF THE FRAMEWORK VIA SYNTHETIC BUT REALISTIC USE CASES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH IS TO LAY THE FOUNDATION OF THE FRAMEWORK FOR A CHARACTERIZATION OF THE SUPPLY CHAIN, WHICH INCLUDES IDENTIFY ISSUES IN THE SUPPLY CHAIN AS MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY A DEMAND SURGE OR OPERATING CONDITION CHANGE AND DETERMINE THE POSSIBLE CAUSES OF THE PROBLEM.? EVENTUALLY, THE PROPOSED FRAMEWORK WILL PROVIDE THE BASIS FOR REASONING TO ADDRESS ISSUES IN THE SUPPLY CHAIN AND BUILD ASSURANCE CASES FOR WORKAROUNDS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MANUFACTURERS, BUSINESSES, AND CONSUMERS WILL BENEFIT FROM DEVELOPING MORE RESILIENT AND EFFECTIVE SUPPLY CHAINS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUB-AWARD FUNDS VIA SUBCONTRACTS FOR CONSULTING/ANALYSIS ON THE DATA ASPECTS OF THE SUPPLY CHAIN. THE SUBCONTRACTOR WILL ANALYZE INTERNATIONAL TRADE DATA AND BUILD ABSTRACTION LAYERS FOR UNIFORM DATA ACCESS TO THE SUPPLY CHAIN INFORMATION.

PURPOSE:  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ULTRAFAST LASER, OPTICS DESIGN SUPPORT AND EXPERTISE TO DEVELOP A TERAHERTZ (THZ) SCATTERING NEAR-FIELD OPTICAL MICROSCOPE SYSTEM. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH NANOSCALE RESOLUTION OF CONDUCTIVITY AND MOBILITY OF FUNCTIONAL DEVICES RELEVANT TO THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE OPTICAL DESIGN AND SPECTROSCOPY CONFIGURATION INCLUDING; 1-IMPROVED SIGNAL-TO-NOISE FOR ACCESSING EXTREMELY SMALL SCATTERING SIGNALS BY OPTIMIZING THZ SOURCE AND ELETRO-OPTIC DETECTION SCHEMES, 2- DESIGN OPTICAL LAYOUT TO COUPLE THZ RADIATION AND DETECTION WITH AN ATOMIC FORCE MICROSCOPE (AFM), 3- DESIGN, CONFIGURE, AND VALIDATE SCATTERED THZ SIGNAL DETECTION, AND 4- TEST OVERALL SYSTEM PERFORMANCE TO QUANTIFY SIGNAL-TO-NOISE WITH KNOWN SEMICONDUCTOR AND OTHER TEST SAMPLES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ESTABLISH NANOSCALE RESOLUTION OF CONDUCTIVITY AND MOBILITY OF FUNCTIONAL DEVICES RELEVANT TO THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY. NEW INSTRUMENT DESIGN, SPECTROSCOPIC DATA, IMAGES OF NANOSCALE INTEGRATED CIRCUIT (IC) COMPONENTS WILL BE INVESTIGATED AND PUBLISHED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  SEMICONDUCTOR ELECTRONIC DESIGN IS CRITICALLY IMPORTANT FOR NEARLY EVERY SECTOR OF THE ECONOMY AND CONSUMER. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO PROVIDE THE CRITICAL DATA TO ENABLE ADVANCED PACKAGING OF SEMICONDUCTOR PRODUCTS AND EVALUATION OF NEW SEMICONDUCTOR MATERIALS AND DEVICES.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE IS NO INTENTION TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: MACHINE LEARNING SYSTEMS HAVE ACHIEVED GREAT FEATS IN RECENT YEARS, WITH MUCH OF THESE ADVANCEMENTS BEING A DIRECT RESULT OF DEEP MULTI-LAYER NETWORKS WITH INCREASING DIMENSIONALITIES. THESE LARGER NETWORKS WERE ENABLED BY INCREASES IN COMPUTATIONAL POWER AND EFFICIENCY DUE TO MOORE?S LAW AND DENNARD SCALING. UNFORTUNATELY, BOTH LAWS ARE APPROACHING THEIR PHYSICAL LIMITS. THUS, FUTURE IMPROVEMENTS CANNOT CONTINUE TO COME VIA LARGER MODELS ALONE DUE TO EXCESSIVE ENERGY AND COMPUTATIONAL OVERHEADS. NOVEL, HARDWARE-BASED MACHINE LEARNING ACCELERATORS ARE NECESSARY TO KEEP UP WITH THE INCREASING DEMAND IN COMPLEXITY AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY. NEURAL NETWORKS FOUNDED ON EMERGING NON-VOLATILE MEMORY DEVICES CAN EXPLOIT UNDERLYING PHYSICAL PHENOMENA TO IMPLEMENT CRITICAL OPERATIONS IN MACHINE LEARNING, POTENTIALLY GIVING RISE TO ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE GAINS IN ENERGY EFFICIENCY. HOWEVER, SUCH A NETWORK STILL HAS A LARGE SPATIAL COMPLEXITY, WHICH TOGETHER WITH THE LIMITED GRAPH TOPOLOGY AND NOISY DEVICE PHYSICS, SIGNIFICANTLY COMPLICATES WEIGHT UPDATES REQUIRED FOR TRAINING. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO STUDY AND CONTROL WEIGHT DYNAMICS VIA ADVANCES IN DEVICE ENGINEERING AND TRAINING ALGORITHMS. SUCCESS WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF SUCH NEXT-GENERATION HARDWARE NEURAL NETWORK ACCELERATORS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TEAM WILL INVESTIGATE THE CHALLENGES IMPOSED BY THE OSCILLATORY NETWORK GRADIENTS AND DEVISE COMPRESSION STRATEGIES THAT SUPPORT A ROBUST HARDWARE-AWARE TRAINING STRATEGY. IN PARTICULAR, THEY WILL DERIVE A DECOMPOSITION ALGORITHM MOST SUITABLE FOR PARALLEL HARDWARE UPDATES, ONE THAT WOULD MINIMIZE HARDWARE-INDUCED OSCILLATIONS TO THESE NOISY HARDWARE WEIGHTS. AS A FIRST STEP, THEY WILL STUDY THE DETAILED TRAINING DYNAMICS IN MULTI-LAYER PERCEPTRONS TRAINED ON THE WELL-KNOWN MNIST DATASET. THEN, EQUIPPED WITH AN IN-DEPTH UNDERSTANDING OF WHAT THE TRAINING DYNAMICS ARE IN HARDWARE NEURAL NETWORKS, THEY WILL INVESTIGATE CONSTRAINTS AND PROPERTIES WHICH A HARDWARE-FRIENDLY DECOMPOSITION ALGORITHM NEEDS FOR IMPROVED NETWORK TRAINING PERFORMANCE. FINALLY, THE PROJECT WILL CONSIDER POTENTIAL AREAS OF PERFORMANCE TRADE-OFFS AT THE ALGORITHMIC LEVEL, SUCH AS TRAINING AND VALIDATION ACCURACY AND LOSS, COMPUTATIONAL COMPLEXITY, AND MEMORY REQUIREMENTS THAT MIGHT AFFECT EFFICIENCY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SCALABLE SOLUTIONS FOR THE TRAINING OF LARGER AND MORE COMPLEX ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORK ARCHITECTURES IN A HARDWARE-AWARE FASHION. RESULTS WILL BE DISSEMINATED VIA RESEARCH PAPERS SUBMITTED TO JOURNALS AND CONFERENCES. THE RESULTS WILL ALSO BE DISSEMINATED IN PRESENTATIONS AND POSTERS AT TECHNICAL CONFERENCES. THE DEVELOPED CODE WILL BE MADE FREELY AVAILABLE IN SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIALS OF PAPERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE PROPOSED ALGORITHMS AND ADVANCED HARDWARE COULD BENEFIT A WIDE RANGE OF INDUSTRIES INCLUDING DEVELOPERS OF RESOURCE-CONSTRAINED INTERNET OF THINGS APPLICATIONS, MEDICAL IMPLANTABLE DEVICES, AND EDGE-SENSOR COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS. THE PROJECT PROVIDES NIST WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO INVESTIGATE HARDWARE/SOFTWARE CO-DESIGN FOR EMERGING AI HARDWARE. IT THEREBY CONTRIBUTES A RESEARCH COMPONENT TO THE NATIONAL PRIORITY CENTERED ON INVESTMENT IN US-BASED SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING. FINALLY, THIS WORK WILL ALSO PLAY ROLE IN EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF COMPUTER SCIENTISTS THROUGH CUTTING EDGE RESEARCH EXPERIENCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE MEASUREMENT METHODS AND DATA TO HELP ENABLE THE TRANSITION TO A CIRCULAR ECONOMY, WITH THE GOALS OF IMPROVING SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY AND ENABLING U.S. COMPETITIVENESS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL USE METROLOGY SUCH AS SPECTROSCOPY TO CHARACTERIZE THE CHEMICAL COMPOSITION OF TEXTILES IN AN EFFORT TO DEVELOP DATA REPOSITORIES AND REGISTRIES FOLLOWING THE FAIR DATA PRINCIPLES, AS WELL AS ESTABLISH NEW STANDARDS AND METHODOLOGIES FOR THE SEPARATION OF TEXTILE BLENDS THAT WILL ALLOW THE REUSABILITY AND RECYCLABILITY OF THESE MATERIALS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING A METHODS AND DATA RESOURCES TO HELP CHARACTERIZE COMMON TEXTILE BLENDS AND PROVIDE A SPECTRAL LIBRARY THAT COULD BE USED TO AUTOMATE SORTING AND ENABLE RECYCLING FOR THE TEXTILE INDUSTRY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: IN ADDITION TO GENERAL SOCIETAL BENEFITS FROM RECLAIMING PREVIOUSLY WASTE MATERIAL, U.S. BUSINESSES AND THE DOMESTIC ECONOMY CAN BENEFIT FROM THE WORK IN THIS PROPOSAL TO FACILITATE A MOVE TOWARDS CIRCULARITY. AS FASTER AND MORE EFFICIENT SORTING AND NEW METHODS OF RECYCLING ARE ENABLED, THIS WILL CAUSE GROWTH IN SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED BUSINESSES FOCUSED IN THE FIELD OF CIRCULAR TEXTILES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PROPOSED PROJECT BUILDS UPON PRIOR EFFORTS TO DEVELOP A GRASSROOTS, COMMUNITY-LED ALLIANCE TO DRIVE ENGAGEMENT BETWEEN FRONT-LINE MATERIALS RESEARCHERS AND THE VARIED COMMUNITY OF DATA INFRASTRUCTURE PROVIDERS, DEVELOPERS, AND USERS, WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF DEFINING AND, ULTIMATELY, BUILDING A SEAMLESS MATERIALS DATA INFRASTRUCTURE THAT CAN ACCELERATE THE DESIGN OF NEW MATERIALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:* THE PROPOSERS WILL ENGAGE THE MATERIALS RESEARCH DATA ALLIANCE (MARDA) COUNCIL TO IMPLEMENT AND EXPAND THE UNIFIED WEB PRESENCE THAT WAS PRIORITIZED DURING THE PILOT PHASE. THIS PRESENCE IS CENTRAL TO RECRUITMENT OF STAKEHOLDERS AND ORGANIZATION OF STUDY OF MDI WORK. THIS PRESENCE PROVIDES A CENTRAL POINT FOR DISSEMINATION OF FINDINGS.* ALSO, THEY WILL WORK WITH A CONTRACTOR TO STRATEGIZE AND IMPLEMENT TIERED ASPECTS OF THE PILOT WEBSITE WITH FORWARD-LOOKING CONTENT AND STRUCTURE.* LEVERAGE INITIAL FINDINGS OF STAKEHOLDER MEETINGS TO SUPPORT WORKING GROUPS ON HIGH PRIORITY GOALS FOR MATERIALS DATA INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT. MARDA PERSONNEL WILL ENGAGE THE MARDA MEMBERSHIP TO IDENTIFY WORKING GROUP NEEDS AND PRODUCE A CODE OF PRACTICES AND SUPPORTS TO ACCELERATE DEVELOPMENT OF FAIR DATA AND ASSOCIATED MDI. PILOT INSTANTIATIONS OF THESE PRACTICES WILL SUPPORT EXISTING AND EMERGING WORKING GROUPS AND INFORM PROGRAMMING FOR THE MARDA-2022 ANNUAL MEETING.* CREATE LIAISON STRUCTURE AND COORDINATION WITH OTHER MATERIALS DATA EFFORTS.* DEVELOP A STRATEGIC ACTION PLAN FOR MARDA'S FUTURE AND LAY THE GROUNDWORK TO SUSTAINABILITY INCLUDING MULTIAGENCY INVOLVEMENT FOR COORDINATED, COMMUNITY ACTION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE CENTRAL GOAL DURING THIS THREE-YEAR STUDY IS DETERMINATION OF THE COMPLEX PROBLEMS FACED BY THE MATERIALS RESEARCH DATA COMMUNITY. THESE PROBLEMS MUST BE ADDRESSED TO ENABLE THE CREATION OF A MATERIALS INNOVATION INFRASTRUCTURE THAT IS A FOCUS OF THE MATERIALS GENOME INITIATIVE (MGI) STRATEGIC PLAN. CENTRAL ASPECTS OF THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE EXTENDING THE COMMUNICATIONS STRUCTURE IDENTIFIED DURING THE PILOT PROJECT PHASE AND NEEDED TO ELICIT INPUT FROM THE STAKEHOLDERS THROUGH WORKING GROUP ENGAGEMENT OF STAKEHOLDER-IDENTIFIED NEEDS IN MATERIALS DATA INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE MARDA WILL ALLOW THE MATERIALS RESEARCH COMMUNITY TO DETERMINE THE CHALLENGES TO CREATING A MATERIALS DATA INFRASTRUCTURE, AND PROVIDE THE MODALITIES FOR SUB-COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THESE CHALLENGES AND PROVIDE ROADMAPS FOR OTHER STAKEHOLDERS TO INVEST TIME AND RESOURCES IN ACHIEVING THE AMBITIOUS GOALS LAID OUT IN THE MGI STRATEGIC PLAN. AS SUCH, THE BENEFICIARIES ARE BOTH THE MATERIALS RESEARCH COMMUNITY, AND, IN THE LONG RUN, THE US POPULATION, WHO BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW MATERIALS IN AREAS AS DIVERSE AS ENERGY PRODUCTION, RECYCLING, MANUFACTURING, DEFENSE, AND HEALTHCARE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT WEBSITE DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EXPLORE EXCITON-POLARITONS USING ADVANCED SPECTROSCOPIC TECHNIQUES OF NOVEL DEVICES FOR APPLICATIONS IN PHOTONICS AND QUANTUM COHERENCE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED WORK WILL USE MULTIDIMENSIONAL COHERENT SPECTROSCOPY TO EXPLORE NON-RESONANT PROPERTIES IN SEMICONDUCTOR MICROCAVITY HETEROSTRUCTURES AND COMPOSITE PHOTONIC NANOSTRUCTURES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT IS TWO-FOLD; 1-EXPLORE COHERENT DYNAMICS IN SEMICONDUCTOR MICROCAVITIES TO ASCERTAIN THE ORIGIN OF CONTRADICTING EVIDENCE FOR THE OBSERVATION OF BIEXCITONS IN DIFFERENT FORMS OF NONLINEAR SPECTROSCOPY AND UNDERSTAND HOW THEIR PRESENCE AFFECTS THE QUANTUM OPTICAL PROPERTIES. 2-APPLY THE METHODOLOGY OF ONE-, TWO-, AND THREE-QUANTUM COHERENT SPECTROSCOPY TO EXCITONS AND BIEXCITONS IN TRANSITION-METAL DICHALCOGENIDE FILMS ON ENGINEERED PLATFORMS TO CONTROL LIGHT-MATTER INTERACTIONS FOR APPLICATIONS IN PHOTONICS AND QUANTUM COHERENCE.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE KNOWLEDGE ACQUIRED WILL CREATE NEW EXPERIMENTAL UNDERSTANDING OF PHOTONIC DEVICES, CRUCIAL TO AN EVER-WIDER RANGE OF APPLICATIONS, ESPECIALLY IN INFORMATION PROCESSING, RANGING, IMAGING, SENSING AND QUANTUM TECHNOLOGIES. AS SUCH, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THESE IMPROVED PHOTONIC TECHNOLOGIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ASSIST WITH THE PROMOTION AND ADOPTION OF THE MANUFACTURING OBJECTS AND ASSEMBLIES DATASET (MOAD) DATASET AND DATA COLLECTION PRACTICES THROUGHOUT THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY. THE MOAD PROJECT IS DEVELOPING A DATASET WITH PHYSICAL OBJECTS AND CORRESPONDING DIGITAL ASSETS OF THOSE OBJECTS TO SUPPORT ROBOT MANUFACTURING AND ASSEMBLY RESEARCH.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS, LOWELL WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING THREE ACTIVITIES:1.	REPLICATION OF THE MOAD DATA COLLECTION RIG. THE MOAD DATACOLLECTION RIG WILL BE REPLICATED IN ORDER TO EVALUATE THE QUALITY AND ACCURACY OF THEDOCUMENTATION GENERATED BY NIST. 2.	DISTRIBUTION OF THE MOAD OBJECT SET. THE MOAD INCLUDES THE FOUR NISTASSEMBLY TASK BOARDS (ATBS). UML ALREADY DISTRIBUTES NIST-ATB #1 TO THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY AS A SERVICE THROUGH THE NERVE CENTER AND WILL APPLY THE SAME METHODOLOGY TO THE OTHER TASK BOARDS THAT WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE MOAD DATASET (AND POTENTIALLY OTHER OBJECTS) BY FABRICATING AND DISTRIBUTING THEM TO RESEARCHERS TO PROMOTE THE AVAILABILITY AND USE OF THE MOAD. 3.	SUPPORTING GENERATION AND UPDATING OF OTHER DATASETS. UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS, LOWELL WILL EXPLORE HOW THE MOAD DATA COLLECTION RIG COULD BE USED TO UPDATE OTHER DATASETS THAT ARE CONSTRUCTED SIMILARLY (I.E., PROVISION OF PHYSICAL OBJECTS ACCOMPANIED BY 3D SCANS AND PHOTOS OF THOSE OBJECTS), IN ORDER TO BROADEN THE IMPACT OF THIS WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ROBOT USERS, ROBOT SYSTEMS INTEGRATORS, ROBOT MANUFACTURERS, US INDUSTRY, ROBOT RESEARCHERSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE EVALUATION FOR SENSOR SYSTEMS USED IN HIGH-DEFINITION (HD) MAPPING FOR AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES BY DEVELOPING A MOBILE ROBOTIC TESTBED. HENCE, THIS RESEARCH WILL FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS EMERGING TECHNOLOGY WHILE INFORMING CONSUMERS AND MANUFACTURERS TO PROMOTE TRUST AND SAFETY IN AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: MICHIGAN TECH WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TWO ACTIVITIES:1)	DEVELOP A MODULAR ROBOTIC TESTBED TO EVALUATE SENSOR SYSTEMS USED IN HD MAPPING. THEEXPERIMENTAL APPARATUS WILL BE AN INDOOR/OUTDOOR MOBILE ROBOT (DIFFERENTIAL DRIVE DINGO). THE MOBILE ROBOT CAN HOST THE INTENDED LIDAR (VELODYNE VLP-16), 360° OMNIDIRECTIONAL CAMERA (OCCAM OMNI 60 OMNIDIRECTIONAL), AND ONBOARD IMU SENSORS FOR EVALUATION IN THIS PROJECT. IN ADDITION, A GPS (GARMIN GPS 18X 5HZ) WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO THE MOBILE ROBOT. 2)	DEVELOP TEST METHODS AND METRICS FOR EVALUATING HD MAPPING CAPABILITIES. AFTER CONSTRUCTION OF THE ROBOTIC TESTBED AND ENVIRONMENT, THE HD MAPPING SENSOR CONFIGURATIONS WILL BE TESTED. HENCE, THIS WORK WILL EVALUATE INTEGRATED CAMERA AND LIDAR SENSORS FOR PERCEPTION IN ADDITION TO THE GPS-WITH-IMU AND GPS-ONLY FOR GLOBAL LOCALIZATION OF THE RAW POINT CLOUDS AND IMAGES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE INTENDED BROADER IMPACT OF THIS WORK IS TO FOSTER A COMMUNITY CONSISTING OF INDUSTRY, ACADEMIC, ORGANIZATIONAL, AND GOVERNMENT STAKEHOLDERS TOWARDS STANDARDIZING COMPONENT-LEVEL SYSTEMS IN AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES. THUS, THIS WORK EXPECTS TO PRODUCE DELIVERABLES BEYOND PUBLICATIONS THROUGH ENGAGING NIST WITH INDUSTRY STAKEHOLDERS IN THE FIELD. IN ADDITION, THIS WORK WILL PROVIDE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE DATA, SOFTWARE (OPEN-SOURCE LICENSE), AND DESIGNS FOR REPRODUCIBILITY TO ACCELERATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF HD MAPS, WHICH IN TURN WILL FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES. FINALLY, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT WILL ALSO FURTHER AWARENESS IN THE NECESSITY OF STANDARDS AND METRICS IN AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AUTONOMOUS VEHICLE USERS (GENERAL PUBLIC), AUTONOMOUS VEHICLE INTEGRATORS, AUTONOMOUS VEHICLE MANUFACTURERS, US INDUSTRY, AUTONOMOUS VEHICLE RESEARCHERSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: FLOW CYTOMETRY IS A TECHNIQUE USED TO MEASURE PROPERTIES OF CELLS AND PARTICLES. TYPICALLY, CELLS OR PARTICLES ARE TAGGED WITH FLUORESCENT MARKERS AND ARE SUSPENDED IN A FLOW. THE SAMPLE IS FOCUSED TO IDEALLY FLOW ONE PARTICLE/CELL AT A TIME THROUGH A LASER BEAM. THE LIGHT SCATTERED OR FLUORESCED IS THEN COLLECTED WITH A PHOTO-DETECTOR. IN THIS WAY, THOUSANDS OF CELLS CAN BE RAPIDLY MEASURED. NIST HAS DEVELOPED AN OPTOFLUIDIC FLOW METER THAT COMBINES BOTH HYDRODYNAMIC AND INERTIAL FOCUSING TO PLACE PARTICLES ON A SINGLE STREAMLINE THAT CAN BE TUNED ACROSS A MICROFLUIDIC CHANNEL. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO DEVELOP AND APPLY THEORETICAL/COMPUTATIONAL MODELS TO UNDERSTAND (I) HOW CELLS AND PARTICLES IN THIS DEVICE INTERACT VIA THE CARRIER FLUID, AND (II) QUANTIFY THE EFFECT OF SUCH INTERACTIONS ON THE MEASUREMENT PROCESS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TEAM WILL DESIGN, TEST, AND IMPLEMENT A SUITE OF FLOW MODELS FOR PARTICLES AND CELLS IN A MICROFLUIDIC CHANNEL. THESE MODELS WILL BE APPLIED TO STUDY PARTICLE-PARTICLE INTERACTIONS, KINETICS OF PARTICLES THAT LEAK OR ABSORB SOLUTES, AND THE EFFECT OF SHAPE AND DEFORMATION OF LEAKY PARTICLES OR CELLS AND THE SURROUNDING SOLUTE FIELDS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE MODELS DEVELOPED, AND SIMULATIONS RUN AS PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE INSIGHT INTO (A) TECHNIQUES FOR TRACKING KINETICS A LEAKY DROPLET, DRUG-CONTAINING VESICLE, OR ACTIVE CELL THAT SECRETES A FLUORESCENT MARKER, (B) THE UPTAKE OF FLUORESCENT MATERIAL BY A PARTICLE SUCH AS A CELL, AND (C) THE CONSUMPTION OF FLUORESCENT MATERIAL AROUND A CELL AS IT TRAVELS ALONG THE FLOW PATH. SUCH INSIGHTS WILL BE USED BY NIST TO CREATE IMPROVED ALGORITHMS TO MEASURE CHARACTERISTICS OF BIOLOGICAL OBJECTS OR PROCESSES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  TO IMPROVE BIOTECHNOLOGY AND MEDICAL DIAGNOSTICS, NIST HAS DEVELOPED AN OPTOFLUIDIC CYTOMETER THAT AIMS TO INCREASE THE RESOLUTION AND PRECISION OF MEASUREMENTS OF CELLS. THIS PROJECT TACKLES ONE OF THE OPEN QUESTIONS REGARDING THIS DEVICE: HOW DO PARTICLE-PARTICLE INTERACTIONS AFFECT THE FLOW DYNAMICS AND OPTICAL MEASUREMENTS? BY BUILDING MATHEMATICAL AND NUMERICAL MODELS, THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE TEAM AT NIST IN ADVANCING THE OPTOFLUIDIC CYTOMETER?S RELIABILITY AND COMMERCIAL AVAILABILITY. THE AVAILABILITY OF SUCH A MEASUREMENT DEVICE COULD ENABLE EARLY AND ACCURATE TESTING OF CANCER AND ALLOW CLINICAL RESEARCHERS TO STUDY REAL-TIME EFFECTS OF TREATMENTS.  IT COULD ALSO FACILITATE THE STUDY AND TREATMENT OF DISEASES SUCH AS DIABETES AND COULD ENABLE RESEARCH ON GENE EXPRESSION, PROTEIN-PROTEIN INTERACTIONS, AND INTRACELLULAR SIGNALING.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RESEARCH, DEVELOP, AND PUBLISH METHODS AND DESIGNS FOR THE HIGH SPEED MEASUREMENT OF NANO-ELECTRONIC/SPINTRONIC DEVICES BUILT AND INTEGRATED ONTO SEMICONDUCTOR WAFERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THREE DIFFERENT CLASSES OF ELECTRONIC MEASUREMENT SYSTEMS WILL BE BUILT. FIRST ARE TUNABLE, HIGH SPEED VARIABLE GAIN AMPLIFIERS WHICH CAN BE USED FOR SMALL SIGNAL AMPLIFICATION OF HIGH SPEED TRANSIENT CURRENTS OF SUCH DEVICES AS SPINTRONIC OSCILLATORS OR RESISTIVE SWITCHING SELECTORS. SECOND ARE A HIGH FREQUENCY VOLTAGE CONTROLLED OSCILLATOR AND DETECTOR PAIR WHICH CAN BE USED IN FUNDAMENTAL CIRCUIT DESIGNS FOR CHIP SCALE FERROMAGNETIC RESONANCE OR MICRON SCALE ELECTRONIC PARAMAGNETIC RESONANCE EXPERIMENTS. FINALLY ARE A SET OF GENERAL PURPOSE HIGH SPEED TEST STRUCTURES FOR ANALYZING OR COUPLING HIGH SPEED SIGNALS, SUCH AS IN SPINTRONIC OSCILLATOR DEVICES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECT OUTCOMES OF THIS RESEARCH ARE DESIGNS FOR AND THE TAPING OUT OF SEMICONDUCTOR CHIPS SPECIFICALLY FOR MONOLITHIC INTEGRATION WITH NANOELECTRONIC/SPINTRONIC DEVICES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE, FIRSTLY, NIST RESEARCHERS WHO ARE ABLE TO EMPLOY THESE CIRCUITS IN THEIR EXPERIMENTS. SECONDLY, BENEFICIARIES ARE ACADEMIC RESEARCHERS WHO WOULD LIKEWISE LIKE TO USE THE DESIGNED SYSTEMS/CIRCUITS TO ENHANCE THEIR METROLOGY OF DEVICES. FINALLY, INDUSTRIAL RESEARCHERS AND PARTNERS WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO USE CIRCUITS SUCH AS THESE FOR ENHANCED MEASUREMENT. SINCE THE RESEARCHERS INTEND TO OPEN-SOURCE THE DESIGNS, BENEFICIARIES WILL BE ABLE TO UTILIZE THE DESIGNS AT NO ADDITIONAL COST. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A MACHINE LEARNING FRAMEWORK THAT UTILIZES OBSERVATION DATA TO DESCRIBE THE UNDERLYING DYNAMICS OF A REAL-WORLD SYSTEM. WITH THE MODELING CAPABILITY DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT, ONE CAN BUILD A SIMULATION MODEL TO PREDICT THE BEHAVIOR OF A PHYSICAL SYSTEM. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL HELP CREATE SMART MACHINES AND INTELLIGENT SYSTEMS IN INDUSTRIAL 4.0.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:1)RESEARCH ON MODE SEPARATION FROM MIXED MODE SIGNAL OF A COUPLED DYNAMICSYSTEM.2)LEARNING A VECTORIZED DIFFERENTIAL EQUATION MODEL FOR WIDEBAND DYNAMIC RESPONSE.3)RESEARCH ON LEARNING DYNAMIC RESPONSE FROM OPERATIONAL DATA WITH EXTERNALEXCITATION4)RESEARCH ON INCORPORATING NONLINEARITIES BASED ON PARTIALLY KNOWN PHYSICS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH TOWARDS BUILDING A DATA-DRIVEN SIMULATION MODEL FOR A PHYSICAL SYSTEM CAN PROVIDE A PATHWAY TO UTILIZE PRACTICAL SENSORY DATA FOR IN-SITU SYSTEM MODELING, SIMULATION, AND CONTROL. THE SUCCESSFUL CARRYOUT OF THE PROJECT WILL ENABLE RELIABLE IN-SITU MONITORING AND ESTIMATION OF PROCESS OUTPUTS AND PERFORMANCE INDICES, SO THAT MANUFACTURERS CAN OPTIMIZE PRODUCTION INSTEAD OF REACTING TO FAILURES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: MACHINE LEARNING COMMUNITY, MANUFACTURERS, EQUIPMENT DESIGNERS AND DEVELOPERS, SIMULATION COMMUNITYSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE RESEARCH PROPOSED IS INTRODUCE METHODOLOGIES AND METRICS TOWARD MEASURING, AND SUBSEQUENTLY MAKE DECISIONS CONCERNING, END-OF-LIFE (EOL) PRODUCT MANAGEMENT IN A CIRCULAR ECONOMY. SPECIFICALLY, THIS RESEARCH AIMS TO EXPLORE METRICS AND TOOLS THAT CAN BE USED TO EVALUATE AND COMPARE THE ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONSEQUENCES OF DIFFERING EOL PRODUCT MANAGEMENT METHODS INCLUDING REUSE, REMANUFACTURING, RECYCLING, AND DISPOSAL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH FOLLOWS SIX RESEARCH TASKS. FIRST, THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL ESTABLISH AN INDUSTRIAL ADVISOR GROUP. THIS GROUP WILL PROVIDE FEEDBACK AND DATA THAT WILL SHAPE THE DEVELOPED OF EOL PRODUCT MANAGEMENT METRICS. SECOND, THE RESEARCH TEAM WILL INTRODUCE A BASIC SYSTEM MODEL FOR THE REUSE, REMANUFACTURING, AND REUSE OF DISCRETE PRODUCTS. THIS MODEL WILL PROVIDE A MEANS TO TEST METRICS AND INDICATORS. THIRD THE RESULTS OF TASK TWO AND INPUT FROM THE ADVISOR GROUP WILL BE USED TO ESTABLISH KEY EOL CIRCULARITY INDICATORS. IN TASK FOUR, THE RESEARCH GROUP WILL CONSTRUCT A FRAMEWORK TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON FINDING DATA THAT SUPPORT KEY INDICATORS. TASK FIVE WILL OPERATIONALIZE METRICS AND INDICATORS TO ALLOW DESIGNERS AND MANUFACTURES TO MAKE INFORMED EOL PRODUCT MANAGEMENT DECISIONS. IN TASK SIX, THE DEVELOPED METHODOLOGY FROM TASK FIVE WILL BE DEMONSTRATED IN AN INDUSTRY CASE STUDY. EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE US-BASED ENTERPRISES WITH DEPLOYABLE EOL PRODUCT MANAGEMENT METHODS THAT EVALUATE AND COMPARE THE ECONOMIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL COSTS OF DIFFERENT EOL PATHS FOR PRODUCTS WITHIN A CIRCULAR ECONOMY. FURTHERMORE, THE DEVELOPED GUIDANCE FRAMEWORK AND INDICATORS WILL ALLOW FOR EXPERTISE AND PARTICIPATION IN STANDARDS CONCERNING EOL METRICS MEASUREMENT IN A CIRCULAR ECONOMY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US GOVERNMENTS, OEMS, AND ACADEMIA WILL BENEFIT FROM RESEARCH THE HELPS DEFINE, STANDARDIZE, AND MEASURE CIRCULAR EOL PRODUCT MANAGEMENT INDICATORS AND SUBSEQUENT EOL DECISION-MAKING STRATEGIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO RESPOND TO CHALLENGES SURROUNDING THE MEASUREMENT OF PRODUCT CIRCULARITY AND CIRCULAR PRODUCT DESIGN (CPD) DEPLOYMENT. SPECIFICALLY, THE RESEARCH PROPOSED HERE WILL HELP ENGAGE US-ENTERPRISES IN CPD STRATEGIES AND STANDARDIZE CPD THROUGH THE INTRODUCTION OF A METRICS-BASED APPROACH FOR EVALUATING PRODUCT CIRCULARITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH FOLLOWS THREE RESEARCH TASKS. FIRST, THE RESEARCH WILL BUILD ON PREVIOUS RESEARCH TO DEVELOP A METRICS-BASED APPROACH FOR PRODUCT CIRCULARITY EVALUATION AND STRATEGIES TOWARD OPERATIONALIZING CPD ACTIVITIES. SECOND, RESEARCHERS WILL ENGAGE IN STAKEHOLDERS TO IDENTIFY, VERIFY, AND VALIDATE CPD REQUIREMENTS AND METRICS RELEVANT TO US-BASED ENTERPRISES. IN CONCLUSION, THE RESEARCHERS WILL EXPLORE ESTABLISHING PATHWAYS TOWARD STANDARDIZATION OF CPD AND THE PROPOSED PRODUCT CIRCULARITY EVALUATION METHOD.  EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE US-BASED ENTERPRISES WITH OPERATIONALIZE CPD STRATEGIES AND A METHOD FOR EVALUATING PRODUCT CIRCULARITY. THE EXPLICIT CONSIDERATION TOWARD DEVELOPING STANDARDS-INFLUENCED METRIC-BASED EVALUATION METHODS FOR PRODUCT CIRCULARITY AND CPD STRATEGIES WILL ENSURE US OEMS ARE COMPETITIVE IN MEETING GLOBAL CIRCULAR ECONOMY INITIATIVES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US GOVERNMENTS, OEMS, AND ACADEMIA WILL BENEFIT FROM RESEARCH THE HELPS DEFINE, STANDARDIZE, AND MEASURE CIRCULAR ECONOMY METRICS AND CPD STRATEGIES. US-BASED RESEARCH IN SUCH TOPICS WILL ENSURE THAT THE GLOBAL ADOPTION OF THE CIRCULAR ECONOMY WILL BE DONE WITH CONSIDERATION OF US-BASED REQUIREMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS

COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR THE U.S. CYBER TEAM ALIGNED TO THE NICE CYBERSECURITY FRAMEWORK PURPOSE: CYBERSECURITY COMPETITIONS NOT ONLY HELP BUILD A BETTER WORKFORCE, BUT THEY ALSO KEEP THE CURRENT WORKFORCE SHARP AND SUPPORT A THRIVING COMMUNITY OF CYBERSECURITY PROFESSIONALS. UNDER THIS PROJECT, KATZCY WILL APPLY NIST STANDARDS AND BEST PRACTICES FOR DEVELOPING AN EFFECTIVE AND DIVERSE CYBERSECURITY TEAM TO COMPETE AT THE ANNUAL INTERNATIONAL CYBERSECURITY CHALLENGE (ICC), AS WELL AS IN OTHER INTERNATIONAL SCRIMMAGES AND COMPETITIONS. THE PROJECT?S PRIMARY GOAL IS TO OPERATIONALIZE THE NIST CYBERSECURITY FRAMEWORK AND NICE FRAMEWORK BY ALIGNING ATHLETE RECRUITING EFFORTS, CYBERSECURITY COMPETITIONS, AND TRAINING INITIATIVES WITH THESE FRAMEWORKS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED PROJECT INCLUDES COORDINATION AND EXECUTION OF QUALIFIER EVENTS AND TRAINING TO RECRUIT, SCOUT, AND TRAIN AN ANNUAL TEAM OF ATHLETES TO REPRESENT THE US IN THE ICC. EVENTS AND TRAINING MATERIALS WILL BE ALIGNED TO NIST AND NICE FRAMEWORKS. ANALYSIS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE THE BENEFITS OF ALIGNING TRAINING WITH THE NICE FRAMEWORK, LOOKING FOR ANY GAPS OR AREAS IN WHICH COMPETITIONS MIGHT INFORM UPDATES TO THE NICE FRAMEWORK AND OTHER CAREER AWARENESS BUILDING EFFORTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SUCCESS IN THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN US PARTICIPATION AND RECOGNITION ON A GLOBAL CYBERSECURITY PLATFORM. MAPPINGS OF CONTENT WILL PROVIDE IMPROVED INSIGHT ON TASKS, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND COMPETENCIES REQUIRED IN THE CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE. FURTHER, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE NIST WITH A CASE STUDY BUILT TO TEST AND OPERATIONALIZE ITS FRAMEWORKS AS CENTRAL TOOLS FOR RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND FORMING CYBERSECURITY TALENT.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE NICE PROGRAM OFFICE AT NIST WILL HAVE DIRECT INPUT ABOUT HOW THE NICE FRAMEWORK CAN BE USED FOR TRAINING AND IN COMPETITION SETTINGS. THE PUBLIC WILL BE PROVIDED WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO PARTICIPATE IN CYBERSECURITY GAMES AND JOIN A TEAM REPRESENTING THE US ON A GLOBAL SCALE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP IN-SITU ELECTRON MICROSCOPY MEASUREMENTS ON NOVEL LOW-DIMENSIONAL ELECTRONIC MATERIALS, TRANSITION METAL CHALCOGENIDES, FOR ADVANCED MICROELECTRONICS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP NEW METHODOLOGICAL APPROACH FOR DETECTING AND QUANTIFYING MICROSTRUCTURAL AND ELECTRONIC PHASE TRANSFORMATIONS IN TRANSITION METAL CHALCOGENIDE THIN LAYERS UNDER THERMAL AND ELECTRICAL IN-SITU BIASING IN TRANSMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPE (TEM).EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DESIGNING THE PROTOCOL FOR IN-SITU TEM CHARACTERIZATION OF MATERIALS AND DEVICE PLATFORMS FOR NOVEL ELECTRONIC DEVICES. IT WILL INCLUDE METHODOLOGY FOR TRANSFERRING ULTRA-THIN LAYERS OF TRANSITION METAL CHALCOGENIDES ONTO TEM HOLDERS FOR IN-SITU HEATING AND ELECTRICAL BIASING, ON-CHIP FABRICATION OF ELECTRICAL CONTACTS TO THESE LAYERS DIRECTLY ON THE TEM HOLDER, AND IN-OPERANDO MACROSTRUCTURAL CHARACTERIZATION UNDER HEAT TREATMENT AND APPLIED ELECTRICAL BIAS DURING OPERATION. A SUITE OF CHARACTERIZATION TECHNIQUES WILL ALLOW DETERMINING THE DYNAMICS OF PHASE TRANSFORMATION AND OTHER CRITICAL PROCESSES IN ULTRA-THIN LAYERS AND DEVICE HETEROSTRUCTURES TO ENABLE IMPROVED MATERIAL AND DEVICE DESIGN FOR ADVANCED MICROELECTRONICS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE IN-SITU MICROSCOPY TECHNIQUES THAT WILL BE DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL ENABLE A BREAK-THROUGH IN THE FIELD OF MEASUREMENT SCIENCE OF PHASE TRANSFORMATION AND RELATED ELECTRONIC PROCESSES AND WILL HAVE A PRACTICAL CONTRIBUTION TO THE TECHNOLOGY OF 2D MATERIALS FOR ADVANCED MICROELECTRONICS, THUS BENEFITING BOTH ACADEMIC AND INDUSTRIAL R&D COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  MICROWAVE MULTIPLEXING IS A POWERFUL READOUT TECHNIQUE, ALLOWING MEASUREMENTS USING LARGE SUPER-CONDUCTING SENSOR ARRAYS WITH UNPRECEDENTEDLY HIGH NUMBER OF DETECTOR PIXELS, BUT IT IS HARD TO USE BECAUSE IT REQUIRES SPECIAL ENGINEERING KNOWLEDGE. THE GRANT PROPOSAL TO DEVELOP NOVEL FIRMWARE AND SOFTWARE WILL MAKE IT MORE ACCESSIBLE TO SCIENTISTS OF VARIOUS FIELDS WITHOUT THE SPECIAL ENGINEERING KNOWLEDGE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DEVELOP AND SUPPLY PRE-COMPILED FPGA BITFILES (PROGRAMS), AND A FOUNDATION (THE BITFILES' SOURCE CODE) TO BUILD ON.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE DEVELOPMENT OF NOVEL FIRMWARE AND SOFTWARE FOR MICROWAVE MULTIPLEXING AS PROPOSED WILL ENABLE THE READOUT OF LARGER ARRAYS OF FASTER SENSORS. THESE SENSOR SYSTEMS WILL ENABLE NIST TO MEASURE THE COMPOSITION OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS MORE ACCURATELY, TO MEASURE X-RAYS AND MILLIMETER WAVES FROM DEEP SPACE, AND, MORE GENERALLY, TO MAKE MORE PRECISE MEASUREMENTS OF LIGHT FROM ACROSS THE ELECTROMAGNETIC SPECTRUM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  IMPROVE THE PUBLIC'S QUALITY OF LIFE AND US ENERGY SECURITY (BY IMPROVING NUCLEAR MATERIAL ACCOUNTANCY, WHICH WILL MAKE NUCLEAR POWER SAFER AND MORE COST-EFFECTIVE).  IT WOULD BE BENEFICIAL TO NIST AS THE PROPOSED WORK WILL STRENGTHEN NIST'S PROGRAMS IN APPLICATION-SPACE FOR SUPERCONDUCTING SENSORS WHICH ENCOMPASSES IMPORTANT TOPICS IN BASIC AND APPLIED SCIENCE.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP, TEST, AND DEPLOY ADVANCED DATA ANALYTICS FOR THE MONITORING OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES AND ASSESSMENT OF MANUFACTURED PRODUCT QUALITY. SPECIFICALLY, THE RESEARCH FOCUSES ON DEVELOPING ADVANCED DATA-DRIVEN, MACHINE LEARNING METHODS FOR THE CHARACTERIZATION OF MELT POOLS ASSOCIATED WITH POWDER BED FUSION PROCESS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH INCLUDES TWO FUNDAMENTAL TASKS. RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP A SET OF CLASSIFIERS FOR ANOMALY DETECTION OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES USING MELT POOL IMAGES CAPTURED BY IN-SITU HIGH SPEED CAMERA. SECOND, RESEARCHERS WILL DEPLOY AND ADAPT ADVANCED MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES FOR POROSITY DETECTION OF MANUFACTURED PARTS VIA PREDICTED TEMPERATURE PROFILE DISTRIBUTION.EXPECTED OUTCOME: THE APPLICATIONS OF MACHINE LEARNING IN ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING, FROM MACHINE MONITORING, DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS OF PARTS, DEFECT SEGMENTATION TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF STANDARD REPRESENTATION OF PREDICTIVE MODEL WILL BE USED BY MANUFACTURERS TO IMPROVE PRODUCTION PROCESSES AND PRODUCT RELIABILITY. FURTHERMORE, THE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENTS WILL BE PUBLISHED AND MADE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE. COLLABORATION WITH RESEARCHERS AT NIST AND INDUSTRIAL PARTNERS WILL ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF REPRESENTATIONAL STANDARDS FOR NEW MACHINE LEARNING MODELS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM BEING ABLE TO PROCESS DATA COLLECTED DURING PRODUCTION OPERATIONS TO IDENTIFY AND INVESTIGATE POTENTIAL EFFICIENCY IMPROVEMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO HELP DEVELOP AND VALIDATE STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR SMALL UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS (AKA DRONES) USED BY PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANTEE WILL HOST TEST METHOD VALIDATION EXERCISES WITH EMERGENCY RESPONDERS TO CAPTURE FEEDBACK AND PERFORMANCE DATA WITHIN THE TEST METHODS AND RELATED OPERATIONAL SCENARIOS. THEY WILL ALSO PROVIDE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE AND GUIDANCE FROM A VARIETY OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS INTERESTED IN USING SUCH STANDARDS TO SUPPORT PURCHASING DECISIONS, FOCUS TRAINING, AND EVALUATE LEVELS OF REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY FOR CREDENTIALING. THESE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS WILL HELP PRIORITIZE TEST METHODS FOR THE STANDARDIZATION PROCESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PRODUCE A SERIES OF STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR BALLOTING THROUGH THE ASTM INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY APPLICATIONS; RESPONSE ROBOTS (E54.09). ALSO, POTENTIALLY NEW USE CASES FROM PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS WITH THRESHOLDS OF ACCEPTABLE PERFORMANCE IN EACH TEST METHOD FOR VARIOUS AIRCRAFT BASED ON THEIR INTENDED MISSIONS, AIRSPACE RESTRICTIONS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS NATIONWIDE WHO WILL USE THE RESULTING TEST METHODS TO GUIDE PROCUREMENTS AND TRAIN WITH MEASURES OF REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY. THE PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT AS EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS BECOME EQUIPPED WITH BETTER LIFE-SAVING TOOLS AND TACTICS, ALONG WITH STANDARDS-BASED CREDENTIALING THAT WILL FACILITATE MUTUAL AID AT LARGE SCALE DISASTERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THIS IS A PUBLIC SAFETY AUGMENTED REALITY (AR) PROJECT TO ACCELERATE THE ADOPTION OF AR USER INTERFACES BY FIRST RESPONDERS. OUR OVERALL GOAL IS TO IDENTIFY, BASED ON EXISTING DATA AS WELL AS SYSTEMATICCOLLABORATION WITH FIRST RESPONDERS, AREAS WHERE AR CAN MOST BENEFIT PUBLIC SAFETY AND INVESTIGATE HOW TO SOLVE FOR CHALLENGES THROUGH A MODULAR DESIGN APPROACH.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 1. IDENTIFY PUBLIC SAFETY USE CASES THAT HAVE DEMAND FOR AR UIS AND PROPOSE A TAXONOMY OF AR PATTERNS BASED ON INPUT FROM FIRST RESPONDERS. 2. DESIGN A COLLECTION OF AR UI MODULES AND IMPLEMENT INTO A RANGE OF FIRST RESPONDER USE CASES. 3. INTEGRATE AR UI MODULES INTO PUBLIC SAFETY USE CASES. 4. EVALUATE HOW AR UIS ENHANCE PUBLIC SAFETY OPERATIONAL CAPABILITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROPOSAL WILL CONTRIBUTE A COLLECTION OF AUGMENTED REALITY  MODULES THAT CAN BE EASILY COMBINED INTO COMPLETE AUGMENTED REALITY USER INTERFACES (FOR THE TRAINING OF EXISTING PUBLIC SAFETY PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES AND FOR THE DEPLOYMENT OF FUTURE PUBLIC SAFETY USER INTERFACES THAT USE AUGMENT REALITY AS A TOOL FOR INCREASING SITUATIONAL AWARENESS, REDUCING RISK AND IMPROVING DECISION MAKING AMONG FIRST RESPONDERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: AS A SUBRECIPIENT, NEXTGEN INTERACTIONS WILL PROVIDE PERSONNEL AND EXPERTISE FOR THE PROJECT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO TEST AND VALIDATE THE APPLICATION OF THE PRE-PLANNING CAMERA-BASED PRODUCT (GEOCAM VISUAL MAPPING SYSTEM) TO AUTOMATE FIRE PRE-PLAN MAPS THAT WILL HELP FIRE DEPARTMENTS KNOW IN ADVANCE OF BUILDING LAYOUTS, LOCATION OF CRITICAL OBJECTS SUPPORTING THEIR EFFECTIVE RESPONSE, AND POTENTIAL HAZARDS. THE SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE GEO-LOCATED IMAGERY OUTDOORS AND INDOORS, SUPPORTING REMOTE AND FREQUENT VIRTUAL TRAINING FOR DEPARTMENT MEMBERS ON CRITICAL STRUCTURES WITHIN A CITY. IT WILL ALSO ENABLE THE DEPARTMENT TO OBTAIN NEW INFORMATION ON STRUCTURAL CHANGES ON A REGULAR BASIS TO HELP IMPROVE ON-DEMAND PRE-PLANNING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  1) IMAGE AND MAP MOST OF THE CITY OF BOISE? STREETS AND A NUMBER OF ITS CRITICAL BUILDINGS.  2) PRODUCE GROUND TRUTH MAPS OF THE PRE-PLAN OBJECTS, INCLUDING HYDRANTS, SPRINKLER/STANDPIPE CONNECTIONS, EMERGENCY EXITS, KNOX BOXES, STAIRWELLS, AND FLOOR PLANS. 3) GENERATE AN AUTOMATED MAP BOOK FOR EACH CRITICAL BUILDING, CONTAINING THE PRE-PLAN MAPS FOR EACH FLOOR AND SELECTED IMAGES FROM EACH ROOM. 4) DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE MACHINE LEARNING MODEL FOR THE PRE-PLAN OBJECTS, INCORPORATING THE LABELED IMAGES. 5) MEASURE AND REPORT ON THE MACHINE LEARNING MODEL ACCURACY DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT. 6) TEST AND MEASURE THE RESPONSE TIME OF FIREFIGHTERS TO REACH A LOCATION INSIDE OF A BUILDING AS INFLUENCED BY THE USE OF THE DEVELOPED PRE-PLAN MAPS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1. GEOCAM SOFTWARE AS A SERVICE (SAAS) HOSTED AS A SERVICE FOR THE CITY OF BOISE. THIS WILL INCLUDE PRE-PLAN DATA AND IMAGERY OF THE CITY STREETS AND THE AFOREMENTIONED BUILDINGS. 2. OPEN-SOURCE MACHINE LEARNING MODEL FOR EACH OF THE PRE-PLAN DATA MODEL OBJECTS. 3. PHYSICAL MAP BOOKS FOR EACH CRITICAL BUILDING, PROVIDING BOTH MAP AND IMAGERY PAGES. 4. TRAINING SESSION PROCEDURES AND DOCUMENTATION ON USING THE GEOCAM SYSTEM. THIS WILL BE USED BY BOISE FIRE DEPARTMENT ON NEW BUILDINGS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PROPOSED PROJECT OFFERS SIGNIFICANT BROADER IMPACT TO THE PUBLIC SAFETY COMMUNITY, COMMERCIAL BUILDING OWNERS /OPERATORS, AND THE PUBLIC. THE WESTERN FIRE CHIEF ASSOCIATION AND GEOCAM WILL HAVE A WELL-TESTED SERVICE TEMPLATE AVAILABLE AS A COMMERCIAL OFFERING TO ANY FIRE DEPARTMENT, LOCAL GOVERNMENT, AND COMMERCIAL COMPANY. THIS SERVICE WILL ALLOW SAID AGENCIES AND SAFETY/ SECURITY TEAMS TO IMPROVE THEIR MAPPING AND FIRE PRE-PLANNING AND IMPROVE THEIR TRAINING, PROMOTING SAFER PRACTICES FOR FIRST RESPONDERS AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: GEOCAM WILL SERVE AS A SUBCONTRACTOR FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT AND PROVIDE PERSONNEL FOR THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ALLOW GTRI TO CONTINUE SUPPORT FOR THE IEEE RAS P1872.1 (ROBOT TASKING) STANDARD WORKING GROUP AS WELL AS PROVIDE THE ABILITY TO IMPLEMENT THE DRAFT STANDARD AND DEMONSTRATE ITS FLEXIBILITY AND AGILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GTRI WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:1)	ORGANIZE AND RUN THE WORKING GROUP?S STANDARD MEETING THAT WILL TAKE PLACE AT IROS 2022 IN KYOTO, JAPAN AND ICRA 2023 IN LONDON, UK. HE WILL ALSO ATTEND OTHER CO-LOCATED IEEE MEETINGS/WORKSHOPS AS THE P1872.1 REPRESENTATIVE.2)	ORGANIZE AND RUN PERIODIC TELECONFERENCES FOR THE WORKING GROUP.3)	ORGANIZE AND LEAD THE WORKING GROUP TO ASSURE THAT ITS MISSION OF SUBMITTING FOR BALLOTING THE P1872.1 STANDARD IS ACCOMPLISHED.4)	DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO PERFORM MULTIPLE, SIMILAR TASKS WITH THE TASK SPECIFICATIONTAKING PLACE JUST PRIOR TO OPERATION.5)	DEMONSTRATE THE ABILITY TO AUTONOMOUSLY RECOVER FROM DETECTED FAULTS6)	BEGIN THE PLANNING OF THE CREATION OF AN IEEE RAS WORKING GROUP TO CREATE A USE AND IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE FOR THE STANDARD.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS EFFORT WILL DEMONSTRATE THE UTILITY OF THE STANDARD FOR COMMERCIAL APPLICATIONS. THIS WILL HAVE THE BENEFIT OF LOWERING PRICES FOR AI SYSTEMS FOR ROBOTIC APPLICATIONS WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY MAKING THE APPLICATIONS MORE AGILE ANDFLEXIBLE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ROBOT USERS, ROBOT SYSTEMS INTEGRATORS, ROBOT MANUFACTURERS, US INDUSTRY, ROBOT RESEARCHERSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE RESEARCH PROPOSED IN THIS DOCUMENT IS RELEVANT TO SYSTEMS ENGINEERING AND SMART MANUFACTURING. IT AUTOMATES PRIOR WORK FORMALIZING THE OPEN STANDARD SYSTEMS MODELING LANGUAGE (SYSML), THE MOST WIDELY USED GRAPHICAL LANGUAGE FOR ENGINEERING COMPLEX SYSTEMS. THE SYSML STANDARD CURRENTLY USES VARIOUS BEHAVIOR MODELING TECHNIQUES. NIST HAS DEVELOPED A PROPOSAL TO UNIFY BEHAVIOR MODELING IN SYSML THROUGH APPLICATION OF THE ONTOLOGICAL BEHAVIOR MODELING (OBM) METHOD. THIS RESEARCH WILL DEVELOP A TRANSLATION TO THE ALLOY ANALYZER (A LOGICAL SOLVER) THAT VALIDATES THIS APPROACH AND PROVIDES A SECOND SOFTWARE IMPLEMENTATION REQUIRED BY THE STANDARDS DEVELOPING ORGANIZATION BEFORE PROCEEDING WITH THE UPDATE TO SYSML.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCH WILL IMPROVE INTEGRATED SYSTEMS ANALYSIS FOR SMART MANUFACTURING SYSTEMS THROUGH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:1.DEVELOP AN AUTOMATED TRANSLATOR THAT READS IN SYSML-SPECIFIED FILE AND CONVERTS IT INTO AN ALLOY MODEL.2.INVESTIGATE THE SCALABILITY/TRACTABILITY OF SYSML MODELS TRANSLATED TO ALLOY.3.INVESTIGATE POSSIBILITIES FOR ADDITIONAL MODELING CAPABILITIES.4.DISSEMINATE FINDINGS AND MODELING RATIONALE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE WORK WILL STRENGTHEN THE FOUNDATIONS OF SYSML FOR IMPROVED ANALYSIS AND INTEROPERABILITY, THROUGH CLEAR AND VERIFIABLE RULES REGARDING ALLOWABLE BEHAVIOR AND THE EXPECTED TRAJECTORY OF SYSTEM STATES.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE TECHNOLOGY THAT IS DEVELOPED THROUGH THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT AN UPDATE OF THE SYSML STANDARD THAT WILL HAVE DIRECT RELEVANCE TO ENTERPRISES THAT DESIGN, MANUFACTURE AND MAINTAIN COMPLEX CYBER-PHYSICAL SYSTEMS. SYSML IS WIDELY USED AMONG AEROSPACE AND DEFENSE ENTERPRISES THAT BUILD COMPLEX, LONG-LIVED SYSTEMS. ONTOLOGICAL BEHAVIOR MODELLING HAS THE POTENTIAL TO ANALYZE MANUFACTURING SCENARIOS AT A MUCH HIGHER LEVEL THAN IS CURRENTLY POSSIBLE, ALLOWING COSTLY MISTAKES TO BE FOUND SOONER. THIS WORK ENABLES EFFECTIVE CAPTURE OF THE REASONING BEHIND DESIGN DECISIONS, WHICH IS CRITICAL FOR LONG-LIVED SYSTEMS. THE PROPOSED WORK WILL LEVERAGE THE LONG-TERM INVESTMENT THAT INDUSTRY HAS ALREADY MADE IN SYSML TO STRENGTHEN THE FOUNDATIONS OF SYSML FOR IMPROVED ANALYSIS AND INTEROPERABILITY. THIS NEW TECHNOLOGY WILL ENABLE SYSTEMS ENGINEERS USING SYSML TO PRODUCE SAFE, SECURE CYBER-PHYSICAL SYSTEMS OUT OF COMPONENTS FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES, RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT PUBLIC BENEFIT OVER MANY YEARS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO SUBAWARDS IN THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP NEW ALGORITHMS AND COMPUTER SOFTWARE FOR DETERMINING ATOMIC ORDER IN TECHNOLOGICAL MATERIALS USING A COMBINED INPUT FROM POWDER AND SINGLE-CRYSTAL X-RAY AND NEUTRON SCATTERING DATA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:NEW ALGORITHMS FOR FAST CALCULATIONS OF 3D DISTRIBUTIONS OF DIFFUSE SCATTERING WILL DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED IN THE RMCPROFILE SOFTWARE (WWW.RMCPROFILE.ORG). THE EXISTING RMCPROFILE CODE WILL BE REPLACED WITH A NEW ONE ENABLING PARALLEL CALCULATIONS ON MULTIPLE GPUS, AS REQUIRED FOR FITTING 3D DIFFUSE SCATTERING DATA OVER LARGE SECTIONS OF RECIPROCAL SPACE WITH HIGH RESOLUTION. A NEW SOFTWARE TOOL FOR THE INVERSE FOURIER TRANSFORM OF THE CALCULATED 3D DIFFUSE SCATTERING WILL BE DEVELOPED IN THIS STUDY, PROVIDING A CAPABILITY FOR IDENTIFYING STRUCTURAL ORIGINS OF SPECIFIC DIFFUSE FEATURES. AN APPROACH FOR STRUCTURAL REFINEMENTS USING LOCAL DISTORTION MODES OF COORDINATION POLYHEDRA AS VARIABLES WILL BE FURTHER DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED IN THE RMCPROFILE SOFTWARE. THE NEWLY DEVELOPED TOOLS WILL BE TESTED USING COMMON STRUCTURAL PROBLEMS ENCOUNTERED IN TECHNOLOGICAL MATERIALS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENTS WILL LEAD TO A STEP CHANGE IN THE PERFORMANCE OF THE RMCPROFILE SOFTWARE FOR ATOMISTIC STRUCTURAL REFINEMENTS USING A COMBINED INPUT FROM POWDER AND SINGLE-CRYSTAL SCATTERING DATA THAT ARE EXPECTED TO YIELD STRUCTURAL MODELS OF UNPRECEDENTED SCOPE AND FIDELITY. THIS SOFTWARE IS PUBLICLY AVAILABLE (WWW.RMCPROFILE.ORG) AND USED WORLDWIDE BY THE MATERIALS RESEARCH COMMUNITY. THE NEW SOFTWARE WILL ENABLE THESE RESEARCHERS AND THEIR CUSTOMERS TO TAKE A FULL ADVANTAGE OF THE STILL UNDERUTILIZED DATA OBTAINABLE WITH MODERN SYNCHROTRON AND PULSED NEUTRON FACILITIES AND, THUS, SOLVE A SIGNIFICANTLY BROADER RANGE OF COMPLEX STRUCTURAL PROBLEMS THAN CURRENTLY POSSIBLE. THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPUTATIONALLY EFFICIENT SOFTWARE FOR THE INVERSE FOURIER TRANSFORM OF CALCULATED DIFFUSE INTENSITIES WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT BENEFIT FOR EXPERIMENTAL CRYSTALLOGRAPHERS AND THEORISTS PERFORMING MOLECULAR DYNAMICS SIMULATIONS. SIMILARLY, THE AVAILABILITY OF ATOMISTIC STRUCTURAL REFINEMENTS USING DISTORTION MODES AS STRUCTURAL VARIABLES WILL REGULARIZE THE REFINEMENT PROCESS AND FACILITATE INTERPRETATIONS OF RESULTS. ALTOGETHER, THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENTS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY ADVANCE THE EXISTING CAPABILITIES IN STRUCTURAL CHARACTERIZATION AVAILABLE TO RESEARCHERS DEVELOPING NEW AND IMPROVED MATERIALS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:MATERIALS RESEARCHERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE NEW CAPABILITIES WHICH WILL FACILITATE THE UNDERSTANDING OF STRUCTURE AND ITS RELATION TO FUNCTION IN COMPLEX TECHNOLOGICAL SYSTEMS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE GRANT HAS TWO PURPOSES: 1) TO INVESTIGATE THE EFFECT OF PROTOMERS (MOLECULES WITH SEVERAL DIFFERENT PROTONIONIZATION LOCATIONS) ON THE REPRODUCIBILITY OF THE DATA IN THE NIST MASS SPECTRAL REFERENCE LIBRARY (STANDARDREFERENCE DATABASE 1A), AND 2) TO STUDY BY MASS SPECTROMETRY THE RELATIVE ABUNDANCES EACH SPECIES IN MIXTURES OF?GLYCANS? (COMPLEX SUGARS).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE GRANT, THE FIRST STEP WILL BE TO CHOOSE MOLECULES THAT ARE VIABLE PROTOMER CANDIDATES FOR STUDY.ONCE SELECTED LIQUID CHROMATOGRAPHY-MASS SPECTROMETRY WILL BE PERFORMED WHILE VARYING AN ARRAY OF INSTRUMENTPARAMETERS TO UNDERSTAND THE BEHAVIOR OF THE PROTOMERS IN THE INSTRUMENT. INSTRUMENT PARAMETERS WILL BE VARIED ANDTHEIR EFFECT ON THE RESULTING MASS SPECTRUM WILL BE DESCRIBED.FOR THE SECOND PART OF THE GRANT, TWO TYPES OF MEASURED MEASUREMENTS WILL BE MADE A) QUANTITATIVE FLUORESCENTMEASUREMENTS, AND B) QUALITATIVE MASS SPECTROMETRY MEASUREMENTS IN NIST STANDARD REFERENCE MATERIAL (SRM)3655 GLYCANS IN SOLUTION. COMPARING THE FLUORESCENCE DATA TO THE MASS SPECTROMETRY DATA WILL YIELD QUANTITATIVEMASS SPECTRAL RESULTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FOR PART ONE, HEURISTIC ION FRAGMENTATION CHEMICAL RULES WILL BE DEVISED. THESE RULES WILL BE USED TO EVALUATE DATAGOING INTO THE NIST MASS SPECTRAL REFERENCE LIBRARY, SRD 1A. THE RULES WILL ENSURE DATA QUALITY. FOR THE SECONDPART OF THE GRANT, QUANTITATIVE CONCENTRATIONS OF GLYCANS ALONG WITH REFERENCE MASS SPECTRA FROM EACH GLYCAN WILL BEMEASURED AND RELATED TO EACH OTHER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES ARE USERS OF NIST STANDARD REFENCE DATABASE 1A AND STANDARD REFERENCE MATERIAL 3655. COMBINEDTHERE ARE THOUSANDS OF USERS ANNUALLY OF THESE TWO NIST SIGNATURE PRODUCTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP FLUORESCENCE LIFETIME IMAGING MICROSCOPY (FLIM) AS A RELIABLE, QUANTITATIVETOOL FOR THE STUDY OF THE DAMAGE MECHANISMS AND DURABILITY OF FIBER REINFORCED POLYMER COMPOSITE MATERIALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESEARCHERS WILL BUILD A STATE-OF-THE-ART SUPER-RESOLUTION FLIM MICROSCOPE FOR THE MAPPING OF DAMAGE IN MODELCOMPOSITE MATERIALS. THEY WILL ALSO DEVELOP A STRESS TEST PLATFORM FOR INVESTIGATION OF SINGLE FIBER BREAKING BEHAVIORIN POLYMER HOST MATERIALS BY SCANNING FLIM MICROSCOPY. A ROBUST METHODOLOGY TO ASSESS AND CALIBRATE THEQUANTITATIVE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN MECHANICAL STRESS AND THE OPTICAL RESPONSE OF MECHANOPHORE DYE MOLECULES WILL BEESTABLISHED AND USED IN THE INVESTIGATION OF MODEL SYSTEMS PROVIDED BY COLLABORATORS AT EXXONMOBIL. FINALLY, FLIMMEASUREMENTS WILL BE CORRELATED WITH THE RESULTS OF OTHER ANALYSIS METHODS, INCLUDING DYNAMIC MECHANICAL ANALYSISAND EX-SITU NEUTRON SCATTERING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP FLUORESCENCE LIFETIME MICROSCOPIES, MECHANICAL TESTING PLATFORMS FOR SINGLE FIBERS ANDMETHODOLOGIES FOR THE QUANTITATIVE CALIBRATION OF THE RESPONSE OF MECHANOPHORE DYE MOLECULES TO MECHANICALLOADING. THESE DEVELOPMENTS WILL LEAD TO A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF THE MECHANISMS OF DAMAGE AT THE FIBER-MATRIXINTERPHASE IN FIBER REINFORCED COMPOSITES. THESE DAMAGE MECHANISMS ULTIMATELY UNDERLIE FAILURE IN COMPOSITEMATERIALS, SO THIS INCREASED UNDERSTANDING WILL LEAD TO ADVANCEMENTS IN THE OPTIMIZATION OF EXISTING MATERIALFORMULATIONS AND THE DESIGN OF NEW COMPOSITES MATERIALS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THIS WORK WILL BENEFIT RESEARCHERS INTERESTED IN THE OPTIMIZATION AND DESIGN OF FIBERREINFORCED COMPOSITE MATERIALS, MANUFACTURERS OF THIS CLASS OF MATERIALS AND FINALLY END USERS OF FIBER REINFORCEDCOMPOSITES IN A WIDE RANGE OF DIVERSE APPLICATION AREAS, INCLUDING AEROSPACE, PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT AND CONSTRUCTIONMATERIALS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

THE I-SITE PROGRAM WILL TRACK MULTI-LASER PROCESS DRIFT, DESIGN EXPERIMENTAL TRIALS TO SIMULATE EXPECTED PROCESS VARIATION AND DETERMINE TYPES OF PROCESS VARIATIONS FOR A MULTI-LASER PBFAM MACHINE THAT WILL IMPACT RESULTING MATERIAL QUALITY, CULMINATING IN THE GENERATION OF A NEW TEST ARTIFACT AND CORRESPONDING BUILD PROCESS AND MEASUREMENT METHOD THAT CAN BE LEVERAGED FOR MULTI-LASER PBFAM SYSTEMS ACROSS THE INDUSTRY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:   UNDERSTAND MACHINE AND PROCESS BEHAVIOR VARIATIONS INDUCED BY MULTIPLE OPTIC TRAIN ADDITIVE SYSTEMS,GENERATE NEW BUILD AND MEASUREMENT PROCEDURES THAT CORRESPOND TO A NEW TEST ARTIFACT THAT CAN BE LEVERAGED BY THE ADDITIVE INDUSTRY, MANAGE THE TECHNICAL TEAM, TASKS, AND THE THOROUGH DOCUMENTATION OF LEARNINGS FROM BUILD TRIALS, WHICH WILL INCLUDE ANALYSIS OF DATA OF SENSOR RESPONSE AND MATERIAL PROPERTIES AS A FUNCTION OF SCAN STRATEGY VARIATIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: QUANTIFICATION OF HOW MELT POOL PHYSICS APPEARS DIFFERENTLY IN STITCH REGIONS AND THE ACQUISITION OF NEW INSIGHTS INTO WHICH MELT POOL MONITORING (MPM) TECHNOLOGY IS MOST SENSITIVE TO THESE DIFFERENCES BASIS FOR FUTURE WORK THAT WILL BE NECESSARY TO DEVELOP A STANDARD METHOD FOR ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING OEM'S AND MACHINE USERS TO ASSESS MULTI-LASER CAPABILITIES, REDUCING THE AMOUNT OF PHYSICAL MATERIAL TESTING REQUIRED TO QUALIFY MULTI-LASER PBFAM PARTS AND PROCESSESALLOW MULTI-LASER PBFAM PROCESS USERS TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF PHYSICAL TESTING, DESTRUCTIVE OR NON-DESTRUCTIVE, OF NEW MACHINE ARCHITECTURE STITCHED PARTS AND PROCESSES, THEREBY MAKING THE MULTI-LASER PBFAM PROCESS MORE COST-EFFECTIVEINTENDED BENEFICIARIES:HOSTING OFFICES AND AGENCY/BUREAU, AWARD RECIPIENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT EL PASO - CHARACTERIZATION SERVICES GE ADDITIVE - MULTI-LASER EXPERIMENTAL AND SENSOR BUILD TRIALS

PURPOSE:* TO USE NEW OPTICAL METROLOGIES THAT WILL ENABLE REAL-TIME PROCESS FEEDBACK AND CONTROL NEEDED TO ACHIEVE PROCESS-BASED QUALIFICATION AND CERTIFICATION OF METALLIC PARTS MADE BY AM.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:   * OPTIMIZE OPERATION OF LPBFTB (LASER POWDER BED FUSION TEST BED) SYSTEM,* BENCHMARK THE SPIFI (SPATIAL FREQUENCY MODULATION IMAGING) IMAGES WITH THE PROPERTIES OF THE FUSED MATERIAL,* VALIDATE PARAMETER-SIGNATURE-QUALITY RELATIONSHIPS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: * THE MANUFACTURING OF DEFECT-FREE PARTS CONSTRUCTED WITH ADVANCED ALLOYS DESIGNED FOR AM.* INTEGRATE SPIFI (SPATIAL FREQUENCY MODULATION IMAGING) INTO AM PLATFORMS TO CHARACTERIZE CRITICAL PROCESS CHARACTERISTICS IN REAL TIME AND IMPROVE OUTCOMESINTENDED BENEFICIARIES:* HOSTING OFFICES AND AGENCY/BUREAU, AWARD RECIPIENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONE

PURPOSE:* TO DEMONSTRATE AN ENHANCED NONDESTRUCTIVE EVALUATION (NDE) TECHNIQUE THAT ACQUIRES NEAR-SURFACE THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY AND SPECIFIC HEAT TO RECONSTRUCT KEY MATERIAL PROPERTIES LIKE OXIDE THICKNESSES, SPLATTER PARTICLE PERCENTAGE, GRAIN SIZE, AND DEFECT DETECTION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:   * ESTABLISH A MEANS TO ASSESS THE QUALITY OF POWDER FEEDSTOCK IN-SITU,* RELATE IN-SITU JUST PRINTED LAYER THERMAL CONDUCTIVITY MEASUREMENTS TO MICROSTRUCTURE AND DEFECTS* DEMONSTRATE TECHNIQUE FOR MONITORING OF THE MELT POOL.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: * DEVELOP NEW, NON-DESTRUCTIVE TECHNIQUE TO DETERMINE THERMOPHYSICAL PROPERTIES OF THE METAL POWDER PRE-PRINT, THE MELT POOL DURING PRINTING, AND THE JUST-PRINTED LAYER.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: * HOSTING OFFICES AND AGENCY/BUREAU, AWARD RECIPIENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE
