PURPOSE:* TO ESTABLISH A DATA-DRIVEN FRAMEWORK WITH COMPUTER VISION AND MACHINE LEARNING FOR THE NON-DESTRUCTIVE QUALIFICATION OF AM MATERIALS/PARTS FOR FATIGUE CRITICAL APPLICATIONS BASED ON DEFECT DISTRIBUTION AND CRITICALITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:   * GENERATE FATIGUE DATA FOR ALSI10MG AND SCALMALLOY SPECIMENS CONTAINING DIFFERENT TYPES OF DEFECTS; COLLECT NDE AND FRACTOGRAPHY DATA FROM SPECIMENS,* CALIBRATE A CRYSTAL PLASTICITY FINITE ELEMENT MODEL WITH EXPERIMENTAL DATA; PERFORM PARAMETRIC STUDY TO INVESTIGATE THE EFFECT OF DEFECTS ON FATIGUE PERFORMANCE, * EXTRACT DEFECT FEATURES WITH COMPUTER VISION, UNDERSTAND THEIR IMPACT ON FATIGUE PERFORMANCE, DEVELOP A MACHINE LEARNING ENSEMBLE MODEL FOR FATIGUE PREDICTION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: * ACHIEVE UNDERSTANDING OF EFFECTS OF DEFECT SHAPE, SIZE, AND LOCATION ON FATIGUE,* IDENTIFY CRITICAL DEFECT FEATURES BY COMPUTER VISION AND OBTAIN AN ACCURATE MACHINE LEARNING MODEL FOR THE NON-DESTRUCTIVE QUALIFICATION OF AM MATERIALS/PARTS,* FOUR NEW STANDARDS MAY BE INITIATED, AND SEVEN EXISTING ONES POSITIVELY IMPACTED.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:* HOSTING OFFICES AND AGENCY/BUREAU, AWARD RECIPIENTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:NONE

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PERFORM FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH INTO THE EMISSION OF PHOTONS BY INDIVIDUAL DEFECTS IN SILICON AND THE ABILITY TO ENHANCE THIS EMISSION USING NANOMETER-SCALE METAL STRUCTURES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FUNDAMENTAL PHOTOPHYSICAL STUDIES OF VARIOUS DEFECTS, INCLUDING W CENTERS AND G CENTERS, AND POTENTIALLY T CENTERS IN SI AND OTHER COLOR CENTERS WILL BE PERFORMED. THE MOST PROMISING DEFECTS FOR QUANTUM-PHOTONIC APPLICATIONS WILL BE IDENTIFIED AND WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO NANOPLASMONIC STRUCTURES. MEASUREMENTS WILL BE MADE TO DETERMINE WHETHER IT IS FEASIBLE TO GENERATE INDISTINGUISHABLE SINGLE PHOTONS FROM THE PLASMON-COUPLED DEFECTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: BETTER DATA ON THE SPECTROSCOPY OF SINGLE LIGHT-EMITTING DEFECTS IN SI, KNOWLEDGE OF WHICH DEFECTS TO EXPLOIT FOR COUPLING TO NANOPLASMONIC STRUCTURES, TECHNIQUES TO COUPLE SINGLE DEFECTS TO INDIVIDUAL NANOPLASMONIC STRUCTURES, DEVELOPMENT OF SINGLE PHOTON GENERATION USING STRONGLY COUPLED DEFECT-PLASMONIC STRUCTURES, INTEGRATION WITH GATE ELECTRODES FOR CONTROL, EVALUATION FOR USE AS A SINGLE PHOTON AND ENTANGLED PHOTON SOURCE; MORE EFFICIENT WAYS TO TRANSDUCE QUANTUM INFORMATION BETWEEN DIFFERENT QUBITS OR BETWEEN QUBITS AND EXTERNAL PROCESSORS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: NIST PROGRAM IN THE ATOM-BASED DEVICES GROUP ON USING COLOR CENTERS TO TRANSDUCE QUANTUM INFORMATION BETWEEN SOLID-STATE SPIN QUBITS OR BETWEEN SOLID-STATE QUBITS AND EXTERNAL INFORMATION PROCESSORS; SCIENTIFIC RESEARCHERS STUDYING COLOR CENTERS, PHOTONIC DEVICES, QUANTUM INFORMATION PROCESSING; DEVELOPERS OF QUANTUM TECHNOLOGY; SECTORS OF THE US ECONOMY THAT WILL PROVIDE OR UTILIZE QUANTUM TECHNOLOGY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP NEW METHODS AND COMPUTER SOFTWARE FOR DETERMINING ATOMIC ORDER IN INORGANIC MATERIALS FOR TECHNOLOGICAL APPLICATIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:NEW APPROACHES AND ALGORITHMS FOR THE DETERMINATION OF THE LOCAL AND NANOSCALE ATOMIC ARRANGEMENTS FROM VARIOUS TYPES OF X-RAY AND NEUTRON SCATTERING DATA WILL BE DEVELOPED AND IMPLEMENTED IN THE COMPUTER SOFTWARE RMCPROFILE (WWW.RMCPROFILE.ORG). THE NEWLY DEVELOPED TOOLS WILL BE APPLIED TO SOLVE STRUCTURES IN SEVERAL TECHNOLOGICAL MATERIALS WHICH COULD NOT BE DETERMINED WITH EXISTING METHODS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENTS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE RMCPROFILE COMPUTER SOFTWARE FOR MULTISCALE STRUCTURE REFINEMENTS USING A COMBINED INPUT FROM MULTIPLE EXPERIMENTAL TECHNIQUES. THIS SOFTWARE IS FREELY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA WWW.RMCPROFILE.ORG AND HAS BECOME A STANDARD STRUCTURE-DETERMINATION TOOL EMPLOYED BY RESEARCHERS WORLDWIDE. THE ALGORITHMS DEVELOPED AS A PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN MUCH FASTER AND MORE ROBUST CONVERGENCE OF SUCH COMBINED-TECHNIQUE REFINEMENTS, THEREBY ENABLING MATERIALS RESEARCHERS TO SOLVE A SIGNIFICANTLY BROADER RANGE OF COMPLEX STRUCTURAL PROBLEMS THAN CURRENTLY POSSIBLE. LIKEWISE, THE PROPOSED NEW APPROACHES FOR OBTAINING ATOMISTIC MODELS OF NANOPARTICLES FROM EXPERIMENTAL DATA WILL DRAMATICALLY ADVANCE EXISTING CAPABILITIES IN STRUCTURAL CHARACTERIZATION ON THE NANOSCALE, FACILITATING THE DEVELOPMENT OF NANOMATERIALS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:MATERIALS RESEARCHERS AS THE NEW TOOLS WILL GREATLY FACILITATE THEIR WORK ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF STRUCTURE-PROPERTY RELATIONSHIPS, WHICH IS A PREREQUISITE FOR ANY DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND OPTIMIZATION OF EXISTING MATERIALS TARGETING SPECIFIC TECHNOLOGICAL APPLICATIONS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO HELP DEVELOP AND VALIDATE STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR GROUND ROBOTS USED BY PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANTEE WILL HELP DEVELOP AND VALIDATE STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR GROUND ROBOTS THAT CAN BE USED TO EVALUATE SYSTEM CAPABILITIES AND REMOTE OPERATOR PROFICIENCY. THEY WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE AND USE CASES FROM PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS INTERESTED IN USING SUCH STANDARDS TO SUPPORT PURCHASING DECISIONS, FOCUS TRAINING, AND EVALUATE LEVELS OF REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY FOR CREDENTIALING. THIS WILL HELP PRIORITIZE TEST METHODS FOR THE STANDARDIZATION PROCESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PRODUCE A SERIES OF STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR BALLOTING THROUGH THE ASTM INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY APPLICATIONS; RESPONSE ROBOTS (E54.09). ALSO, POTENTIALLY NEW USE CASES FROM PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS WITH THRESHOLDS OF ACCEPTABLE PERFORMANCE IN EACH TEST METHOD FOR VARIOUS ROBOTS BASED ON THEIR INTENDED MISSIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS NATIONWIDE WHO WILL USE THE RESULTING TEST METHODS TO GUIDE PROCUREMENTS AND TRAIN WITH MEASURES OF REMOTE OPERATOR PROFICIENCY. THE PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT AS EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS BECOME EQUIPPED WITH BETTER LIFE-SAVING TOOLS AND TACTICS, ALONG WITH STANDARDS-BASED CREDENTIALING THAT WILL FACILITATE MUTUAL AID AT LARGE SCALE DISASTERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO HELP DEVELOP AND VALIDATE STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR SMALL UNMANNED AIRCRAFT SYSTEMS (AKA DRONES) USED BY PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE GRANTEE WILL HELP DEVELOP AND VALIDATE STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR DRONES THAT CAN BE USED TO EVALUATE SYSTEM CAPABILITIES AND REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY. THEY WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL EXPERTISE AND USE CASES FROM PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS INTERESTED IN USING SUCH STANDARDS TO SUPPORT PURCHASING DECISIONS, FOCUS TRAINING, AND EVALUATE LEVELS OF REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY FOR CREDENTIALING. THIS WILL HELP PRIORITIZE TEST METHODS FOR THE STANDARDIZATION PROCESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS GRANT WILL PRODUCE A SERIES OF STANDARD TEST METHODS FOR BALLOTING THROUGH THE ASTM INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS COMMITTEE ON HOMELAND SECURITY APPLICATIONS; RESPONSE ROBOTS (E54.09). ALSO, POTENTIALLY NEW USE CASES FROM PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS WITH THRESHOLDS OF ACCEPTABLE PERFORMANCE IN EACH TEST METHOD FOR VARIOUS AIRCRAFT BASED ON THEIR INTENDED MISSIONS, AIRSPACE RESTRICTIONS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES WILL BE PUBLIC SAFETY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS NATIONWIDE WHO WILL USE THE RESULTING TEST METHODS TO GUIDE PROCUREMENTS AND TRAIN WITH MEASURES OF REMOTE PILOT PROFICIENCY. THE PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT AS EMERGENCY RESPONSE ORGANIZATIONS BECOME EQUIPPED WITH BETTER LIFE-SAVING TOOLS AND TACTICS, ALONG WITH STANDARDS-BASED CREDENTIALING THAT WILL FACILITATE MUTUAL AID AT LARGE SCALE DISASTERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EXPLORE USING AN INTERPRETABLE MACHINE LEARNING FRAMEWORK FOR CHARACTERIZING SOMATIC REFERENCE SAMPLES FOR CANCER DIAGNOSTICS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHER WILL BUILD A NEW METHODOLOGICAL FRAMEWORK BASED ON INTERPRETABLE MACHINE LEARNING TO UNDERSTAND BIASES IN SOMATIC VARIANT CALLING. THE RESEARCHER WILL ANALYZE DATA SETS FROM NIST AND NIST'S COLLABORATORS IN THE GENOME IN A BOTTLE CONSORTIUM TO TEST AND VALIDATE THEIR FRAMEWORK. THE RESEARCHERS WILL ALSO DEVELOP METRICS TO ASSESS PERFORMANCE OF SOMATIC VARIANT CALLING METHODS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE NEW FRAMEWORK SHOULD RESULT IN NEW APPROACHES TO UNDERSTAND STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES OF ANY SOMATIC VARIANT CALLING METHOD, AND HOW THE METHOD CAN BE IMPROVED FOR RELIABLE DIAGNOSIS OF VARIANTS IN TUMORS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE MODEL GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BE USED BY RESEARCHERS WORKING WITH CANCER GENOME DATA TO IMPROVE THEIR RESULTS, AND THE PERFORMANCE METRICS WILL HELP CLINICAL LABORATORIES VALIDATE THEIR METHODS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY THE BEST PRACTICES FOR GROWTH OF THIN FILM MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS FOR ADVANCED MAGNETIC MEMORY ELEMENTS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL PERFORM THE CONTROLLED SYNTHESIS OF ULTRATHIN FILM HETEROSTRUCTURES, INCLUDING MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS, IN AN ULTRAHIGH VACUUM THIN FILM DEPOSITION FACILITY AND ESTABLISH BEST-PRACTICES FOR THE GROWTH AND PROCESSING OF THESE HETEROSTRUCTURES FOR MAGNETIC MEMORY ELEMENTS. THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE EXPLORING THE DEPENDENCE OF PROXIMAL AND DISTAL LAYER MATERIALS, THEIR ASSOCIATED STRESSES AND CHEMISTRY, ON THE PROPERTIES OF THE MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS COMPOSED THEREOF. PARTICULAR FOCUS WILL BE GIVEN TO OBTAINING THE PROPER CRYSTALLIZATION AND CRYSTAL ORIENTATION OF THE MGO AND FEPD COMPONENTS NEEDED TO ACHIEVE HIGH PERPENDICULAR MAGNETIC ANISOTROPY, LOW DAMPING, LOW ANISOTROPY INHOMOGENEITY AND HIGH MAGNETORESISTANCE VALUES IN THE UNDERLYING MAGNETIC MEMORY ELEMENT. JUDICIOUS EXPERIMENTAL METHODOLOGY IN THE PREPARATION OF THIN FILM SPECIMENS AND THEIR CAREFUL AND SYSTEMATIC PROCESSING IN CONTROLLED CONDITIONS WILL BE EMPLOYED TO ADVANCE KNOWLEDGE IN THE MATERIALS AND PROCESSING LEADING TO OPTIMIZED MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS. STRUCTURAL MEASUREMENTS - INCLUDING X-RAY DIFFRACTION, TRANSMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPY AND ATOMIC FORCE MICROSCOPY - AND MAGNETIC MEASUREMENTS - INCLUDING MAGNETORESISTANCE MEASUREMENTS, MAGNETOMETRY AND FERROMAGNETIC RESONANCE SPECTROSCOPY - WILL BE USED TO ESTABLISH STRUCTURE-PROPERTY RELATIONSHIPS KEY TO BUILDING NEW PROCESSING KNOWLEDGE FOR THE OPTIMIZED MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL DELIVER NEW MATERIALS UNDERSTANDING TO PRODUCE MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS THAT COMBINE HIGH MAGNETIC ANISOTROPY WITH LOW MAGNETIC LOSS AND LARGE TUNNEL MAGNETORESISTANCE BY EXPLORING THE MATERIALS AND PROCESSING STRATEGIES THAT ARE COMPATIBLE WITH FEPD AND MGO-BASED MAGNETIC TUNNEL JUNCTIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE US SEMICONDUCTORY INDUSTRY WILL BENEFIT FROM APPLYING THE NEWLY DEVELOPED SYNTHESIS AND PROCESSING STRATEGIES TO THEIR EXISTING FOUNDRY TOOLS FOR MAGNETIC NON-VOLATILE MEMORY DEVELOPMENT, A KEY ENABLER FOR EMERGING EMBEDDED AND STANDALONE MEMORY TECHNOLOGIES, AND GENERALLY ONE OF THE MOST QUICKLY GROWING AREAS IN THE GLOBAL MEMORY INDUSTRY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD A DIGITAL-TWIN ENABLED TESTBED WITH THE STATE-OF-THE-ART USER INTERFACE/USER EXPERIENCE TECHNOLOGIES AND ADVANCED SIMULATION MODELS TO PROVIDE A PHOTOREALISTIC VIRTUAL REALITY ENVIRONMENT FOR FIRST RESPONDERS AND EMERGENCY MANAGERS TO ENGAGE, EXPERIENCE, AND EXPLORE THE LATEST SENSING AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: KEY ACTIVITIES OF THE PROJECT INCLUDE COLLECTING DATA AT DISASTER CITY, DEVELOPING 3D SURFACE MODELS ACCESSIBLE FOR MULTIPLE TRAINING SITES AT DISASTER CITY, ENABLING REMOTE ACCESS FOR DIGITAL TWIN OF TRAINING SITES, AND MAKING AVAILABLE APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACES FOR COLLABORATORS TO TEST NEW TECHNOLOGIES IN A VIRTUAL ENVIRONMENT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE TESTBED WILL SERVE AS A VIRTUAL TESTING AND TRAINING FACILITY FOR FIRST RESPONDERS, AND ALSO FUNCTION AS AN OPEN PLATFORM FOR RESEARCHERS AND ENTREPRENEURS WORLDWIDE TO COLLABORATE WITH FIRST RESPONDERS AND EMERGENCY MANAGERS TO DEVELOP NEXT-GENERATION SENSING AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGIES AND DEVICES SPECIALIZED FOR PUBLIC SAFETY USAGEINTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS AND EMERGENCY MANAGERS ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THERE ARE THREE PURPOSES OF THIS PROJECT.  (1) DEVELOP POSITIONING SYSTEM FOR LOCATION OF EMERGENCY RESPONDERS. (2) DEVELOP FAR TARGET DETECTION SYSTEM FOR LOCATION OF EQUIPMENT, PRESENCE OF HAZARDS, AND RESOURCES. (3) DEVELOP A SYSTEM PROVIDING PATH PLANNING AND GUIDANCE FOR EMERGENCY RESPONDERS WITH STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS GUARANTEEING ARRIVAL TO A DESIRABLE DESTINATION (E.G., EXIT FROM A BUILDING).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THREE CUSTOM TECHNOLOGIES: UNAVCHIP - A CHIP-SCALE INERTIAL MEASUREMENT UNIT AND AIDING SENSORS MOUNTED IN SOLE OF A SHOE FOR SELF-CONTAINED GEOLOCATION OF EMERGENCY RESPONDERS (SUBJECTS), "CRYSTALBALL" - A GOLF-BALL SIZE MULTI-SENSOR SUITE FOR GEOLOCATION OF FARAWAY OBJECTS OF INTEREST (THINGS), "ECOTONE" - A PATH PLANNING ENGINE FOR GUIDANCE AND NAVIGATION IN COMPLETELY UNKNOWN ENVIRONMENT. THE TECHNOLOGIES OF UNAVCHIP, CRYSTALBALL, AND ECOTONE WILL BE INTEGRATED IN A FORMFACTOR OF A HAND-HELD DEVICE WITH A DEDICATED USER INTERFACE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A PROTOTYPE OF WEARABLE TECHNOLOGY TO LOCALIZE EMERGENCY RESPONDERS, ASSETS AND EQUIPMENT, AND OTHER PEOPLE (E.G., PATIENTS AND TRAPPED PERSONS) INDOORS AND IN COVERED OUTDOOR ENVIRONMENTS, WHERE THE ENVIRONMENT IS NOT KNOWN AND WHERE GPS SIGNALS ARE NOT AVAILABLE OR ARE UNUSABLE. THE WEARABLE AND HAND-HELD TECHNOLOGY WILL ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES OF GEOLOCATION OF PERSONNEL, GEOLOCATION OF  RESOURCES, AS WELL AS SAFE OPERATION IN UNKNOWN AND FAST CHANGING ENVIRONMENTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS, SPECIFICALLY FIREFIGHTERS, ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT IDENTIFIES 4 PRIMARY OBJECTIVES. (1) CREATE A FRAMEWORK FOR INTEGRATION OF THE DATA AND SYSTEM VISUALS INTO NEW AND EXISTING PUBLIC SAFETY ORGANIZATION (PSO) APPLICATIONS. (2) DISPLAY MITIGATION RECOMMENDATIONS IN A WIDELY AVAILABLE AND USER-FRIENDLY  COMMERCIAL OFF-THE-SHELF AUGMENTED REALITY (AR) INTERFACES. (3) RESEARCHING THE INTEGRATION OF MODELING TOOLS THAT CAN PROVIDE PREDICTIVE USER INTERFACES IN AR, OPTIMIZING THE INFORMATION BASED ON THE TASKS AND SITUATIONS AT HAND (4) EVALUATE EFFECTIVENESS OF APPLICATION?S AR INTERFACES (VISUALS, AUDIO, GESTURES) FOR TRAINING, OPERATIONS, AND AFTER-ACTION REVIEW (AAR) IN TERMS OF USABILITY BY COLLECTING USER INTERACTION DATA, CONDUCTING OBSERVATIONAL SURVEYS, AND GATHERING USER FEEDBACK DATA.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT?S APPROACH IS TO USE THE SUCCESSIVE APPROXIMATION MODEL, USER CENTERED DESIGN, AND SCRUM AGILE SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES AND MACHINE LEARNING OPERATIONS (MLOPS) ALONG WITH THE IPHONE, IPAD, HOLOLENS2 AND UNITY3D TO BUILD AR INTERFACES THAT CONVEY INFORMATION TO USERS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE POTENTIAL IMPACT OF THIS PROJECT IS TO (1) PUBLIC SAFETY WITH AN AR INTEGRATION FRAMEWORK FOR THE PRODUCTION OF MITIGATION APPLICATIONS; (2) INTEGRATE LIVE DATA INTO THE AR INTERFACE IN A COMPACT, EASY-TO-DEPLOY SOLUTION; (3) PROVIDE R&D RESEARCH ON 3D ICONOGRAPHY, MODELS AND SIMULATIONS INTEGRATION, TIME OF FLIGHT (TOF) SENSORS, AND MACHINE LEARNING MODELS. (4) DEVELOP A COMMERCIALLY VIABLE WILDFIRE MITIGATION AR SOLUTION AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC SAFETY AGENCIES AT NO COST AT THE END OF PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PUBLIC SAFETY ORGANIZATIONS ARE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A FIRST RESPONDER INTELLIGENT ASSISTANT(FRIA), A TECHNOLOGICAL SOLUTION THAT IMPROVES ACCESS AND DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION FOR DECISION MAKERS, ASSET OPERATORS, AND FRONT-LINE RESPONDERS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FRIA WILL SYNTHESIZE, STRUCTURE, AND ROUTE ACTIONABLE INSIGHTS FROM THE SMALL UNMANNED AIR VEHICLES (SUAV) DATA AND THEN PRESENT IT IN CONTEXT TO FIRST RESPONDERS AND MACHINE SYSTEMS IN AN INTERACTION FORMAT THAT FITS THEIR NEEDS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FRIA WILL IMPACT FIRST RESPONSE OPERATIONS THROUGH A SERIES OF ADVANCING IMPLEMENTATIONS, BEGINNING WITH SOLUTIONS THAT ARE DEPLOYABLE USING CURRENT HARDWARE ALREADY IN THE HANDS OF FIRST RESPONDERS, AND ADVANCING WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF AUGMENTED AND VIRTUAL REALITY INTERFACES, WEARABLE TECHNOLOGY, AND ROBOTIC ASSETS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE FIRST RESPONDERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS THREE LONG-STANDING AND DIFFICULT CHALLENGES IN EMERGENCY ENVIRONMENTS BY UTILIZING EMERGING 5G CAPABILITIES. LONG-STANDING CHALLENGES ARE 1) PRECISE INDOOR POSITIONING SYSTEM, 2) RELIABLE COMMUNICATION INFRASTRUCTURE, AND 3) ACCURATE MAPPING AND VISUALIZATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DESIGN, PROTOTYPE AND DEMONSTRATE A HIGHLY PRECISE 5G-BASED INDOOR POSITIONING SYSTEM (5G-IPS) USING UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLES (UAVS) THAT CAN ACCURATELY, RELIABLY, AND QUICKLY TRACK FIREFIGHTERS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSED 5G-IPS SYSTEM WILL ENABLE A NEW CAPABILITY THAT ALLOWS MUCH GREATER SITUATION AWARENESS OF FIRST RESPONDERS THAT ARE IN HARM'S WAY BY KNOWING THEIR PRECISE LOCATION, COLLABORATING IN INDOOR MAP BUILDING, AND COMMUNICATING SEAMLESSLY AMONG KEY FIRST RESPONDERS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE FIRST RESPONDERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO VIRGINIA TECH TO LEVERAGE EXPERTISE WITH INDOOR POSITIONING ALGORITHM DEVELOPMENT, SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE DESIGN AND PROTOTYPE/TESTBED DEVELOPMENT OF THE  OVERALL SYSTEM.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS THE DEFINITION, SPECIFICATION, DESIGN, PROTOTYPINGAND PILOTING OF AN INTEROPERABLE COMMUNICATIONS FRAMEWORK THAT WILL SUPPORT THE INTERCONNECTIONOF DIFFERENT PUBLIC SAFETY AGENCIES, REGARDLESS THEIR SELECTED MISSION CRITICAL DATA SOURCE (VOICE, DATA, AND/OR VIDEO) AND/OR MOBILE NETWORK PROVIDER.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: KEY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1) TO INTRODUCE THE CONCEPT OF INTER-AGENCY OPERATIONS PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT, 2) TO ENABLE THE RAPID CREATION AND PROPAGATION OF INTER-AGENCY ?CAMPAIGNS?, 3) TO CREATE A MISSION CRITICAL VOICE, DATA, AND VIDEO (MCX) INTER-COMMUNICATION PLATFORM, FULLY BASED ON 3GPP MCX STANDARD PROCEDURES AND  4) TO EVALUATE THE SUITABILITY OF THE CONCEPTS IN TERMS OF KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS RESEARCH WILL ALLOW THE INDUSTRY TO EASILY CROSS-CONNECT WITH OTHER VENDORS IN A STANDARDS-COMPLIANCE FASHION PAVING THE WAY FOR THE RESOLUTION OF INTEROPERABILITY THAT THE US FIRST-RESPONDERS AND CITIZENS REQUIRE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: PRIME INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE US FIRST-RESPONDERS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP OF A USER INTERFACE FOR DISPLAYING FORENSIC SEQUENCING DATA. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP AN INTERACTIVE INTERFACE USING THE PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES R, PYTHON, AND C++. THE INTERFACE WILL INTERFACE WITH THE EXISTING NIST 'STRSEQ' DATABASE TO TEST AND VALIDATE THEIR APPLICATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING A GRAPHICAL USER INTERFACE TO PARSE THE DATA (SEQUENCE STRINGS) HELD WITHIN THE STRSEQ RESOURCE. THE OUTCOME WILL BE 1) A TOOL TO CONVERT STR SEQUENCE STRINGS TO BRACKETED FORMALS AND 2) SUPPORT ENSURING DATA THE COMPATIBILITY FOR SEQUENCED-BASED STR DATABASES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTERFACE CAN BE USED BY COMMERCIAL ENTITIES THAT PERFORM SEQUENCING OF FORENSIC STR MARKERS TO DISPLAY THEIR INFORMATION IN CONSISTENT FORMAT. STEWARDS OF SEQUENCE DATABASES CAN USE THE TOOL TO CONVERT SEQUENCE STRINGS TO A BRACKET NOTATION THAT IS COMMON TO THE FORENSIC COMMUNITY. ACADEMIC USERS CAN USE THE TOOL TO UNDERSTAND NOMENCLATURE AND PARSING OF SEQUENCE INFORMATION. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THREE UNDERGRADUATE PHYSICS RESEARCH ASSOCIATES TO WORK ONSITE AT NIST GAITHERSBURG FROM MAY 31, 2022 TO AUGUST 5, 2022, UNDER THE SUPERVISION AND DIRECTION OF MR. JOSEPH KOPANSKI IN THE NANOSCALE DEVICE CHARACTERIZATION DIVISION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT PRACTICAL RESEARCH TRAINING FOR THREE STUDENTS WORKING ON THEIR BS DEGREES IN PHYSICS. THE INTERNSHIPS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ON-GOING NIST RESEARCH PROJECTS IN PHOTOEMISSION ELECTRON MICROSCOPY, DEVELOPMENT OF A PORTABLE DETECTOR FOR A RADIATION DOSIMETRY PROJECT, AND TIME-RESOLVED SPECTROSCOPY OF EXCITONS AND EXCITON-POLARITONS IN ORGANIC CRYSTALS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM, EACH RESEARCH ASSOCIATE GIVES A PROFESSIONAL PRESENTATION ON HIS/HER WORK, DESCRIBING CONTRIBUTIONS TO THEIR ASSIGNED RESEARCH PROJECTS AND OVERALL INTERNSHIP EXPERIENCE TO THE STAFF SCIENTISTS OF THE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF PHYSICS AND INVITED GUESTS. INTERNS ARE ALSO ENCOURAGED AND SUPPORTED TO GIVE PRESENTATIONS ABOUT THEIR EXPERIENCE AT A NATIONAL PHYSICS MEETING IN THE YEAR FOLLOWING THEIR INTERNSHIP.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE GUEST RESEARCHERS WILL BENEFIT FROM PRACTICAL RESEARCH LABORATORY EXPERIENCE. SUCH TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES ARE CRITICAL FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FUTURE SCIENTIFIC WORKFORCE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE US ECONOMY AND ARE IN LINE WITH NIST MISSION OBJECTIVES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT A UNIFORM APPROACH BETWEEN ASME AND ISO (STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATIONS) FOR MODEL BASED ENGINEERING (MBE) OF COMPOSITE STRUCTURES AND THE APPLICATION OF MBE TO MANUFACTURING, THROUGH HARMONIZING THE DEFINITIONS AND APPROACHES TO THE CONCEPTS BEHIND COMPOSITE MANUFACTURING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: PROPOSED HARMONIZATION ACTIVITIES FOR ISO 10303 INCLUDE UPDATING ISO 10303-1767 COMPOSITE CONSTITUENT SHAPE TO ADD LINES AND AREAS FOR LIMITED LENGTH OR AREA INDICATORS (LLAI) DEFINITION AND ADD PRODUCT AND MANUFACTURING INFORMATION (PMI) FOR SHAPE TOLERANCES; UPDATING ISO 103003-1770 PART AND ZONE LAMINATE TABLE TO REPRESENT COMPOSITE CONSTITUENTS FOR LLAI; AND UPDATING ISO 10303-1772 PLY ORIENTATION SPECIFICATION TO ADD PMI FOR PLY ANGLES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT SHOULD IMPROVE THE DESIGN AND MANUFACTURE OF COMPOSITE STRUCTURES BY PROVIDING A COMMONLY UNDERSTOOD VOCABULARY SHARED BY THE ENGINEERS WHO DESIGN COMPOSITES FOR MANUFACTURE, AND FOR TOOL VENDORS WHO PROVIDE THE WORKBENCHES TO AUTOMATE THE DESIGN AND MANUFACTURE OF THOSE STRUCTURES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROPOSAL WILL FURTHER DEVELOP AND ENHANCE INTEROPERABILITY STANDARDS OF CRITICAL IMPORTANCE TO US INDUSTRY. THE RESEARCH WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC THROUGH TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER OF THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED THROUGH STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT TO ULTIMATELY SUPPORT IMPROVED PRODUCT MANUFACTURE AND FUNCTIONALITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL QUANTIFY THE FUTURE RISK AND IMPACTS OF WIND AND HAIL STORMS IN A WARMING CLIMATE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT INCLUDES A NOVEL EFFORT TO ESTIMATE THE COMBINED WIND AND HAIL EFFECTS ON THE US BUILDING STOCK.  THE PROJECT FURTHER ASSESSES NOT ONLY THE CURRENT IMPACT OF WIND AND HAIL DAMAGES, BUT ALSO CONDUCT SOPHISTICATED ANALYSES TO THROUGH PROBABILISTIC MODELING TO ASSESS THE LIKELY LOSSES DUE TO CHANGES IN THE FUTURE CLIMATE.  ONCE THE CURRENT AND PROJECTED FUTURE LOSSES ARE ESTIMATED, THE PROJECT WILL THEN IDENTIFY AND EVALUATE ADAPTATION AND RISK MITIGATION MEASURES TO REDUCE US LOSSES DUE TO WIND AND HAIL.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT RECOMMENDATIONS WILL BE ADOPTED INTO US BUILDING CODES AND STANDARDS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: TOTAL US LOSSES DUE TO SEVERE CONVECTIVE STORMS HAVE EXCEEDED $10 BILLION DOLLARS EVERY YEAR FOR THE PAST DECADE.  US BUILDING OWNERS, HOMEOWNERS, AND INSURANCE COMPANIES WILL BENEFIT FROM AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF HOW TO MITIGATE WIND AND HAIL DAMAGES BOTH CURRENT TO FUTURE CLIMATIC CONDITIONS. THIS RESEARCH IS ALIGNED WITH NIST WIND ENGINEERING AND NATIONAL WINDSTORM IMPACT REDUCTION PROGRAM OBJECTIVE TO DEVELOP NOVEL METHODS FOR HIGH-RESOLUTION MODELING OF METEOROLOGICAL PHENOMENA TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF EFFECTS OF CONVECTIVE WIND CURRENTS AND HAIL HAZARD RELEVANT TO STRUCTURAL ENGINEERING RISK ASSESSMENT, ANALYSIS, AND DESIGN.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE GENERATION OF FIREBRANDS AND FIRE INTENSITY FOR DIFFERENT VEGETATIVE FUELS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE FIREBRANDS GENERATED AND FIRE INTENSITY, AND DURATION FOR DIFFERENT FUELS AND IDENTIFYING FUEL CHARACTERISTICS WHICH MAY BE PREDICTORS OF FIREBRAND GENERATION PROPENSITY (E.G. FUEL SHAPE, BARK STRUCTURE). ADDITIONALLY, THE DATA OBTAINED FROM THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL BE UTILIZED TO PARAMETERIZE THE NUMERICAL MODELS OF FIREBRAND GENERATION, TRANSPORT, AND DEPOSITION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FIREBRANDS ARE A SIGNIFICANT SOURCE OF IGNITION FOR HOMES NEAR THE WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE (WUI).  THE PROJECT WILL GENERATE FIREBRAND GENERATION PARAMETERS, WHICH ARE CRITICAL INPUTS TO WUI FIRE MODELS.  DATA PUBLISHED FROM THIS WORK WILL ALSO SERVE AS A FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE FIREBRAND TRANSPORT AND MODELING RESEARCH.  THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE TOOLS AVAILABLE TO PRACTITIONERS, ENGINEERS, AND INVESTIGATORS TO PREDICT THE POTENTIAL IGNITION OF A STRUCTURE BY FIREBRANDS POTENTIAL OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT TO THE FIRE COMMUNITY WILL BE IMPROVING THE RESILIENCE OF THE US COMMUNITIES AT RISK OF WUI FIRES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US COMMUNITIES AT RISK OF WUI FIRES WILL HAVE IMPROVED TOOLS FOR PLANNING RESILIENCE EFFORTS.  THIS PROJECT IS ALIGNED WITH THE STATED DRRG GOALS OF THE NIST WUI FIRE PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMPUTATIONAL TOOLS DIRECTLY RELATED THE PREDICTION OF IGNITION BY FIREBRANDS BY COLLECTION OF NECESSARY DATA FOR UNDERSTANDING FIREBRAND TRANSPORT CONDITIONS AND VALIDATION OF COMPUTER MODELS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE UNIVERSITY OF EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND, UK AND CALIFORNIA POLYTECHNIC STATE UNIVERSITY, CA, USA WILL BE SUBAWARDEES ON THIS PROPOSAL. THE UNIVERSITY OF EDINBURGH HAS A COMPLEMENTARY SETUP TO WPI'S WIND-TUNNEL THAT HAS ALREADY BEEN USED FOR WILDLAND FIRE RESEARCH AND A STRONG TRACK-RECORD OF FIREBRAND RESEARCH (INCLUDING NIST-FUNDED PROJECTS).

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE RESILIENCE OF US PORT AND HARBOR INFRASTRUCTURE THAT SERVES AS A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF THE US ECONOMY AND CURRENTLY REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT POST-EARTHQUAKE RECOVERY VULNERABILITY IN US SEISMIC REGIONS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE RESIDUAL AXIAL CAPACITY OF STEEL PIPE PILES THAT ARE SUBJECTED TO CYCLIC LOADING AND EXHIBIT LOCAL BUCKLING, THROUGH PHYSICAL TESTING AND NUMERICAL SIMULATION.  STEEL PIPE PILES ARE FUNDAMENTAL TO THE INTEGRITY OF PORT PHYSICAL INFRASTRUCTURE.  HOWEVER, THE PILES ARE UNDERGROUND, DIFFICULT TO ACCESS FOR MEASUREMENTS AND MONITORING, DESPITE BEING SUBJECT TO LONG-TERM AGING EFFECTS FROM EXPOSURE TO SALTWATER.THIS PROJECT WILL DERIVE NEW COMPRESSIVE STRAIN LIMITS FOR BUCKLING OF AXIAL LOAD CARRYING STEEL PIPE PILES FOLLOWING DEVELOPMENT OF AN IN-GROUND PLASTIC HINGE BASED ON LARGE-SCALE EXPERIMENTS AND NUMERICAL MODELING.  THE PROJECT WILL UNDERTAKE A BLIND PREDICTION CONTEST HIGHLIGHT AND HELP DISSEMINATE THE RESEARCH WITH LONG-LASTING PROJECT VISIBILITY.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ESTABLISH A HIGHLY-QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE INDUSTRY ADVISORY PANEL COMPRISED OF SENIOR MARINE STRUCTURAL, GEOTECHNICAL ENGINEERS, STAKEHOLDERS AND PROFESSIONAL ENGINEERS REPRESENTING THE MAIN PORTS ALONG THE WEST COAST OF THE US.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESULTS WILL BE PROPOSED TO ASCE-COPRI 61 SEISMIC DESIGN OF PIERS AND WHARVES STANDARD TO ENHANCE THE SCIENCE-BASIS FOR US CODES AND STANDARDS.  FURTHER, THE FINDINGS DEVELOPED IN THIS STUDY CAN BE TRANSFERRED TO A BROAD RANGE OF OTHER TYPES OF INFRASTRUCTURE WHICH ARE SUBJECT TO SIMILAR TYPES OF CONCERNS (E.G., TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE). THIS RESEARCH IS ALIGNED WITH THE NIST EARTHQUAKE ENGINEERING GOALS, INCLUDING THE NATIONAL EARTHQUAKE HAZARD REDUCTION PROGRAM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AS 99% OF THE OVERSEAS TRADE MAKES USE OF THE MARINE TRANSPORT SYSTEM, SUPPORTING $5.4 TRILLION OF ECONOMIC ACTIVITY (US MARINE ADMINISTRATION (MARAD).  THIS WORK WILL BENEFIT US BUSINESSES AND CONSUMERS WHO ARE DEPENDENT UPON IMPORTS BY HELPING TO ENSURE THE LONG-TERM STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF STEEL PIPE PILES IN SEISMIC AREAS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO SUPPORT STATE/LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, FIRE RESPONSE ENTITIES, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN DEVELOPING THEIR RESPONSE STRATEGIES TO WUI OR SIMILAR NO-NOTICE EVACUATION EVENTS FROM NATURAL HAZARDS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROPOSAL WILL COMBINE HUMAN BEHAVIOR, RELEVANT FEATURES OF THE COMMUNITY, AND CHARACTERISTICS OF THE WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE FIRE THREATS FOR SITUATIONS THAT RESULT IN SHORT- OR NO-NOTICE EVACUATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL USE AGENT-BASED MODELING, FIRE DYNAMICS MODELING, AND EVACUATION MODELING WITHIN A SEMANTIC MODEL. THE RESEARCH WILL LEVERAGE THE UNIQUE NIST DATA SET FROM THE CAMP FIRE THAT INCLUDE FIREFIGHTING SURVEY DATA, GIS DATA, CELL PHONE (LOCATION) DATA, AND OTHER COMMUNICATIONS DATA. THE SEMANTIC MODELING FRAMEWORK IS HIGHLY NOVEL AND COULD BE A TRANSFORMATIVE APPROACH TO INVESTIGATING THESE INTERACTIONS. THE PROPOSED FRAMEWORK WILL BE DESIGNED TO EVALUATE DIFFERENT COMMUNITY ARCHETYPES. A NEW WUI FIRE MODEL WILL CAPTURE UNIQUE FEATURES FOR WUI FIRE SPREAD, WHICH IS IMPORTANT AS WUI FIRE MODELING IS A CRITICAL UNFILLED NEED FOR THE INDUSTRY.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL SIMULATE FIRE HARDENING AND EVACUATION STRATEGIES TO ESTABLISH A POLICY EVALUATION FRAMEWORK THAT IS ACCESSIBLE AND USEFUL TO POLICYMAKERS AND THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE ADVANCEMENT OF CONCEPTS SUCH AS CONNECTIVITY, ACCESSIBILITY, RELIABILITY, RESILIENCY, AND VULNERABILITY, AMONG OTHERS AS THEY RELATE TO WUI. THE RESEARCH WILL FACILITATE STATE GOVERNMENTS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN DEVELOPING THEIR EMERGENCY RESPONSE STRATEGIES FOR ADDRESSING NO-NOTICE WILDFIRES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US CITIZENS IN AREAS AT RISK FROM WILDFIRES AND THE PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICIALS CHARGED WITH CITIZEN SAFETY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: HIS PROJECT WILL USE LARGE EDDY SIMULATION (LES) MODELS TO PRODUCE A DATABASE OF HURRICANE BOUNDARY LAYER (HBL) WINDS OVER OCEAN AND HOMOGENEOUS LAND, CHARACTERIZE THE TURBULENT STRUCTURE OF HBL WINDS, AND CHARACTERIZE HOW COASTAL MORPHOLOGY AFFECTS HBL WINDS DURING LANDFALL. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: HURRICANE MODELS MAKE CRUDE ASSUMPTIONS ABOUT THE SHAPE AND ENERGY CASCADE IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER, A CRITICAL REQUIREMENT FOR FORECASTING THE STRENGTH, DIRECTION, AND SPEED OF US HURRICANES.  THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE USE OF A NOVEL HIGH-FIDELITY HURRICANE SIMULATION FRAMEWORK TO I) CHARACTERIZE THE TURBULENT STRUCTURE OF HURRICANE WINDS OVER HOMOGENEOUS LAND AND OCEANS II) DETERMINE HOW COASTAL AND URBAN BUILDINGS AND INFRASTRUCTURE RESPOND TO EXTREME WIND GUSTS, AND III) PROPOSE IMPROVED FORMULAS FOR THE EVALUATION OF WIND LOADS ON BUILDINGS AND INFRASTRUCTURE DURING HURRICANE EVENTS IN VARYING EXPOSURE CONDITIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PRODUCTS FROM THIS PROJECT INCLUDE A DATABASE OF TIME-VARYING 3-D WIND FIELDS FROM HURRICANE WINDS INTERACTING WITH IDEALIZED BUT REPRESENTATIVE URBAN AND COASTAL ENVIRONMENTS, ALONG ANALYTIC FORMULAS THAT DESCRIBE THE DEPENDENCY OF QUANTITIES OF INTEREST FROM A RESILIENCE PERSPECTIVE ON SYSTEM PARAMETERS. PRODUCTS AND FINDINGS FROM THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVED HURRICANE LOSS ESTIMATION, QUANTIFICATION OF WIND HAZARDS FOR WIND ENERGY APPLICATIONS, QUANTIFY REALISTIC DESIGN LOADS PERFORMANCE-BASED DESIGN, AND IMPROVE WEATHER FORECASTING MODELS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT US CITIZENS A AT RISK OF HURRICANES IN COASTAL COMMUNITIES AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE OFFICIALS CHARGED WITH THE SAFETY OF AT-RISK COASTAL COMMUNITIES.  THIS RESEARCH IS ALIGNED WITH NIST WIND ENGINEERING AND NATIONAL WINDSTORM IMPACT REDUCTION PROGRAM OBJECTIVE TO DEVELOP NOVEL METHODS FOR HIGH-RESOLUTION MODELING OF METEOROLOGICAL PHENOMENA TO IMPROVE UNDERSTANDING OF EFFECTS OF HURRICANE HAZARD RELEVANT TO WIND AND STRUCTURAL ENGINEERING RISK ASSESSMENT, ANALYSIS, AND DESIGN (WIND LOADS ON STRUCTURES).SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL ESTABLISH GEOGRAPHIC RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN CLIMATE CHANGE AND CASCADING INFRASTRUCTURE FAILURES AND IDENTIFY THE BEST PRACTICES FOR PREVENT CASCADING FAILURE MODES FOR INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS EXPOSED TO WINDSTORMS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: INFRASTRUCTURE INTERDEPENDENCIES ARE POORLY UNDERSTOOD AND THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE THE WELL-DEVELOPED ?SAFE-TO-FAIL? DESIGN APPROACH IN A NOVEL WAY TO HARDEN INFRASTRUCTURE INTERDEPENDENCIES IN SUCH A WAY AS TO MITIGATE THE LIKELIHOOD OF CASCADING FAILURES.  ?SAFE-TO-FAIL? DESIGN STRATEGIES ARE SOLUTIONS THAT ALLOW INFRASTRUCTURE TO FAIL IN ITS ABILITY TO CARRY OUT ITS PRIMARY FUNCTION BUT CONTROL THE CONSEQUENCES OF THE FAILURE.  THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A NOVEL MODELING FRAMEWORK TO SIMULATE THE LONG-TERM PERFORMANCE OF INTERDEPENDENT INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS DIFFERENT WINDSTORM DESIGN SCENARIOS UNDER CURRENT AND FUTURE CLIMATE CONDITIONS.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND TEST THE MODEL FOCUSING ON THE ROADWAY SYSTEM AND ITS DEPENDENCIES WITH THE STORMWATER AND POWER SYSTEMS OF THE CITY OF PHOENIX, AZ.  A TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE WILL BE ESTABLISHED AND CONSULTED THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL TRAIN STAKEHOLDERS ON THE UTILITY OF SAFE-TO-FAIL SOLUTIONS THROUGH AN ONLINE INTERACTIVE PLATFORM, WHICH WILL ALLOW USERS TO SIMULATE INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEMS UNDER NOVEL SAFE-TO-FAIL DESIGN SCENARIOS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: US CITIZENS IN AREAS AT RISK FROM WINDSTORMS AND THE PUBLIC / PRIVATE UTILITIES IMPACTED BY WINDSTORMS AND CROSS-UTILITY INTERDEPENDENCIES.  THIS PROJECT ALIGNS WITH WIND ENGINEERING GOALS IN THE NATIONAL WINDSTORM IMPACT REDUCTION PROGRAM TO HELP REDUCE LOSSES AND SPEED RECOVERY FROM WINDSTORMS.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A FRAMEWORK TO INFORM DECISION MAKING ON RETROFITTING INDIVIDUAL COLUMNS, OR GROUPS OF COLUMNS, WITH FIBER REINFORCED POLYMERS (FRP) IN NONDUCTILE REINFORCED CONCRETE (RC) BUILDINGS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: WITH THE SUPPORT OF AN INDUSTRY PANEL, THE INVESTIGATORS FIRST PLAN TO DEVELOP A MINIMUM OF THREE PROTOTYPE RC NONDUCTILE FRAME STRUCTURES. THE PROTOTYPE STRUCTURES WILL BE EVALUATED THROUGH INCREMENTAL DYNAMIC ANALYSIS IN THEIR UNRETROFITTED AND RETROFITTED CONDITIONS. THE PROJECT WILL NEXT CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS IN AREAS IDENTIFIED AS HAVING LIMITED EXPERIMENTAL DATA UNDERLYING THE BUILDING CODE PROVISIONS ? SPECIFICALLY, A SET OF TWELVE LABORATORY TESTS THAT STUDY THE IMPACT OF FRP RETROFIT, COLUMN CROSS-SECTION SHAPE, AND AXIAL LOAD RATIO, ALL UP TO THE POINT OF AXIAL LOAD FAILURE. THE TEST DATA WILL ALSO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF NONLINEAR MODELS FOR THE RETROFITTED COLUMNS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESULTS LEAD TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW PERFORMANCE-BASED DESIGN CRITERIA FOR FRP RETROFITTED COLUMNS WHICH ARE NOT CURRENTLY AVAILABLE IN ASCE 41. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITIES WITH DAMAGED OR AGING REINFORCED CONCRETE BUILDINGS WILL BENEFIT BY HAVING A MORE CERTAIN PROCESS FOR RETROFITTING AND IMPROVING THE BUILDINGS THAT WOULD OTHERWISE BE VULNERABLE TO COLLAPSE IN AN EARTHQUAKE.  THIS WILL MAKE CITIZENS SAFER AND COMMUNITIES MORE RESILIENT.  THE PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO NIST EARTHQUAKE ENGINEERING AND NATIONAL EARTHQUAKE HAZARD REDUCTION PROGRAM PRIORITIES BY IMPROVING THE SCIENTIFIC BASIS FOR BUILDING CODE PROVISIONS FOR RETROFIT AND REPAIR OF NONDUCTILE CONCRETE BUILDINGS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE THE USE OF ULTRA-HIGH PERFORMANCE CONCRETE (UHPC) WITH GLASS FIBER REINFORCED POLYMER (GFRP) UNDER ANTICIPATED WAVE EXPOSURE AND HURRICANES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TRADITIONAL STEEL-REINFORCED CONCRETE SEAWALLS PERFORM POORLY UNDER HURRICANE LOADING DUE TO DETERIORATION OF THE REINFORCEMENT THROUGH CORROSION AND SEA/WAVE EXPOSURE. THE SCOPE INCLUDES (A) ANALYSIS AND TESTING OF DIFFERENT UHPC FORMULATIONS, EVALUATION OF THE DESIGN AGAINST CONVENTIONAL REINFORCED CONCRETE WALLS, (B) COMPARISON OF THEIR BEHAVIOR UNDER WAVE IMPACTS IN A WAVE-WIND TANK, (C) DEVELOPMENT OF DESIGN GUIDELINES FOR BUILDING CODES AND STANDARDS, (D) REPAIR STRATEGIES FOR EXISTING SEAWALLS USING UHPC AND GFRP, AND (E) FIELD TESTING USING A COASTAL COMMUNITY AS A TEST SITE. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IF SUCCESSFUL, THE PROJECT WILL LEAD TO MORE DURABLE AND RELIABLE STRUCTURES UNDER EVENTS SUCH AS HURRICANES. UHPC AND GFRP ARE ANTICIPATED TO EXHIBIT SUPERIOR REAL-WORLD PERFORMANCE COMPARED TO CONVENTIONAL REINFORCED CONCRETE SEAWALLS BECAUSE OF THEIR HIGHER STRENGTH, RESISTANCE TO ABRASION AND IMPACT, AND POTENTIAL OF INCREASING THE LIFE SPAN OF THE STRUCTURE.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: CONSEQUENTLY, KNOWLEDGE FROM THIS STUDY CAN BE DIRECTLY APPLICABLE AND PERFORMANCE OF THE STRUCTURE WOULD BE OF GREAT INTEREST TO GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES, LOCAL COMMUNITIES, AND THE INDUSTRY AS WE PREPARE TO MANAGE SEA LEVEL RISE AND INTENSIFYING HURRICANES IN THE US.  THIS PROPOSAL SUPPORTS THE WIND ENGINEERING AND NATIONAL WINDSTORM IMPACT REDUCTION PROGRAM GOALS OF REDUCING WINDSTORM LOSSES BY SHOWING THE IMPROVED EFFICACY OF INNOVATIVE SEAWALLS TO PROTECT COASTAL COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY STORM SURGE FROM HURRICANES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL CONDUCT NOVEL EXPERIMENTS THROUGH THE COMBINED ACTION OF WIND, STORM SURGE, AND WAVES ON STRUCTURES BY UNDERTAKING A MULTI-SCALE PHYSICAL TESTING IN THE SUSTAIN EXPERIMENTAL FACILITY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI.   ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL COMPARE ANALYTICAL AND NUMERICAL WIND, STORM-SURGE AND WAVE LOAD MODELS; CONDUCT PHYSICAL TESTING OF SELECTED BUILDING TYPOLOGIES AT THREE RELEVANT SCALES UNDER THE UNCOUPLED AND COUPLED ACTION OF WIND, STORM-SURGE AND WAVES; EVALUATE A WIDE RANGE OF TEST PARAMETERS - WIND SPEED, WAVE FREQUENCY AND AMPLITUDE, SURGE HEIGHT AND BUILDING TYPOLOGIES ? TO ALLOW FOR SITE-SPECIFIC EFFECTS OF BATHYMETRY AND BUILDING TYPES THEREBY MAKING THE TEST RESULTS APPLICABLE TO A BROAD SPECTRUM OF COASTAL REGIONS AND CONSTRUCTION; AND COMPARE RESULTS WITH DESIGN LOAD MODELS FROM BUILDING CODES AND STANDARDS FOR COASTAL STRUCTURES PROVIDED BY ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS AMERICAN SOCIETY OF CIVIL ENGINEERS (ASCE), INTERNATIONAL CODE COUNCIL (ICC) AND FEDERAL EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AGENCY (FEMA).EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL MAKE THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT LESS PRONE TO THE COUPLED ACTION OF WINDS, STORM-SURGE AND WAVES BY PROPOSING SCIENCE-BASED CHANGES TO NATIONAL MODEL BUILDING CODES AND STANDARDS BASED ON EXPERIMENTAL AND ANALYTICAL PROJECT RESULTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BY 2050, 65% OF THE WORLD POPULATION WILL LIVE IN CITIES AND URBAN AREAS, MANY OF THOSE BEING COASTAL COMMUNITIES SUSCEPTIBLE TO DAMAGES FROM TROPICAL STORMS AND HURRICANES, WHICH ARE LIKELY TO BE EXACERBATED BY CLIMATE CHANGE.  RESIDENTS OF THESE COASTAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED BUILDING CODES AND STANDARDS.  THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT NIST WIND ENGINEERING AND NATIONAL WINDSTORM IMPACT REDUCTION PROGRAM OBJECTIVES TO QUANTIFY SPATIOTEMPORAL EFFECTS OF WINDSTORM PHENOMENA TO REDUCE US WINDSTORM LOSSES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A NOVEL MEANS TO CHARACTERIZE STRESS FIELDS THAT DEVELOP DURING THE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING OF ENGINEERING ALLOYS AS THEY FORM. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS WORK WILL CREATE A SERIES OF SURROGATE MODELS THAT WILL BE CAPABLE OF DETERMINING METRICS DESCRIBING STRESS DISTRIBUTIONS CONTAINED WITHIN DIFFRACTION VOLUMES DURING IN-SITU ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING EXPERIMENTS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY PERFORMING A SERIES OF THERMODYNAMIC CALCULATIONS TO DETERMINE THE TEMPERATURE-DEPENDENT PROPERTIES OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING MATERIALS THROUGH COOLING.  THESE PROPERTIES WILL BE COMBINED WITH HEAT- AND MASS-TRANSFER MODELS SIMULATING THE IN-SITU DIFFRACTION EXPERIMENTS TO PROVIDE INPUTS FOR A SERIES OF DIFFRACTION SIMULATIONS.  THE SURROGATE MODELS WILL BE TRAINED TO RELATE DIFFRACTION DATA TO VARIOUS METRICS OF INDIVIDUAL STRESS COMPONENT DISTRIBUTIONS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE ABILITY TO CHARACTERIZE SUBSURFACE STRESS DISTRIBUTIONS WILL PROVIDE THE CRITICAL DATA NECESSARY TO CONTROL THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESIDUAL STRESS, AND IMPORTANTLY, AID EFFORTS TO QUALIFY AM PROCESSES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE TO THE PUBLIC. THIS PROPOSED RESEARCH PRODUCES A NOVEL APPROACH TO STRESS CHARACTERIZATION, INCLUDING STATE-OF-THE-ART PHYSICS-BASED MODELING AND MACHINE LEARNING, THAT WILL BE A MAJOR CONTRIBUTION TO EFFORTS IN CONTROLLING RESIDUAL STRESS DURING THE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESS AND QUALIFYING ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSES. THE RESEARCH PROPOSED HERE WILL BE EXTREMELY VALUABLE IN UNDERSTANDING AND CONTROLLING THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESIDUAL STRESS IN ADDITIVELY MANUFACTURED COMPONENTS, ACCELERATING THE WIDESPREAD ADOPTION OF ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGIES.  FURTHERMORE, SOFTWARE DEVELOPED AS PART OF THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO BE A VALUABLE ASSET FOR THE LARGE RESEARCH COMMUNITY PERFORMING THERMOMECHANICAL LOADING EXPERIMENTS AT SYNCHROTRON AND NEUTRON SOURCES.  ALSO, THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROPOSAL WILL ALLOW SIGNIFICANT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT THROUGH FURTHER TRAINING OF A POST-DOCTORAL RESEARCHER AT THE UNIVERSITY.   SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE STATEMENT:  THE PROJECT WILL BUILD A CONSENSUS ON THE INNOVATION NEEDED AND ECONOMIC PATHWAY TO MANUFACTURE CELL-CULTURED MEAT AT COMMERCIAL SCALE.   ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  STAKEHOLDERS WILL BE CONVENED IN THREE WORKSHOPS TO FIRST DEVELOP THE STRATEGIC LANDSCAPE, THEN FOCUS ON SPECIFIC PRIORITIZED TOPIC AREAS, AND FINALLY TO SYNTHESIZE THE ROADMAP ARTICULATING THE 10-YEAR PRIORITIES FOR THE EMERGING TECHNOLOGY SECTOR OF CELLULAR AGRICULTURE.  THE ROADMAP WILL BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH DIFFERENT STAKEHOLDER COMMUNITIES IN THE VALUE CHAIN THROUGH TARGETED OUTREACH USING STRATEGIC PARTNERS TO GENERATE AWARENESS AND ACCEPTANCE OF THE PROJECT GOALS FOR CELLULAR AGRICULTURE.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE PROJECT WILL PRODUCE A 10-YEAR ROADMAP THAT INTEGRATES FUNDAMENTAL SCIENCE, ENABLING TECHNOLOGIES AND SYSTEM-LEVEL ENGINEERING TO DEVELOPMENT OF A SCALABLE MICRO-PRODUCTION PLATFORM OF MEAT USING CELLULAR AGRICULTURE.  POST-AWARD, THE PROJECT TEAM ANTICIPATES DEVELOPING AN ACTION PLAN AND SUSTAINABLE CONSORTIUM AS FOUNDATION FOR A POTENTIAL MANUFACTURING USA INSTITUTE.   INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT ARE THE SMALL COMPANIES, RESEARCHERS, AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ADVANCING CELLULAR AGRICULTURE FOR GREATER FOOD SUPPLY SUSTAINABILITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS FOR TWO CONTRACTS AND ONE SUBRECIPIENT.  THE CONTRACTORS WILL CONDUCT WORKSHOP ACTIVITIES MANAGE WORKSHOP ACTIVITIES AND REPORTING TO THE TEAM.  THE SUBRECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT A TOPIC WORKSHOP ON TRUSTED CELLAGRICULTURE AND PARTICIPATE IN OTHER TOPIC AND SYNTHESIS WORKSHOPS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO FUND ONE PHYSICS INTERN TO WORK VIRTUALLY AT NIST GAITHERSBURG FROM JANUARY 31, 2022, TO DECEMBER 31, 2022, IN THE OFFICE OF ADVANCED MANUFACTURING (OAM).ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CONDUCT RESEARCH AND SYNTHESIZE THAT INFORMATION TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO OAM ON ADDITIONAL OPPORTUNITIES TO ACCOMPLISH THE MANUFACTURING USA PROGRAM GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR INCREASING THE COMPETITIVENESS OF U.S. MANUFACTURING. PROVIDE DATA THAT WILL ENABLE MORE EFFICIENT PROGRAM PLANNING. RESEARCH AND ANALYSES TO SUPPORT PLANNING FOR THE FUTURE NIST-SUPPORTED PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING AND ADVANCED PACKAGING. COORDINATE INFORMATION EXCHANGE WITH THE NIST LABORATORY PROGRAMS AND WITH THE LEADERSHIP OF RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT INSTITUTES ACROSS THE U.S. AND WITH OTHER FEDERAL DEPARTMENTS AND AGENCIES, UNIVERSITIES, STATES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND OTHER PUBLIC AND PRIVATE INSTITUTIONS. WORK WITH OAM AND LEADERS OF THE MANUFACTURING USA INSTITUTES TO PROVIDE DATA AND INFORMATION NEEDED TO SUPPORT NETWORK-WIDE PROGRAMS AND POLICIES TO ADVANCE U.S. MANUFACTURING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE AWARENESS OF SCIENCE POLICY AMONG YOUNG SCIENTISTS BY DIRECTLY ENGAGING THEM IN INTERAGENCY RESEARCH AND POLICIES THAT SUPPORT U.S. ADVANCED MANUFACTURING ACROSS THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME PROVIDING THE STUDENT WITH MEANINGFUL AND CHALLENGING PROJECTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SOCIETY OF PHYSICS STUDENTS, EDUCATION DIVISION OF THE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF PHYSICS, AND NIST WILL ENRICH AND DIVERSIFY THE ORGANIZATIONS¿ PROGRAMS AND SCIENTIFIC ENDEAVORS WHILE BUILDING AWARENESS OF THE POLICY PROCESS THROUGH DIRECT ENGAGEMENT IN THE WORK THAT GOES ON IN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO SUPPORT A COLLABORATIVE PROJECT BETWEEN THE NIST MATERIAL MEASUREMENT LABORATORY AND ENGINEERING LABORATORY THAT SEEKS TO PERFORM RAPID CHARACTERIZATION OF PHASE TRANSITION OF THE ADDITIVE ALUMINUM ALLOY UNDER REALISTIC MANUFACTURING CONDITIONS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHER WILL PARTICIPATE IN ESTABLISHING A METHODOLOGICAL FRAMEWORK BASED ON HIGH-SPEED MEASUREMENTS THAT SEEK TO UNDERSTAND THE PHASE TRANSFORMATION DURING ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING PROCESSING OF ALLOYS, FOCUSING ON ADDITIVE ALUMINUM ALLOYS. THE RESEARCHER WILL PERFORM MEASUREMENTS USING NANOCALORIMETRY, X-RAY DIFFRACTION, ELECTRON MICROSCOPY AND CONDUCT CALCULATIONS USING COMPUTATIONAL THERMODYNAMICS. THE RESEARCHER WILL ANALYZE THE ACQUIRED DATASETS AND DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMBINED METHODOLOGY USING THERMOGRAPHY, NANOCALORIMETRY, X-RAY DIFFRACTION, ELECTRON MICROSCOPY, AND THERMODYNAMIC SIMULATIONS TO INVESTIGATE THE PHASE TRANSFORMATIONS OF ADDITIVE ALUMINUM ALLOYS UNDER HIGHLY NONEQUILIBRIUM CONDITIONS. THE RESEARCHER IS EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE TO ALL ASPECTS OF THIS PROJECT. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: (1) PRODUCING AND INTERPRETING NANOCALORIMETRY DATA ON AT LEAST ONE SURROGATE MODEL ALLOY SYSTEM THAT PROVIDE THERMAL INSIGHT REGARDING THE ALLOYS PHASE TRANSFORMATION UNDER VARIOUS COOLING SPEEDS; (2) PERFORMING MULTI-LENGTH SCALE MICROSTRUCTURAL EVALUATION USING X-RAY AND ELECTRON MICROSCOPY METHODS TO PROVIDE INSIGHT REGARDING THE PHASE PRESENT UNDER DIFFERENT PROCESSING CONDITIONS; AND (3) CONDUCTING THERMODYNAMICS AND KINETICS ANALYSIS TO PREDICT AND ELUCIDATE THE PHASE TRANSFORMATION PATHWAY AND KINETICS. THE RESULTS, ONCE CONCRETELY ESTABLISHED, ARE EXPECTED TO BE DISSEMINATED TO A BROAD AUDIENCE IN THE FORMS OF PRESENTATION AND PUBLICATION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE METHODOLOGY AND DATA GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BENEFIT RESEARCHERS WORKING WITH ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING OF ALUMINUM ALLOYS AND OTHER ALLOYS BY PROVIDING INSIGHTS REGARDING THE FUNDAMENTALLY CRITICAL, PERFORMANCE-DETERMINING PHASE TRANSFORMATION PATHWAY AND KINETICS. THE DATA CAN ALSO HELP THE ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY DEVELOP PROCESSING STRATEGIES THAT LEAD TO MORE RELIABLE AND ROBUST FABRICATION METHODS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPLEMENT, TEST, AND MEASURE AGILITY FOR INDUSTRIAL ROBOTIC SYSTEMS (PHYSICAL AND SIMULATED). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THREE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED: 1) AUGMENTING THE DEFINITION OF AGILITY AND DEVELOPING TEST METHODS AND METRICS TO MEASURE AGILITY, 2) TESTING AGILE ROBOTIC SYSTEMS IN SIMULATED AND PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENTS USING THE OUTPUT FROM THE PREVIOUS OBJECTIVE, AND 3) IMPLEMENTING MACHINE LEARNING-BASED APPROACHES TO GENERATE ENVIRONMENTS PROCEDURALLY.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ACCOMPLISHING THESE OBJECTIVES IS EXPECTED TO ALLOW MANUFACTURERS TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES SUCH AS 1) SWAPPING ROBOTS IN AND OUT WITHOUT INTRODUCING EXTENDED DOWNTIME OR REPROGRAMMING,  2) FAST REPLANNING AND RETASKING WHEN NEW PRODUCT DESIGNS ARE PROVIDED, AND 3) RESPONDING TO  CHANGING ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS (E.G., NON-FIXTURED TRAY MOVES).INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: SMALL AND MEDIUM MANUFACTURERS, LARGE MANUFACTURERS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED ROBOT AGILITY; ROBOT SYSTEMS INTEGRATORS WILL BENEFIT FROM MORE SEAMLESS INTEGRATION OF ROBOTIC SYSTEMS, ROBOT VENDORS WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE MORE AGILE ROBOTSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

NIST-IMA POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP ON ANALYSIS OF MACHINE LEARNINGPURPOSE: MACHINE LEARNING AND DATA SCIENCE ARE OF INCREASING IMPORTANCE, NOT ONLY TO A BROAD ARRAY OF INDUSTRIES BUT ALSO TO MISSION CRITICAL SCIENCE AGENCIES.  HOWEVER, A DEEP UNDERSTANDING OF THE OPPORTUNITIES AND LIMITATIONS OF THESE TOOLS IS STILL NEEDED. THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL EXPLORE THESE LIMITATIONS AND OPPORTUNITIES WITH CUTTING-EDGE MATHEMATICAL AND STATISTICAL METHODS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A TWO-YEAR POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP, JOINTLY MENTORED BY MATHEMATICIANS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA AND NIST. THE FELLOW WILL FOCUS ON TOPICS IN THE FOUNDATIONS OF MACHINE LEARNING, SUCH AS UNDERSTANDING PERFORMANCE ISSUES OF GRAPH NEURAL NETWORKS, DEVELOPING SENSITIVITY ANALYSIS FOR DEEP LEARNING, AND PROVIDING ROBUST GENERATIVE METHODS IN MACHINE LEARNING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE MATHEMATICAL FOUNDATION NEEDED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF TRUST AND CONFIDENCE IN MACHINE LEARNING APPLICATIONS. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: AI SYSTEMS USED FOR DECISION MAKING NEED TO BE ABLE TO JUSTIFY THEIR DECISIONS, THAT IS, THEIR RECOMMENDATIONS NEED TO BE EXPLAINABLE. SUCH ABILITIES REMAIN RARE AMONG ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) SYSTEMS TODAY, WHICH THREATENS TO STYMIE THEIR ADOPTION IN MANY APPLICATIONS. NIST HAS DEVELOPED A NEW RESEARCH PROGRAM AIMED AT IMPROVING TRUST IN AI SYSTEMS. IMPROVING TRUST WILL BENEFIT BOTH THE DEVELOPERS AND USERS OF FUTURE AI SYSTEMS. THE RESEARCH PROPOSED BY THIS APPLICANT WILL CONTRIBUTE DIRECTLY TO THIS GOAL. THIS WORK WILL ALSO PLAY ROLE IN EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF APPLIED MATHEMATICIANS THROUGH CUTTING EDGE RESEARCH EXPERIENCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPLORE AND DEVELOP METHODS FOR OBFUSCATING DATA FROM POPULATIONS; THAT IS, DATA DRAWN FROM ALGORITHMS, MODELS, OR OTHER GENERATIVE MECHANISMS. DEMONSTRABLY SUCCESSFUL POPULATION OBFUSCATION CAN PROTECT PROPRIETARY OR CLASSIFIED INFORMATION CONTAINED IN A POPULATION WHILE OTHERWISE FAITHFULLY RENDERING THOSE DATA FOR, FOR EXAMPLE, TRAINING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCES, MEDICAL, PUBLIC HEALTH, AND SOCIAL SCIENCE RESEARCH, AND SYSTEM MODELING AND SIMULATION.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DEVELOP THE THEORY OF POPULATION OBFUSCATION, INCLUDING MATHEMATICAL FORMALISM FOR MARKED POPULATIONS, ISOLATION MAPS, REDACTION, AND MASKING. PUT THE NOTIONS OF WEAK AND STRICT INHERENT MASKING ON A SOUND CONCEPTUAL FOUNDATION. CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF MASKED POPULATIONS USING VARIATIONAL AUTO-ENCODERS AND GENERATIVE ADVERSARIAL NETWORKS.CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF MASKED POPULATIONS USING OPTIMAL TRANSPORT MAPS.CONDUCT EXPERIMENTS FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF (INHERENTLY) MASKED POPULATIONS USING CONTROLLED POPULATION CONSTRUCTION.IDENTIFY/DEVELOP METROLOGY TOOLS (MEASURES OF DISTRIBUTION SEPARATION) FOR EFFICACIOUSLY AND EXPEDITIOUSLY ASSESSING POPULATION MASKING PROCEDURES, AND USE THESE TOOLS TO MAP OUT THE RESOURCES NEEDED FOR AND THE LIMITS OF POPULATION OBFUSCATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL DEVELOP SOLUTIONS FOR POPULATION OBFUSCATION; THAT IS, IT WILL PROVIDE METHOD(S) FOR PRODUCING SYNTHETIC DATA THAT OBSCURES OR HIDES SENSITIVE INFORMATION. THE PROBLEM STUDIED HERE IS NOVEL IN THAT IT ADDRESSES OBFUSCATION---MASKING AND REDACTION---FOR A POPULATION, RATHER THAN FOR JUST FIXED, FINITE DATA SAMPLES. SOLUTION(S) TO THIS PROBLEM WILL PROVIDE DATA SCIENTISTS AN ABILITY TO CREATE UNLIMITED SYNTHETIC OBFUSCATED DATA FOR PURPOSES SUCH AS SIMULATION, TRAINING, AND RESEARCH. IN ADDITION TO OFFERING POPULATION MODELS FOR SYNTHETIC DATA GENERATION, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE USERS WITH MEASURES THAT QUANTIFY THE DIFFICULTY OF THE OBFUSCATION TASK AND THE QUALITY OF THE SYNTHETIC DATA, QUALITY MEANING BOTH HOW WELL THE CONSTRUCTED POPULATION RETAINS THE REQUISITE PROPERTIES OF THE UNOBFUSCATED POPULATION AND HOW WELL THE SENSITIVE FEATURES OF THE POPULATION ARE MASKED. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESEARCHERS, SCIENTISTS, AND ENGINEERS FROM NIST AND BEYOND SEEKING ACCESS TO DATA FROM GENERATIVE MODELS, FOR SYSTEM SIMULATION, TESTING, AND EVALUATION AND FOR TRAINING ORGANIZATIONS, COMPLEX ENGINEERED SYSTEMS, AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: NONE.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO CONTINUE WORK TOWARDS DEVELOPING AN OBJECTIVE IMAGE ANALYSIS METHOD FOR THC DETERMINATION USING THE 4-AMINOPHENOL TEST IN FORENSIC LABORATORIES. SPECIFICALLY, THIS GRANT SEEKS TO COMPLETE A PILOT WITH SELECT PRACTICING LABORATORIES TO DETERMINE THE UTILITY OF THE PREVIOUSLY DEVELOPED IMAGE ANALYSIS METHOD IN AN OPERATIONAL ENVIRONMENT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RESEARCHERS WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:1) DISTRIBUTE NIDA REFERENCE SAMPLES; 2) COLLECT REAL-WORLD USER IMAGES AND DATA FROM THE 4-AP TEST FOR OPTIMIZING THRESHOLD VALUES GENERATED PREVIOUSLY IN A CONTROLLED LABORATORY SETTING; 3) COLLECT IMAGES AND DATA WITH MINIMAL INFLUENCE ON THE; 4) DISTRIBUTE GUIDANCE AND PROCEDURES FOR OPERATING THE 4-AP TEST AND COLLECTING IMAGES FOR THE OBJECTIVE ANALYSIS METHOD TO LABORATORIES; 5) DEPLOY OF GUI AND METHODS FOR PILOT INTERLABORATORY STUDY; AND 6) SOLICIT USER FEEDBACK ON THE GUI OPERATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPLETION OF THE PROPOSED PILOT STUDY WILL PROVIDE KEY DATA FROM FORENSIC PRACTITIONERS UTILIZING THE TEST METHOD IN AN OPERATIONAL ENVIRONMENT. RESULTS FROM THIS STUDY WILL GUIDE ANY NECESSARY METHOD REFINEMENTS PRIOR TO IMPLEMENTATION AND TESTING WITHIN FORENSIC SEIZED DRUG CASEWORK AMONG A LARGER VALIDATION AND INTERLABORATORY STUDY (?8 PARTICIPATING LABORATORIES).INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FORENSIC SCIENCE COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE; THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEMSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

ALGORITHMIC DEVELOPMENT FOR HARDWARE AI COPROCESSORSPURPOSE: NEUROMORPHIC COMPUTATION REFERS TO A NON-VON-NEUMANN ARCHITECTURE INSPIRED BY THE STUDY OF BIOLOGICAL NERVOUS SYSTEMS. SUCH PROCESSORS HAVE GREAT PROMISE FOR ACCELERATING CERTAIN TYPES OF COMPUTATIONS WHILE REQUIRING SIGNIFICANTLY LESS POWER. AN IMPORTANT EXAMPLE IS MACHINE LEARNING, WHERE THE NEUROMORPHIC PROCESSOR CAN EFFICIENTLY IMPLEMENT A NEURAL NETWORK. TRAINING IS THE MOST ENERGY AND TIME INTENSIVE PART OF MACHINE LEARNING, AND SUCH TRAINING IS TYPICALLY DONE ON CONVENTIONAL COMPUTERS. THUS, HARDWARE THAT CAN TRAIN NEURAL NETWORKS EFFICIENTLY AND ACCURATELY IS SORELY NEEDED. THIS PROJECT AIMS TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE BY PROVIDING A NEW APPROACH TO TRAIN THE MOST WELL-DEVELOPED TYPES OF NEW ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) HARDWARE ACCELERATORS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TEAM WILL DESIGN, CHARACTERIZE, AND TEST HARDWARE-AWARE DECOMPOSITION ALGORITHMS FOR COMPUTATIONS ON MATRIX MANIFOLDS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SINGULAR VALUE DECOMPOSITION (SVD) AND NON-NEGATIVE MATRIX FACTORIZATION. SUCH COMPUTATIONS REPRESENT COMPUTE-INTENSIVE PARTS OF MANY AI ALGORITHMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP EXTREMELY EFFICIENT HARDWARE-BASED COMPRESSION STRATEGIES FOR DATA ANALYSIS AND COMPUTATION. SUCCESS IN THIS PROJECT WOULD MAKE IT FEASIBLE TO CREATE AI SYSTEMS THAT CAN CONTINUE TO LEARN WHILE DEPLOYED. FURTHERMORE, SIMILAR COMPUTATIONS ARE REQUIRED FOR DYNAMICAL AND STREAMING SENSOR ENVIRONMENTS ARISING, FOR EXAMPLE, IN INTERNET OF THINGS APPLICATIONS. SUCCESS IN THIS PROJECT COULD OPEN NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR SMART DEVICES IN THE FUTURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE PROPOSED ALGORITHMS AND ADVANCED HARDWARE COULD BENEFIT A WIDE RANGE OF INDUSTRIES INCLUDING DEVELOPERS OF RESOURCE-CONSTRAINED INTERNET OF THINGS APPLICATIONS, MEDICAL IMPLANTABLE DEVICES, AND EDGE-SENSOR COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS. THE PROJECT PROVIDES NIST WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO INVESTIGATE HARDWARE/SOFTWARE CO-DESIGN FOR EMERGING AI HARDWARE. IT THEREBY CONTRIBUTES A RESEARCH COMPONENT TO THE NATIONAL PRIORITY CENTERED ON INVESTMENT IN US-BASED SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING. FINALLY, THIS WORK WILL ALSO PLAY A ROLE IN EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF COMPUTER SCIENTISTS THROUGH CUTTING EDGE RESEARCH EXPERIENCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO: 1. ESTABLISH A REALISTIC DATA SET BASED ON LIVE EXERCISE DATA;  2. CONDUCT A PRIZE CHALLENGE ASSEMBLING THE BEST OF INDUSTRY AND ACADEMIA; 3. GAIN INSIGHTS INTO DATA NEEDS OF THE PUBLIC SAFETY COMMUNITY WHILE UNLOCKING UNDERSTANDING OF SENSOR CAPABILITIES IN ADVANCED WIRELESS NETWORK SETTINGS; AND 4. PROVIDE INNOVATORS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO DESIGN, DEVELOP, TEST, AND DEMONSTRATE USABLE SYSTEMS FOR DATA VISUALIZATION, SITUATIONAL AWARENESS, AND DECISION SUPPORT DURING LIVE EMERGENCY RESPONSE SCENARIOS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE LARGE TASK TO BE PERFORMED IS THE DEVELOPING AND HOSTING A PRIZE COMPETITION; THIS PROJECT AS BEEN BROKEN INTO SUBTASKS THREE SUBTASKS: IOT DATA COLLECTION, DATA SET COLLECTION AND MANAGEMENT, AND PRIZE COMPETITION MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THIS EXPECTED OUTCOME IS THAT THE COMPETITION PRODUCE A SOLUTION FOR 1. ACCURATELY INTEGRATING  DATA FROM MULTIPLE SOURCES TO SUPPORT FIRST RESPONDERS WITH REAL]TIME DATA AND 2. DELIVERING DISTILLED, ACTIONABLE NAVIGATION INFORMATION TO BOTH FIRST RESPONDERS AND OPERATIONS PERSONNEL.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FIRST RESPONDERS ARE THE PRIMARY INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO US IGNITE.

PURPOSE: 

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO APPLY AB INITIO COMPUTATIONAL METHODS TO CHARACTERIZE THE INTERACTIONS OF IONS IN SOLUTIONS AND AT ELECTROCHEMICAL INTERFACES TO ASSIST IN DEVELOPING THE DIELECTRIC-ACOUSTIC SPECTROSCOPY FOR INDUSTRIAL CHEMICAL SEPARATION TECHNOLOGIES. 



ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: 

THE RESEARCHERS WILL PERFORM DFT CALCULATIONS OF ELECTROLYTES IN WATER AND CREATE MACHINE-LEARNED FORCE FIELDS FOR THOSE SYSTEMS. THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: EXPLORING THE DEPENDENCE OF PRESSURE, TEMPERATURE, AND CONCENTRATION ON THE COMPUTED DIELECTRIC SPECTRA, THE ION PAIR FORMATION, AND THE HYDRATION OF THE IONS; EVALUATING THE CHOICE OF DFT FUNCTIONAL FOR ACCURATELY CAPTURING THE DIELECTRIC PROPERTIES OF SOLUTIONS; DETERMINING THE ORIGINS OF PEAKS IN EXPERIMENTAL AND SIMULATED DIELECTRIC SPECTRA. THE RESEARCH WILL EXPAND TO ELECTROLYTE MIXTURES AND EXPLORE THE NON-ADDITIVE EFFECTS OF MULTIPLE ELECTROLYTE MIXTURES. COMPUTATIONAL METHODS WILL INCLUDE THE ELECTRONIC STRUCTURE METHODS BEYOND DFT, SUCH AS THE RANDOM PHASE APPROXIMATION (RPA), TO PRODUCE MORE ACCURATE AB INITIO DATA FOR MACHINE-LEARNED FORCE FIELDS. MANUSCRIPTS WILL BE PREPARED DURING THE RESEARCH YEARS AND RESULTS WILL BE PUBLISHED IN PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS.



EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 

THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP COMPUTATIONAL METHODS TO PRODUCE ACCURATE DESCRIPTION OF DIELECTRIC SPECTRA OF CHEMICAL SOLUTIONS FOR LIQUID-PHASE SEPARATION PROCESSES, AND TO DECONVOLUTE THOSE SPECTRA INTO CONTRIBUTIONS BY DIFFERENT SPECIES OR PROCESSES IN SOLUTION INCLUDING HOW PRESSURE, CONCENTRATION, AND TEMPERATURE CHANGE THE COMPUTED DIELECTRIC SPECTRA. 



INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  

THE U.S. CHEMICAL INDUSTRY WILL BENEFIT FROM APPLYING THE NEWLY DEVELOPED DIELECTRIC-ACOUSTIC SPECTROSCOPY TO DESIGN AND IMPROVE CHEMICAL SEPARATION TECHNOLOGIES BASED ON OPTIMIZED PROCESSES OF ION PAIRING AND SPECIES HYDRATION IN CHEMICAL SOLUTIONS. 



SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: 

THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES OF JILA, THE NIST-UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO BOULDER (UCB) JOINT RESEARCH INSTITUTE. JILA CONDUCTS RESEARCH TO ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING OF QUANTUM PHYSICS THAT PROVIDES THE FOUNDATION FOR QUANTUM-ENHANCED PRECISION MEASUREMENT, QUANTUM COMPUTATION AND SIMULATION, AND QUANTUM NETWORKING, FOR APPLICATIONS IN CHEMISTRY, BIOLOGY, AND DIVERSE ASPECTS OF FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICS. UCB PERSONNEL WILL PERFORM THIS RESEARCH IN CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH STAFF MEMBERS OF THE NIST PHYSICAL MEASUREMENT LABORATORY (PML) WHO ARE ENGAGED AS JILA FELLOWS.

ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: RESEARCH ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED IN THE AREAS OF QUANTUM INFORMATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY; ATOMIC, MOLECULAR, AND OPTICAL PHYSICS; MANY-BODY QUANTUM PHYSICS; NANOSCIENCE; CHEMICAL PHYSICS; AND BIOPHYSICS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, FOR EXAMPLE, EXPERIMENTAL INVESTIGATIONS OF FUNDAMENTAL QUANTUM SYSTEMS, DEVELOPMENT OF MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUES THAT EXPLOIT QUANTUM BEHAVIOR, AND DEVELOPMENT OF PRECISION MEASUREMENT TOOLS.  JILA WILL CONTINUE PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT PRESTIGIOUS FELLOWSHIPS FOR THE ?BEST AND BRIGHTEST? GRADUATE STUDENTS AND POST-DOCTORAL ASSOCIATES AVAILABLE GLOBALLY. JILA WILL ALSO MAINTAIN SEMINARS WITH SPEAKERS OF INTERNATIONAL REPUTATION, AND WILL CONTINUE A ROBUST VISITING FELLOWS PROGRAM TO BRING INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED LEADERS IN QUANTUM SCIENCE TO UCB.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: JILA RESEARCH RESULTS WILL ADVANCE UNDERSTANDING IN THE AREAS OF FUNDAMENTAL QUANTUM PHYSICS, AND QUANTUM INFORMATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY.  IT WILL PROVIDE FOR IMPROVEMENTS TO PRECISION MEASUREMENTS ACROSS A BROAD RANGE OF APPLICATIONS IN PHYSICS, CHEMISTRY, AND BIOLOGY.  A PARTICULAR OUTCOME WILL BE IMPROVED MEASUREMENT OF FUNDAMENTAL CONSTANTS THAT HELP TO TEST FUNDAMENTAL PHYSICAL THEORIES AND THEIR LIMITATIONS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: JILA RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE INNOVATIONS THAT SUPPORT ON-GOING GROWTH OF QUANTUM INDUSTRIES AND THE ASSOCIATED SUPPLY CHAINS.  FOR EXAMPLE, THOSE DEVELOPING QUANTUM COMPUTERS WITH CAPABILITIES FAR EXCEEDING EVEN THE WORLD'S BEST EXISTING SUPERCOMPUTERS.  JILA RESEARCH WILL SUPPORT THE QUANTUM PHYSICS RESEARCH ECOSYSTEM WITH IMPROVED TECHNIQUES, TOOLS, AND ADVANCED KNOWLEDGE. THE STUDENTS AND POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATES SUPPORTED BY JILA WILL PROVIDE A HIGHLY TRAINED WORKFORCE NECESSARY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RAPIDLY DEVELOPING QUANTUM ECONOMY.

PURPOSE: THIS RESEARCH WILL HELP MANUFACTURERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE 3D SURFACE CHARACTERISTICS OF ADDITIVELY MANUFACTURED METAL ALLOYS AND THEIR IMPACTS ON FATIGUE LIFE OF COMPONENTS MADE BY ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING (AM). ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON CHARACTERIZATION AND ANALYSIS OF FOUR COMMONLY USED METAL AM MATERIALS.  THIS RESEARCH WILL BE BROKEN INTO THREE TASKS.  TASK 1 IS TO PERFORM EXPERIMENTS AND ANALYSIS LEADING TO BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF SURFACE FORMATION IN THE ALLOY SYSTEMS.  TASK 2 INVOLVES THE 3D SURFACE CHARACTERIZATION OF THE AM SURFACES.  TASK 3 IS TO DEVELOP A PREDICTIVE MODEL FOR FATIGUE PERFORMANCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED IN THIS PROJECT WILL LEAD TO A MATERIAL INDEPENDENT APPROACH FOR UNDERSTANDING THE PROCESSING-STRUCTURE-PROPERTIES-PERFORMANCE RELATIONSHIP FOR THE FATIGUE PERFORMANCE OF AS-BUILT COMPONENTS WITH ROUGH SURFACES FABRICATED THROUGH AM. IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AM SURFACES AND FATIGUE PERFORMANCE WILL LEAD TO BETTER MEASUREMENT METHODS FOR SURFACE CHARACTERIZATION TO BE DEVELOPED, LEADING TO RAPID QUALIFICATION TOOLS FOR ADDITIVELY MANUFACTURED MISSION CRITICAL COMPONENTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROPOSAL WILL SUPPORT GRADUATE STUDENTS AT THE COLORADO SCHOOL OF MINES TO DO ADVANCED RESEARCH IN SURFACE CHARACTERIZATION OF ADDITIVELY MANUFACTURED PARTS IN A COOPERATIVE MANNER WITH NIST. COLORADO SCHOOL OF MINES FACULTY AND GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BENEFIT FROM NIST RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE IN METAL-BASED ADDITIVE MANUFACTURING. THE RESEARCH WILL BE OF SIGNIFICANT VALUE TO THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING RESEARCH RESULTS OF SURFACE CHARACTERISTICS OF ADDITIVELY MANUFACTURED SUPER ALLOYS AND THEIR EFFECTS ON FATIGUE LIFE OF SUCH PARTS UNDER HIGH STRESS CONDITIONS. SUCH APPLICATIONS PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT BENEFIT TO U.S. AEROSPACE AND MEDICAL DEVICE INDUSTRIES TO REDUCE COST AND IMPROVE PRODUCTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.
