MALCOLM BALDRIGE NATIONAL QUALITY AWARD OUTREACH ACTIVITIES

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A STREAM-OF-QUALITY APPROACH TO IDENTIFY THE ROOT CAUSES OF YIELD EXCURSIONS AND VARIABILITY IN SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING PROCESSES, IN ORDER TO PREDICT THESE CHANGES AND CONTROL THEM TO MAINTAIN PROCESS QUALITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A METHODOLOGY, THEORY, AND BEST PRACTICES FOR APPLYING STREAM-OF-QUALITY (SOQ) DIGITAL TWIN (DT) MODELING CAPABILITY TO PROVIDE ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS (NEAR-TERM) AND PREDICTION (LONGER TERM) OF YIELD/E-TEST EXCURSIONS AND VARIABILITY, SPECIFICALLY APPLIED TO PROCESSES OF AN INDUSTRY PARTNER. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CREATE A CASE STUDY OF APPLICATION OF THE METHODOLOGY TO IDENTIFY THE ROOT CAUSE OF YIELD/E-TEST EXCURSIONS, WITH THE CASE STUDY UTILIZING REAL FABRICATION FACILITY DATA POSSIBLY AUGMENTED BY SIMULATED DATA, AS WELL AS A SET OF REQUIREMENTS THAT HIGHLIGHT THE DATA QUALITY AND DT INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS NEEDED TO REALIZE AND MAINTAIN A SOQ DT-BASED CAPABILITY IN SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: UTILIZING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TO UNDERSTAND SEMICONDUCTOR PROCESS RELATIONSHIPS WILL ENABLE THE U.S. SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING BASE TO MAINTAIN THEIR EQUIPMENT AND PROCESSES AND HENCE INCREASE THEIR PRODUCTIVITY. THE POTENTIAL SAVINGS FROM SUCCESSFUL INDUSTRIAL IMPLEMENTATION CAN BE SUBSTANTIAL.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RECIPIENT INDUSTRY PARTNER (APPLIED MATERIALS, INC.) AND THE U.S. SEMICONDUCTOR MANUFACTURING BASE WILL BENEFIT FROM IMPROVED MAINTENANCE OF THEIR EQUIPMENT AND PROCESSES AND HENCE INCREASE THEIR PRODUCTIVITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

TITLE: DEVELOPING A TEST OF FORENSIC FACE EXAMINERS FOR DEMOGRAPHICALLY DIVERSE FACESPURPOSE: FORENSIC FACIAL EXAMINERS RECEIVE EXTENSIVE TRAINING AT COMPARING IMAGES OF TWO FACES. WHEN COMPARING FACE IMAGES, FACIAL EXAMINERS DECIDE HOW LIKELY THE FACES IN THE IMAGES ARE THE SAME PERSON. THE RESULTS OF EXAMINERS? COMPARISONS CAN BE USED IN LEGAL PROCEEDINGS. A RECENT PAPER PUBLISHED RESULTS SHOWING THAT EXAMINERS ARE VERY ACCURATE, AND THEY HAVE PERFORMANCE SUPERIOR TO THE GENERAL POPULATION. FOR MOST OF THE COMPARISONS IN THE PAPER, THE RACE OF THE EXAMINER AND FACE WERE THE SAME. PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL MEASURE ACCURACY WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. FOR NUMEROUS APPLICATIONS, FACE RECOGNITION SYSTEMS REQUIRE HUMAN OVERSIGHT. PART OF THIS PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE METHODS FOR COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES THAT INCREASE SYSTEM OVERSIGHT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL COORDINATE WITH NIST EFFORTS TO STUDY THE EFFECT OF CROSS RACE IN FACIAL COMPARISONS AND COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES FOR FACE RECOGNITION. FOR FORENSIC COMPARISONS, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL FIRST FOCUS ON FINDING TEST COMPARISONS THAT WILL BE CHALLENGING FOR FACIAL EXAMINERS. NEXT, THE TEAM WILL GIVE FACIAL EXAMINERS THE TEST COMPARISONS AND THE EXAMINERS WILL RETURN THEIR CONCLUSIONS TO THE TEAM. THE STARTING POINT FOR STUDYING COMBINING HUMANS AND MACHINES WILL BE THE FINDING THAT FUSING THE BEST HUMANS AND BEST ALGORITHMS PRODUCE DECISIONS THAT ARE BETTER THAN EITHER HUMAN OR ALGORITHM ALONE. THEN BASED ON THE PSYCHOLOGY AND THE DECISION-MAKING LITERATURE, THE PROJECT WILL INVESTIGATE METHODS THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL FOR IMPROVING ACCURACY AND OVERSIGHT. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: FOR FORENSIC SCIENCE, THIS RESEARCH WILL PRODUCE KNOWLEDGE OF FACIAL COMPARISONS WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. THE STUDIES ON COMBINING HUMANS AND ALGORITHMS WILL PRODUCE INSIGHT INTO CREATING EFFECTIVE OVERSIGHT OF SYSTEMS. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PRESENTED IN OPEN SCIENTIFIC FORUMS AND PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: FORENSIC EXAMINERS, LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE LEGAL SYSTEM WILL BENEFIT FROM KNOWING THE ACCURACY OF COMPARISONS WHEN THE RACE OF THE EXAMINERS AND THE FACES ARE DIFFERENT. THIS KNOWLEDGE WILL FACILITATE INVESTIGATORS, LAWYERS, AND JUDGES INTERPRETING THE RESULTS OF THESE FACIAL COMPARISONS. FORENSIC SCIENTISTS, PSYCHOLOGIST, AND NEUROSCIENTIST WILL HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF METHODS AND TECHNIQUES FOR MEASURING THE PERFORMANCE OF FORENSIC EXAMINERS. ENGINEERS, FORENSIC SCIENTISTS, AND PSYCHOLOGISTS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ADDITIONAL INSIGHT INTO DESIGNING FACE RECOGNITION SYSTEMS THAT REQUIRE HUMAN OVERSIGHT.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

TITLE: APPLICABLE RESURGENCE & UNIFORM ASYMPTOTICSPURPOSE: THE SPECIAL FUNCTIONS ARE ENORMOUSLY USEFUL TOOLS FOR THE MATHEMATICAL MODELING OF PHYSICAL PHENOMENA IN ALL BRANCHES OF SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING, AND HENCE DEEP UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROPERTIES OF SUCH FUNCTIONS CAN HAVE WIDE IMPACT. ONE OF THE IMPORTANT QUESTIONS IS TO DETERMINE THE BEHAVIOR OF SUCH FUNCTIONS WHEN PARTICULAR PARAMETERS BECOME VERY LARGE, VERY SMALL, OR APPROACH CERTAIN CRITICAL VALUES; THIS IS THE GOAL OF THE FIELD OF ASYMPTOTICS. THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP AND APPLY NEW TOOLS FOR ASYMPTOTIC ANALYSIS OF FUNCTIONS WHICH ARE SOLUTIONS TO CERTAIN TYPES OF DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE THEORY OF ASYMPTOTICS AND HYPERASYMPTOTICS WILL BE ADVANCED ALONG SEVERAL FRONTS. THESE INCLUDE: (A) EXTENDING THE THEORY OF BOREL TRANSFORMATIONS FOR NON-LINEAR DIFFERENCE EQUATIONS, INVESTIGATING THE DISCRETE PAINLEVE-I EQUATION AS A TEST CASE, (B) DEVELOPING A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF RESURGENCE IN EXPONENTIAL ASYMPTOTICS FOR PARTIAL DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS, WHICH WILL BE USED TO OBTAIN SHARP AND COMPUTABLE ERROR BOUNDS FOR THE LARGE ZEROS OF MANY SPECIAL FUNCTIONS, AND (C) THE CONSTRUCTION OF TRANSITION-REGION-EXPANSIONS FOR SECOND-ORDER LINEAR ODES WITH A SEVERAL TYPES OF TURNING POINTS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE IMPORTANT NEW TECHNIQUES AND TOOLS FOR THE MATHEMATICAL ANALYSIS OF SPECIAL FUNCTIONS. IN PARTICULAR, THE ASYMPTOTIC ANALYSES DEVELOPED WILL MAKE THE EVALUATION OF SPECIAL FUNCTIONS MUCH EASIER TO ACCOMPLISH NEAR CRITICAL POINTS. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PRESENTED IN OPEN SCIENTIFIC FORUMS AND PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESULTS OF THIS PROJECT SHOULD BE OF INTEREST TO SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS IN MANY FIELDS WHO UTILIZE SPECIAL FUNCTIONS IN THEIR THEORETICAL AND COMPUTATIONAL ANALYSES. IT SHOULD BE OF PARTICULAR INTEREST TO THOSE WHO MUST DEVELOP COMPUTER PROGRAMS TO RELIABLY EVALUATE SPECIAL FUNCTIONS. FINALLY, IT WILL BENEFIT THE NIST DIGITAL LIBRARY OF MATHEMATICAL FUNCTIONS (DLMF) PROJECT, WHICH SEEKS TO CATALOG AND DISSEMINATE INFORMATION ON THE PROPERTIES OF THE SPECIAL FUNCTIONS OF APPLIED MATHEMATICS FOR USE BY THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO EDUCATE INDUSTRY, ACADEMIC, AND NATIONAL LAB SCIENTISTS IN DATA SCIENCE AND MACHINE LEARNING METHODS AND TOOLS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND WILL HOST A TRAINING WORKSHOP TO EDUCATE INDUSTRY, ACADEMIC, AND NATIONAL LAB SCIENTISTS IN DATA SCIENCE AND MACHINE LEARNING METHODS AND TOOLS. UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND WILL ALSO HOST A SPEAKER WORKSHOP ON MACHINE LEARNING IN THE SCATTERING SCIENCES. THE TRAINING WORKSHOP WILL CONSIST OF A 4-DAY TUTORIAL AND 1-DAY PRESENTATIONS ON CURRENT METHODS AND THE SPEAKER WORKSHOP WILL CONSIST OF 3 DAYS OF SEMINARS. THE WORKSHOP WILL BE HELD AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, COLLEGE PARK.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE TECHNOLOGIES TAUGHT DURING THIS WORKSHOP CAN BE APPLIED TO ANY NUMBER OF MATERIALS SYSTEMS WITH DRAMATIC SOCIAL AND TECHNICAL IMPLICATIONS.  MATERIALS CAN BE DESIGNED AND DISCOVERED TO IMPROVE THE ENERGY EFFICIENCY OF THE ELECTRONICS, MAKE LIGHTER WEIGHT AUTOMOBILES (WHICH ARE MORE FUEL EFFICIENT), FASTER COMPUTER CHIPS, QUANTUM DEVICES WITH NOVEL PROPERTIES, MORE RESILIENT ARMOR, IMPACT PROTECTION, ETC.  THE LIST IS NEARLY ENDLESS, AND THESE TECHNIQUES ARE POISED TO USHER IN A REVOLUTION IN MATERIALS INNOVATION.  IN PRIOR YEARS THERE HAS BEEN SIGNIFICANT INDUSTRIAL PARTICIPATION, AND WE EXPECT THIS YEAR WILL BE NO DIFFERENT. ADDITIONALLY, THE SCATTERING WORKSHOP WILL BRING THE SCATTERING COMMUNITY TOGETHER TO DISCUSS CUTTING EDGE MACHINE LEARNING METHODS FOR ACCELERATING SCATTERING RESEARCH AT NIST?S SCATTERING FACILITY AS WELL AS OTHER FACILITIES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE INDUSTRY, ACADEMIC, AND NATIONAL LAB SCIENTISTS WHO WILL LEARN DATA SCIENCE AND MACHINE LEARNING SKILLS AS WELL AS LEARN ABOUT CUTTING-EDGE SCATTERING ANALYSIS TECHNIQUES. THROUGH THIS GREATER KNOWLEDGE, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT THROUGH A GREATER NUMBER OF SCIENTISTS WITH THE SKILLS TO ACCELERATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF TECHNOLOGY-RELEVANT MATERIALS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INVESTIGATE QUANTITATIVE STRUCTURAL AND CHEMICAL INFORMATION ON BOTH POLYMER FILMS AND MNP .ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHER WILL GENERATE A PROCEDURE, AND USE BCARS MICROSCOPY, TO BE ABLE TO CHARACTERIZE AND INVESTIGATE THE 3D MOLECULAR STRUCTURE OF MICROPLASTICS, AS WELL AS LARGER PLASTIC BODIES. BY COMPARING THE 3D MOLECULAR STRUCTURES OF PRODUCED MNP AND OF LARGE PLASTICS, WE CAN PROPOSE DEGRADATION MECHANISMS DUE TO WEATHERING EFFECTS. THE RESEARCHER WILL ALSO DEVELOP A STANDARD PROTOCOL OF O-PTIR MICROSCOPY TO IMAGE MNP AND POLYMER FILMS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHER IS DEVELOPING A METHOD TO IMAGE MNP AND POLYMER FILMS TO UNDERSTAND WEATHERING PRODUCTION MECHANISMS. THEY WILL USE IMAGING TECHNIQUES OF CHEMICAL IMAGING BASED ON BCARS AND O-PTIR MICROSCOPY. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES AT MATERIAL MEASUREMENT LAB (MML), SUCH AS POLARIZATION CONTROLLED BCARS MICROSCOPY AND O-PTIR MICROSCOPY AND DEVELOP A STANDARD PROTOCOL TO MONITOR WEATHERING EFFECTS ON POLYMER FILMS AND MNP. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE SUCCESS OF THIS PROJECT WILL ADVANCE TECHNOLOGIES NEEDED FOR MITIGATING MNP POLLUTION, WHICH HAS BECOME A SERIOUS GLOBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEM. THE NEW KNOWLEDGE OF SUBMICROMETER-LEVEL STRUCTURAL INFORMATION ON MNP SHEDDING AND THE WEATHERING EFFECT WILL IMPROVE NOT ONLY PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT BUT ALSO THE COMPETITIVENESS OF US MANUFACTURING. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A NEW SOFTWARE TOOL TO EVALUATE THE POTENTIAL CARBON UPTAKEAND THE ENGINEERING PROPERTIES OF NEW LOW CARBON CEMENTS AND CONCRETES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP AN ADVANCED COMPUTATIONAL TOOL COMBINED WITH REFERENCE DATA TO ASSESS THE CARBONDIOXIDE ABSORPTION CAPACITY AND ENGINEERING PROPERTIES OF NEW LOW CARBON BUILDING MATERIALS. THE WORK WILLEXPAND THE CAPABILITIES OF THE VIRTUAL CEMENT AND CONCRETE TESTING LABORATORY (VCCTL) TO INCLUDE A NEW HYDRATIONMODEL AND CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, THERMODYNAMIC, AND KINETIC DATA. THE RESULTING OPEN-SOURCE SOFTWARE WILL PROVIDESTAKEHOLDERS WITH A TOOL TO MODEL THE MICROSTRUCTURE AND THUS THE MECHANICAL BEHAVIOR AND CARBON DIOXIDEABSORPTION CAPACITY OF CEMENTS AND CONCRETES BASED NEW CHEMISTRIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESEARCHERS WILL PROVIDE A SOFTWARE PACKAGE, VCCTL 10, AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON BITBUCKET OR GITHUB. THESOFTWARE WILL INCLUDE: (1) A NEW HYDRATION MODEL AND ENABLE USER-DEFINED MICROSTRUCTURES, OPTION PHASE GROUPINGS,SOLUTION COMPOSITIONS, AND KINETIC PARAMETERS FOR SIMULATIONS; (2) THE KINETICS OF VARIOUS REACTIONS TO MORE GENERALRATE EQUATIONS, INCLUDING THOSE FOR CO2 UPTAKE; (3) MINERALS WITH HIGH CARBONATION POTENTIAL.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE SOFTWARE PACKAGE GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BE USED BY RESEARCHERS DEVELOPING NEW LOW EMBODIEDCARBON CEMENTS AND CONCRETES, NEEDED TO MEET NATIONAL AND GLOBAL GOALS OF ACHIEVING NET ZERO GREEN HOUSE GASEMISSIONS BY 2050.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT TO INCREASE THE UNDERSTANDING OF MASS SPECTRAL FRAGMENTATION PATTERNS FOR AN EMERGING CLASS OF SYNTHETIC OPIOIDS NITAZENES. THIS IS OF IMPORTANCE TO THE FORENSIC SCIENCE, CRIMINAL JUSTICE, AND PUBLIC HEALTH SECTORS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL MEASURE A SERIES OF NOVEL NITAZENE COMPOUNDS WITH MULTIPLE FORMS OF MASS SPECTROMETRY. FOR EACH TYPE OF MASS SPECTROMETRY USED, THE RESULTING SPECTRA WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY COMMON FRAGMENTATION PATHWAYS ACROSS THE COMPOUND CLASS, ENABLING IDENTIFICATION OF DIAGNOSTIC IONS AND SHARED FRAGMENTATION MECHANISMS. THIS INFORMATION WILL THEN BE SUMMARIZED AND PROVIDED TO THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING AN INTIMATE KNOWLEDGE OF THE MASS SPECTRAL FRAGMENTATION PATHWAYS AND DIAGNOSTIC IONS THAT ARE COMMON FOR NEW SYNTHETIC OPIOIDS FROM THE NITAZENE CLASS. THIS WORK WILL ULTIMATELY RESULT IN (1) AN IN-DEPTH UNDERSTANDING OF THE FRAGMENTATION MECHANISMS OF NITAZENES WHEN ANALYZED BY GAS CHROMATOGRAPHY MASS SPECTROMETRY, (2) AN IN-DEPTH UNDERSTANDING OF THE FRAGMENTATION MECHANISMS OF NITAZENES WHEN ANALYZED BY LIQUID CHROMATOGRAPHY TANDEM MASS SPECTROMETRY (LC-MS/MS) OR DIRECT ANALYSIS IN REAL TIME MASS SPECTROMETRY (DART-MS), AND (3) A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE ABILITY TO TRANSLATE LIBRARIES AND SEARCH TOOLS DEVELOPED FOR DART-MS TO LC-MS/MS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE DATA GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE FORENSIC SCIENCE COMMUNITY, WHO NEEDS RESOURCES LIKE THIS TO BETTER IDENTIFY NEW COMPOUNDS IN THE ILLICIT DRUG SUPPLY. RAPID IDENTIFICATION OF NEW DRUGS WILL FURTHER AFFECT THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND PUBLIC HEALTH COMMUNITIES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS WORK IS TO CONDUCT A CONFERENCE ON THE STATE-OF-THE-ART PRACTICES IN PHYSICAL METALLURGY, A DISCIPLINE OF MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: GORDON RESEARCH CONFERENCES ARE INTENSIVE SESSIONS OF TALKS, POSTERS, AND INFORMAL CONVERSATIONS IN SPECIFIC DISCIPLINES (IN THIS CASE PHYSICAL METALLURGY), USUALLY IN RELATIVELY REMOTE LOCATIONS, TO ENABLE DEEP EXPLORATION OF THE CUTTING EDGE OF SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CONFERENCE HAS A NUMBER OF BENEFICIAL OUTCOMES, INCLUDING PROPELLING THE FIELD FORWARD AT AN ACCELERATED RATE, THE IDENTIFICATION OF THE LATEST ACADEMIC AND INDUSTRIAL TRENDS, THE LATEST TECHNIQUES AND ANALYSIS OF WHAT APPROACHES HAVE FALLEN OUT OF FAVOR, AND THE CULTIVATION OF THE NEXT GENERATION OF RESEARCHERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE MATERIALS RESEARCH COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE, THE FUNDING AGENCIES (WHO ENSURE THAT THE BEST WORK IS CONDUCTED), THE GRADUATE ATTENDEES (WHO CAN CONNECT WITH THE LEADERS IN THE FIELD), AND THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL (AS THE FIELD IMPACTS THE DEVELOPMENT OF MANY CONSUMER AND INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTS). SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

NIST- MAPPING OF CYBER THREAT INTELLIGENCE TO VULNERABILITIES AND SYSTEM LEVEL TRACES USING ONTOLOGYPURPOSE: CYBER THREAT INTELLIGENCE IS INFORMATION ABOUT THREATS AND THREAT ACTORS WHICH CAN HELP TO MITIGATE HARMFUL EVENTS IN CYBERSPACE. THE RESEARCH OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO LINK THE ATTACK PATTERNS TO THE LOW LEVEL SYSTEMS EVENTS AND LOGS.  CURRENTLY, SECURITY ANALYSTS HAVE TO PERFORM SIGNIFICANT AMOUNTS OF MANUAL INSPECTION WHEN IT COMES TO THREAT ANALYSIS. IN THIS PROJECT THEY WILL DEVELOP A SECURITY ASSISTANT THAT WILL FACILITATE QUERYING, VISUALIZATION, AND RECOMMENDATIONS. AS A RESULT, THIS WILL IMPROVE EFFICIENCY AND HELP ANALYSTS BETTER DEAL WITH THREATS IN THE FUTURE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A GRADUATE STUDENT TO PERFORM THE RESEARCH AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT. THE STUDENT WILL FOCUS ON TOPICS OF DEVELOPMENT OF AN ONTOLOGY FOR CYBER ATTACKS AND HOW TO LINK THEM WITH SYSTEM EVENTS. THE ONTOLOGY AND ALL THE RESULT RESULTS WILL BE DOCUMENTED IN RESEARCH PAPERS AND REPORTS PUBLISHED JOINTLY WITH NIST.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL RESULT IN DEVELOPMENT OF BETTER TOOLS FOR DETECTION AND MITIGATION OF CYBER ATTACKS.  THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE WORK PROPOSED IN THIS PROJECT WILL LEAD TO SIGNIFICANT RESULTS IN DETECTION OF CYBER ATTACKS. THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE ONTOLOGY WILL RESULT IN NEW RESEARCH IN MACHINE LEARNING. THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO ENABLE COLLABORATION BETWEEN PROFESSORS AT UT DALLAS AND COMPUTER SCIENTISTS AT NIST. STUDENTS WILL HAVE THE EXPERIENCE AND MENTORSHIP FROM SCIENTISTS AT NIST.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO GENERATE THE CPRT DATA IN OSCAL IN THE FORM OF A SET OF CONTROL CATALOGS AND CONTROLS MAPPING. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROJECT WILL AUTOMATICALLY BUILD OSCAL CONTENT FROM CPRT REFERENCE DATA AND RELATED MAPPING DOCUMENT. SPECIFICALLY, PROOF-OF-CONCEPT CODE WILL PROGRAMMATICALLY COMBINE CPRT MAPPINGS WITH THE PRE-EXISTING OSCAL NIST SP 800-53 CONTROL (SP 800-53 CATALOG) TO CREATE NEW OSCAL CONTENT. THE RESULTANT CONTENT WILL INCREASE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE OSCAL CONTENT. THIS NEW OSCAL CONTENT WILL PROVIDE PRODUCT VENDORS THE ABILITY TO IMPORT WELL-FORMED AND VALID OSCAL INTO THEIR PRODUCTS. THIS WILL ENABLE GRC PRODUCT VENDORS TO IMPORT OSCAL AS A STARTING POINT FOR ASSESSMENT, REPORTING, AND AUTHORIZATION (I.E., SYSTEM SECURITY PLAN GENERATION).  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ONCE THE PROJECT SUCCESSFULLY EXPANDS AVAILABLE OSCAL CONTENT, FOLLOW-ON ACTIVITIES WILL ENRICH THE OSCAL CONTENT WITH MAPPING INFORMATION. SPECIFICALLY, A FUTURE PROJECT WILL CREATE PROOF-OF-CONCEPT CODE TO PROGRAMMATICALLY CREATE OSCAL CONTENT WHERE THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN TWO OR MORE EMBEDDED REFERENCE DATASETS ARE DEFINED BY KEY PROPERTIES. KEY PROPERTIES MIGHT INCLUDE RELATIONSHIP TYPES USING SET THEORY, MAPPING RATIONAL USING SEMANTIC, SYNTACTIC, OR FUNCTIONAL TERMS, AND FULFILLMENT STATEMENTS WHETHER ONE REFERENCE ELEMENT ENTIRELY SATISFIES THE OTHER REFERENCE ELEMENT. THIS WILL ALLOW USERS, SUCH AS GRC PRODUCT VENDORS, TO GO BEYOND COMMUNICATING THE RELATIONSHIPS OF SP 800-53 CONTROLS TO CPRT REFERENCE DATASET. PRODUCT VENDORS WOULD THEN BE ABLE TO EXPRESS THE FULFILLMENT OF A GIVEN CPRT REFERENCE DATASET BASED ON SP 800-53 ASSESSMENTS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: GOVERNANCE, RISK AND COMPLIANCE (GRC) TOOL VENDORS WILL BE ABLE TO SUPPORT AUTOMATED ASSESSMENTS AGAINST OTHER REGULATORY FRAMEWORKS THAN SP 800-53. SYSTEM OWNERS WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE INFORMATION REGARDING THE CPRT CONTROLS SATISFACTION IN MACHINE READABLE FORMATS (XML, JSON AND YAML), SECURITY ASSESSORS AND AUDITORS WILL BE ABLE TO AUTOMATE 60% OR MORE OF THE SYSTEMS ASSESSMENT WHILE INCREASING THE ASSESSMENT ACCURACY. SECURITY FRAMEWORK OWNERS AND SYSTEM IMPLEMENTERS WILL BE ABLE TO USE THE MAPPING MODEL TO RELAY HOW THE CONTROLS FROM ONE FRAMEWORK RELATE TO CONTROLS FROM OTHER REGULATORY FRAMEWORKS, SUPPORTING RIGOROUS ASSESSMENTS ?ONCE? AND INFERENCE OF THE RESULTS ?MULTIPLE TIMES?.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE CONFERENCE SUPPORT FOR STUDENTS AND EARLY CAREER SCIENTISTS  TO ATTEND THE GRC CONFERENCE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THE PI AND HIS COLLEAGUES WILL SELECT THE CANDIDATES TO BE SUPPORTED BASED ON QUALITY OF THE APPLICANT AND THE POTENTIAL CONTRIBUTION THE APPLICANT WOULD MAKE TO THE CONFERENCE PLUS OTHER FACTORS SUCH AS BALANCE IN RESEARCH SPECIALTY, GEOGRAPHICAL DISTRIBUTION WITH APPROPRIATE EMPHASIS ON APPLICATIONS FROM UNDER-REPRESENTED GROUPS TO ENSURE A DIVER GROUP OF PARTICIPANTS FOR THE CONFERENCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  POTENTIAL FOR AN INCREASE IN HIGHLY QUALIFIED CANDIDATES TO ATTEND THE CONFERENCE, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO WOULDN?T OTHERWISE BE ABLE TO ATTEND DUE TO LACK OF FUNDING.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  IT WOULD BE BENEFICIAL TO THE SELECTED AMO CANDIDATES WHO WOULD BE ABLE TO PERSONALLY INTERACT AND ENGAGE WITH TOP AMO PHYSICISTS, WHICH LEAD TO EXCHANGE OF IDEAS, METHODS, AND TECHNIQUES ESSENTIAL TO ADVANCEMENT OF KNOWLEDGE IN THE FIELD.  THIS IN TURN BENEFITS NIST BY PROVIDING AN OPPORTUNITY TO PROMOTE NIST RESEARCH IN THE AMO AREA AND ATTRACT TOP QUALITY CANDIDATES TO NIST.  THE GENERAL PUBLIC ALSO BENEFITS AS THERE IS SUBSTANTIAL CONTRIBUTION TO THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF FUTURE SCIENTISTS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP TECHNIQUES FOR THE ULTRACLEAN TRANSFER OF LOW DEFECT GRAPHENE, A SINGLE LAYER OF CARBON ATOMS, GROWN ON SIC SUBSTRATES USING A NOVEL POLYMER STAMP-BASED TECHNIQUE. SUCH RESEARCH IS CRITICAL TO ENABLING GRAPHENE AS A COMPONENT IN FUTURE ELECTRONIC AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:RESEARCHERS WILL FOCUS ON THREE AREAS TO DISLODGE THE GRAPHENE FROM SIC WHEN GROWN ON EITHER THE SI OR C FACE; HIGH FREQUENCY ASSISTED, POLYMER (PVA) ASSISTED, AND GOLF-FILM ASSISTED. THE TRANSFERRED FILMS WILL THEN BE CHARACTERIZED USING ADVANCED MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESULTS OF THE PROPOSED WORK WILL BE DETAILED METHODOLOGY THAT WILL BE PUBLISHED IN TECHNICAL, PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS AND PRESENTED AT CONFERENCES.  CHARACTERIZATION DATA WILL ALSO BE GENERATED AND INCLUDED IN THE DISSEMINATION OF THE RESULTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY INVOLVED IN THE STUDY OF 2D MATERIALS WOULD HAVE IMMEDIATE BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPED PROCESSES TO TRANSFER GRAPHENE. SUCH ABILITY WILL ENABLE NEW STRUCTURES TO BE FORMED AND TESTED MORE QUICKLY ENSURING US LEADERSHIP IN NEXT GENERATION ELECTRONICS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

THE TRANSFER WILL LEVERAGE ULTRASONIC ENERGY AND AN INTERMEDIATE NAFION POLYMER. THE ABILITY TO PLACE GRAPHENE, A SINGLE LAYER OF CARBON ATOMS IN SPECIFIC LOCATIONS ON FAB-FRIENDLY SUBSTRATES IS CRITICAL AS A COMPONENT IN FUTURE ELECTRONIC AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGIES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:THE TECHNICAL APPROACH WILL CONSIST OF 3 TASKS, NAMELY INITIAL FEA MODELING, CHARACTERIZATION OF ADHESION ENERGIES AT RELEVANT INTERFACES, FOLLOWED BY PROOF-OF-CONCEPT EXPERIMENTS (I.E., VALIDATION OF THE TECHNOLOGY ON SUBSTRATE SIZES OF 1? X 1?).  FURTHERMORE, A FOLLOW-UP PLAN TO SCALE UP THE TECHNOLOGY HAS BEEN DEVELOPED. THE TRANSFERRED GRAPHENE FILMS WILL BE CHARACTERIZED USING ADVANCED MEASUREMENT CAPABILITIES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE RESULTS OF THE PROPOSED WORK WILL BE DETAILED PROCESSES THAT WILL BE PUBLISHED IN TECHNICAL, PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS AND PRESENTED AT CONFERENCES.  CHARACTERIZATION DATA WILL ALSO BE GENERATED AND INCLUDED IN THE DISSEMINATION OF THE RESULTS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY INVOLVED IN THE STUDY OF 2D MATERIALS WOULD HAVE IMMEDIATE BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPED PROCESSES TO TRANSFER GRAPHENE. SUCH ABILITY WILL ENABLE NEW STRUCTURES TO BE FORMED AND TESTED MORE QUICKLY ENSURING US LEADERSHIP IN NEXT GENERATION ELECTRONICS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A SINGLE-ZONE MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHM BASED SIMULATION TOOL TO ANALYZE THE DESIGN AND OPERATION OF INDOOR SPACES AND THEIR HEATING, VENTILATING AND AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEMS BY UNDERSTANDING THE DISTRIBUTION OF COMFORT AND HEALTH PARAMETERS WITHIN THE SPACE. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP A MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHM BASED SIMULATION CAPABILITY TO ANALYZE THE DISTRIBUTION OF POLLUTANTS AND OTHER CONDITIONS WITHIN A SINGLE-ZONE SPACE. THE EFFORT WILL FIRST REQUIRE GENERATING COMPUTATIONAL FLUID DYNAMICS (CFD) SIMULATION DATA SETS SUITABLE FOR INDOOR SPACES REPRESENTING BOTH OFFICE AND CLASSROOM ENVIRONMENTS. AROUND 30,000 INDIVIDUAL DATA SETS WILL BE GENERATED FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRAINING AND TESTING THE MACHINE LEARNING MODELS. THE NEXT MAJOR TASK WILL BE TO EVALUATE MACHINE LEARNING MODELS IN APPROXIMATING SPATIAL VIRAL AEROSOL CONCENTRATIONS AT STEADY STATE FOR THESE TEST SPACES. THIS INVESTIGATION WILL TEST AT LEAST TWO SPECIFIC ML MODELS WITH DIFFERENT SETS OF INPUT PARAMETERS TO APPROXIMATE HOW FAR AND WIDE PARTICLES EMITTED BY OCCUPANTS CAN TRAVEL, AND THE SPATIAL CONCENTRATION FOR A SPECIFIC SET OF TRAINING INPUT PARAMETERS. THE FINAL TASK WILL BE TO EXPLORE THE EXTENSION OF THE ML MODELS FOR USE IN EXISTING NIST TOOLS (INCLUDING CONTAM AND FATIMA) OR AS A NEW STANDALONE TOOL. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE AVAILABILITY OF A UNIQUE, SINGLE-ZONE MACHINE LEARNING-BASED ANALYSIS TOOL TO SIMULATE THE DISTRIBUTION OF TEMPERATURE, HUMIDITY AND POLLUTANT CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN AN OCCUPIED SPACE. ONE EXAMPLE WOULD BE A RAPID ASSESSMENT OF HOW DIFFERENT DESIGNS AND TECHNOLOGY WOULD IMPACT AIRBORNE TRANSMITTED DISEASES SUCH AS COVID19 SPREAD AND DETERMINE THE BEST COURSE OF ACTION TO LIMIT EXPOSURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: RESEARCHERS, DESIGN ENGINEERS AND BUILDING OPERATORS WILL HAVE A NEW MACHINE LEARNING-BASED SIMULATION TOOL TO QUICKLY EVALUATE BUILDING AND HVAC SYSTEM DESIGN AND OPERATIONAL STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE EXISTING AND NEW BUILDING PERFORMANCE THROUGH DESIGN AND OPERATION STRATEGIES THAT REDUCE BUILDING ENERGY USE AND PROVIDE BETTER CONTROL OF IAQ, HEALTH, AND PRODUCTIVITY-RELATED PARAMETERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS INTO THE WUI-NITY WUI FIRE EVACUATION MODEL. IMPROVEMENTS ARE NEEDED TO TAKE THE PREVIOUS RESEARCH AND DEVELOP MODELS THAT CAN BE IMPLEMENTED IN PRACTICE INCLUDING BETTER INTEGRATION OF INPUTS INTO THE DESIGN AND PLANNING PROCESS AND TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTIVE INTEGRATION OF WUI-NITY OUTPUT TO GET INTO PRACTITIONER HANDS RESULTS THAT ARE ACCEPTED AND UNDERSTOOD.        ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE TASK 1: DEVELOPMENT OF EVACUATION SUB-MODELS ABLE TO INCLUDE MICROSCOPIC REPRESENTATION (E.G., INDIVIDUAL VEHICLES). TASK 2: DEVELOP A VIRTUAL REALITY EXPERIMENTAL TECHNOLOGY THAT CAN GATHER DATA ON EVACUEE DECISION-MAKING. TASK 3: DEVELOP OF A TOOL TO IDENTIFY SCENARIOS TO BE EXAMINED. TASK 4: ENHANCEMENTS IN THE MODEL INTERFACE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) THE OUTCOME OF THE RESEARCH WILL BE TO BUILD A TESTED, CALIBRATED, AND CONFIGURABLE MODEL THAT CAN BE USED BY STAKEHOLDERS TO ASSESS WILDFIRE EVACUATION AND PERFORMANCE IN REAL-WORLD SITUATIONS.    INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STAKEHOLDERS, THE COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE OPERATIONS AND PLANNING PERSONNEL, CHARGED WITH ASSESSING COMMUNITY RESPONSE TO WILDFIRE EVACUATION, AND DEVELOPING PLANS TO BE IMPLEMENTED. THE RESIDENTS IN COMMUNITIES AFFECTED BY WILDAND-URBAN INTERFACE FIRES AND SUBJECT TO EVACUATION ORDERS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVEMENTS IN ASSESSMENT AND PLANNING TO PROVIDE TIMELY AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATIONS AND OPTIMIZED EVACUATION INSTRUCTIONS.    SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBAWARD $26,255 TO GHD, $21,500 TO IMPERIAL COLLEGE LONDON, $42,585 TO LUND UNIVERSITY, $18,162 TO THE NATIONAL RESEARCH COUNCIL CANADA, AND $25,262 TO RMIT UNIVERSITY TO SUPPORT VARIOUS CO-INVESTIGATORS IN COMPLETING THE ACTIVITIES LISTED.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A WILDFIRE EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT PLATFORM TO IMPROVE KNOWLEDGE OF COMMUNITY RESILIENCE TO WILDFIRES AND WILDFIRE PREPAREDNESS, RESPONSE, AND RECOVERY. THE PLATFORM WILL HAVE THE CAPABILITY OF COMMUNICATING WITH EVACUATION ASSISTANCE APPS, TO GATHER CROWDSOURCED INPUTS FROM CITIZENS AND PROVIDE REAL-TIME INFORMATION BACK TO CITIZENS TO ENHANCE RISK COMMUNICATION,      ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE TASK 1: ENGAGE KEY STAKEHOLDERS INCLUDING ORGANIZING A SHOWCASE WORKSHOP AND CONDUCTING INTERVIEWS WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS. TASK2: DEVELOP DATA CREATION AND INTEGRATION FRAMEWORK AND COLLECT DATA (GPS, CELLPHONE, FIRE SPREAD, TRAFFIC COUNTS, ETC, AND TRADITIONAL COMMUNITY DATASETS) AND CONSTRUCT STATIC AND DYNAMIC RESILIENCE MEASURES.TASK3: COMPARE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE MODELS TO TRADITIONAL MODEL FOR EVACUATION DEMAND FORECASTING. TASK 4: BUILD PROTOTYPE PLATFORM INCLUDING MAPPING MODULE, AL MODULE AND COMMUNICATION MODULE.   EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) THE STUDY WILL LEVERAGE THE MASSIVE NEAR REAL-TIME DATASETS TO CREATE NEW DYNAMIC MEASURES TO BETTER CAPTURE DIFFERENT ASPECTS OF COMMUNITY RESILIENCE TO WILDFIRES. THE GOAL IS TO BRING A TRANSFORMATIVE LEAP FORWARD IN ASSESSING AND QUANTIFYING COMMUNITY RESILIENCE, REDUCE THE LIFE SAFETY RISKS AND ENHANCE THE RESILIENCE OF COMMUNITIES. DECISION MAKERS, AND EMERGENCY MANAGERS WILL BE ABLE TO LEVERAGE AND INTEGRATE DATA TO FACILITATE PRE-EVENT PLANNING AND REAL-TIME DECISION MAKING.   INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BUSINESSES, RESIDENTS AND PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE LOCATED IN COMMUNITIES THAT CAN BE AFFECTED BY WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE FIRE THREATS WILL BENEFIT BY THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE WILDLAND EMERGENCY PLATFORM TO REDUCE RISK AND ENHANCE THE RESILIENCE OF THE COMMUNITY. TH DEVELOPMENT AND THIS TOOL AND THE LEVERAGING OF VARIOUS DATASETS WITH AI-FOCUSED ANALYSIS WILL BENEFIT THE EMERGENCY MANAGERS, AND COMMUNITY OFFICIALS, IN PRE-PLANNING AND DURING WILDFIRE EVENTS.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBAWARD $5000 TO MASSEY UNIVERSITY TO ASSIST WITH PLATFORM DEVELOPMENT AND REPORT DEVELOPMENT, THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBAWARD $5000 TO UNIVERSITY OF UTAH FOR ANALYSIS AND MODELING ACTIVITIES AND DISSEMINATION OF RESEARCH.

HUDSONALPHA INSTITUTE OF BIOTECHNOLOGY ?SECURING DNA WITH A MODULAR GENOMIC CYBERSECURITY LABPURPOSE: TO UNDERSTAND THE CYBERSECURITY LABORATORY OF PROCESSING GENOMIC DATA.  THERE IS A NEED FOR FUTURE CYBERSECURITY RESEARCH, TESTING AND DEVELOPMENT TO IDENTIFY THE PROCESSING OF GENOMIC DATA. THE APPLICANT WILL BUILD A CYBERSECURITY LABORATORY OUTLINING GENOMIC USE CASES AND TECHNOLOGIES ACROSS THE HUDSONALPHA?S BIOTECHNOLOGY CAMPUS DOCUMENTING RESULTS FROM THEIR SECURITY ASSESSMENTS, TABLETOP EXERCISES, AND EDUCATIONAL TRAINING IN THE GENOMICS LABORATORY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES WILL CONSIST OF DEVELOPING USE CASES, ENVIRONMENTS, AND TECHNOLOGIES USED ACROSS GENOMIC LABORATORIES.  RESEARCH, ANALYSIS, TESTING, IMPLEMENTING HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE MODELS, EVALUATION OF TECHNOLOGIES, AND EDUCATING PROFESSIONALS IN THE FIELD. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE APPLICANT WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE ADVANCED EDUCATION TO STUDENTS AND EXPERTS WITH HOW TO UNDERSTAND THE SECURITY OF PROTECTING GENOMIC DATA AND THE INFRASTRUCTURE WHICH PROCESSES THE DATA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE WORK PERFORMED BY THIS GRANT WILL HELP BUILD A CYBERSECURITY LABORATORY USING GENOMIC TEST CASES TO HELP IDENTIFY GAPS AND UNDERSTAND THE INFRASTRUCTURE WHEN USING GENOMIC DATA IS BEING PROCESSED.  THE 2 DELIVERABLES WILL OUTLINE AND PROVIDE A REPORT THAT CAN PROVIDE BENEFITS TO THE CYBERSECURITY AND CYBER RESILIENCE RESEARCH COMMUNITIES, CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE OWNERS AND OPERATORS, FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHEN BUILDING A LABORATORY AND PROCESSING GENOMIC DATA. FUTURE WORK AND STUDIES CAN BE PERFORMED BY NIST TO EXPAND THE SOLUTIONS ON SECURING AND CONTROLLING THE CYBERSECURITY OF GENOMIC DATA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

UNIVERSITY OF ALABAMA IN HUNTSVILLE RECONFIGURABLE GENOMIC DATA CYBERSECURITY LABORATORYPURPOSE: THE NEED FOR RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS ON THE LIFE CYCLE FOR THE CYBERSECURITY OF GENOMIC DATA IS CRITICAL TO UNDERSTAND WEAK AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT. THE PURPOSE OF THE RESEARCH IS TO DESIGN A GENOMICS DATA CYBERSECURITY LAB WHICH WOULD CONSIST OF HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE COMPONENTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE NEEDED CYBERSECURITY CONTROLS FOUND IN THE GENOMIC DATA LIFE CYCLE.  SOME EXAMPLES WOULD BE GENOMIC SEQUENCING SAMPLE PREPARATION, GENOMIC SEQUENCING AND RESULTING GENOMIC DATA STORAGE, DISSEMINATION, PROCESSING, AND END-OF-LIFE DESTRUCTION. THIS LABORATORY WILL HELP PROMOTE NEW CYBERSECURITY SCIENCE AND DISCOVERY WITHOUT COMPROMISING PRODUCTION MACHINERY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES WILL BE IMPLEMENTED INTO 2 PHASES.  THE FIRST PHASE WILL CONSIST OF PREPARING A REPORT WHICH DOCUMENTS THE COMMON SYSTEM CONFIGURATIONS THAT ARE USED IN THE GENOMIC DATA LIFE CYCLE, CURRENT CYBERSECURITY CONTROLS IN PLACE AND CONTROLS THAT CAN BE ADDED, AND POSSIBLE VULNERABILITY VECTORS FOUNDS. THE SECOND PHASE WILL CONSIST OF DOCUMENTING THE FINDINGS, CONTENTS AND ARCHITECTURE OF A GENOMICS DATA CYBERSECURITY LABORATORY WITH THE ASSOCIATED COST ESTIMATES.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE EXPECTED OUTCOME RESULT IN TWO DELIVERABLES.  FIRST, A REPORT WILL BE PREPARED THAT DOCUMENTS THE COMMON HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE COMPONENTS INCLUDING NETWORK ENVIRONMENTS USED THROUGHOUT THE GENOMIC DATA LIFE CYCLE AND WILL OUTLINE POSSIBLE ATTACK VECTORS AS WELL AS ARCHITECTURAL MODIFICATIONS THAT MAY MITIGATE THREATS. SECOND, A REPORT WILL BE PREPARED THAT DOCUMENTS THE PROPOSED CONTENTS AND ARCHITECTURE OF A GENOMICS DATA CYBERSECURITY LABORATORY WITH SPECIFICS ON COSTS OF ACQUISITION AND MAINTENANCE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE WORK PERFORMED BY THIS GRANT WILL HELP OTHERS SECURE THE INFRASTRUCTURE WHEN USING GENOMIC DATA.  THE REPORT PROVIDED WILL ALLOW THE AUDIENCE TO UNDERSTAND ASSOCIATED RISKS AND PROVIDE BENEFITS TO THE CYBERSECURITY AND CYBER RESILIENCE RESEARCH COMMUNITIES, CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE OWNERS AND OPERATORS, FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WHEN USING GENOMIC DATA. FUTURE WORK AND STUDIES CAN BE PERFORMED BY NIST TO EXPAND THE SOLUTIONS ON SECURING AND CONTROLLING THE CYBERSECURITY OF GENOMIC DATA.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO STUDY EMBER GENERATION RATES AND FIRE SPREAD IN PRESCRIBE WILDLAND FIRE FIELD STUDIES. A DATA REPOSITORY WILL BE DEVELOPED AND USED TO PROVIDE MODEL INPUT VARIABLES AND VALIDATION COMPUTER FIRE MODELS. THE KNOWLEDGE DEVELOPED WILL ALLOW IMPROVEMENT IN WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE FIRE CODES AND STANDARDS TO ENHANCE PUBLIC SAFETY AND REDUCE PROPERTY LOSSES IN WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE FIRES.   ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FIELD STUDIES WILL BE CONDUCTED DURING PRESCRIBED WILDLAND FIRE BURNS IN THE NEW JERSEY PINELANDS IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNITED STATES FOREST SERVICE PERSONNEL. THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES ARE FIELD WORK PREPARATION, DATA GATHERING DURING THE FIELD EXPERIMENTS, FIRE BEHAVIOR DATA PROCESSING, FIRE BRAND GENERATION AND DEPOSITION ANALYSIS, DEVELOPMENT OF DATABASE AND REPORTING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) THE STUDY WILL LEAD TO AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN FIRE BEHAVIOR, FUELS, AND THE FIREBRAND HAZARD, FOCUSING ON SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF THE FIREBRAND HAZARD. A LARGE, OPEN DATASET OF FIREBRAND GENERATION AND DEPOSITION DATA CONTEXTUALIZED WITH FIRE BEHAVIOR DATA WILL BE PRODUCED THAT CAN BE USED TO DEVELOP AND TEST NUMERICAL TOOLS. THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED WILL PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE PARAMETERS RELEVANT TO FIREBRAND GENERATION AND DEPOSITION FOR INCLUSION IN WILDFIRE HAZARD ASSESSMENT TOOLS, SPECIFICALLY AIMING TO DEVELOP NUMERICAL APPROACHES.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BUSINESSES, RESIDENTS AND PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE LOCATED IN COMMUNITIES THAT CAN BE AFFECTED BY WILDLAND-URBAN INTERFACE FIRE THREATS WILL BENEFIT BY THE APPLICATION OF KNOWLEDGE DEVELOPED TO IMPROVE CODES AND STANDARDS TAILORED TO THE SPECIFIC FIRE THREATS THAT CAN DEVELOP. DEVELOPERS OF COMPUTER FIRE MODELS LIKE THE NIST FIRE DYNAMICS SIMULATOR OR OTHER PREDICTIVE FIRE TOOLS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE DETAILED DATA SETS THAT WILL BE DEVELOPED TO IMPROVE AND VALIDATE MODELS AND TOOLS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: CYBERSECURITY AND THE RESILIENCE OF COMPUTING AND COMMUNICATIONS INFRASTRUCTURE IS AN AREA OF SIGNIFICANT AND GROWING CONCERN TO POLICYMAKERS, FEDERAL RESEARCH SPONSORS, AND THE PUBLIC. THE NATIONAL ACADEMIES? CYBER RESILIENCE FORUM WILL FACILITATE CROSS-SECTOR EXCHANGE OF IDEAS AMONG SCIENTISTS, PRACTITIONERS, AND GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS; ENABLE THE EARLY IDENTIFICATION OF RISKS AS WELL AS PROMISING APPROACHES TO IMPROVE THE RESILIENCE OF COMPUTING AND COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS; AND PROVIDE TECHNICALLY SOUND INFORMATION TO DECISION MAKERS AND THE PUBLIC THROUGH ITS PUBLIC EVENTS AND PUBLISHED REPORTS.

PURPOSE:  NIST PERFORMS EVALUATIONS OF BIOMETRIC IDENTIFICATION ALGORITHMS.  THESE EVALUATIONS INCLUDE FACE, FINGER, AND IRIS ALGORITHMS.  IREX-10 IS THE CURRENT EVALUATION FOR IRIS RECOGNITION.  THERE IS A CONSTANT STREAM OF NEW ALGORITHMS REPORTED IN THE ACADEMIC LITERATURE THAT ARE OFTEN COMPARED WITH BASELINE ALGORITHMS THAT ARE NOT WELL CHARACTERIZED, MAKING IT DIFFICULT TO EVALUATE CLAIMS FOR THOSE ALGORITHMS.  THIS PROJECT WILL SUBMIT EXISTING OPEN SOURCE ALGORITHMS TO IREX-10 THEREBY PROVIDING TO THE PUBLIC WELL CHARACTERIZED BASELINE ALGORITHMS THAT CAN BE USED FOR COMPARISONS WITH NEW ALGORITHMS AND WHICH CAN SERVE AS TEMPLATES FOR SUBMISSION OF NEW ALGORITHMS TO IREX-10.  THE ALGORITHMS WILL ALSO BE USEFUL IN SCENARIOS WHERE EXAMINATION OF THE UNDERLYING CODE BY ALL THE STAKEHOLDERS IS NECESSARY OR DESIRABLE.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT BE CARRIED OUT BY A GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANT UNDER THE DIRECTION OF TWO FACULTY MEMBERS WHO ARE WELL VERSED IN THE SUBJECT MATTER.  EXISTING IMPLEMENTATIONS OF TWO OPEN SOURCE ALGORITHMS WILL BE UPDATED/MODIFIED FOR SUBMISSION TO IREX-10.  THE ALGORITHMS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO IREX-10 AND PUBLISHED WITH DOCUMENTATION VIA A PUBLIC GITHUB REPOSITORY.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  TWO OPEN SOURCE ALGORITHMS WHOSE PERFORMANCE IS WELL CHARACTERIZED VIA IREX-10.   THESE ALGORITHMS CAN BE USED BY RESEARCHERS AS BASELINES FOR COMPARISONS WITH NEW ALGORITHMS, AS THEY ARE DEVELOPED.   INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: ALGORITHM DEVELOPERS:  WILL HAVE GOOD BASELINES AGAINST WHICH TO COMPARE THEIR ALGORITHMS AND A TEMPLATE FOR SUBMISSION OF THEIR ALGORITHMS TO IREX-10.PEER REVIEWERS FOR ACADEMIC PAPERS:  THE AVAILABILITY OF WELL CHARACTERIZED BASELINE ALGORITHMS WILL MAKE IT EASIER FOR PEER REVIEWERS TO JUDGE THE CLAIMS IN PAPERS REPORTING NEW ALGORITHMS. PUBLIC:  IN ANY SCENARIO IN WHICH THE INTERNALS OF AN IRIS RECOGNITION ALGORITHM ARE OF INTEREST TO THE VARIOUS STAKEHOLDERS.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ESTABLISH THE CURRENT STATE OF CIGARETTE FIRES IS IN THE US. THROUGH DATA ANALYSIS AND A WORKSHOP, THE RESEARCH AIMS AT GATHERING RELEVANT INFORMATION AND DATA TO USE AS A BASIS FOR INITIATIVES TO FURTHER REDUCE CIGARETTE FIRES.         ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE TASK 1: FORM A TECHNICAL PANEL COMPRISED OF KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS. TASK 2: UPDATE THE CURRENT STATISTICS ON HOME MEDICAL OXYGEN FIRES AND BURNS (MOST OFTEN CIGARETTE INITIATED). TASK 3: CONDUCT LITERATURE REVIEW OF THE RELEVANT INFORMATION AND DATA AND DEVELOP A SUMMARY OF CIGARETTE FIRE SCENARIOS TO IDENTIFY TRENDS. TASK 4: HOLD A STAKEHOLDER WORKSHOP THAT PRESENTS THE PROJECT DELIVERABLES. ATTENDEES WILL INCLUDE RESEARCHERS, ENFORCERS, FIRE SERVICE, PUBLIC EDUCATORS, INDUSTRY REPRESENTATIVES, AND CODES AND STANDARDS DEVELOPERS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS A REPORT THAT PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON WHAT IN NEEDED TO FURTHER REDUCE CIGARETTE FIRES THAT CAN BE USED BY PUBLIC EDUCATORS, CODES AND STANDARDS DEVELOPERS, AND RESEARCHERS, LIKE THE NIST FIRE RESEARCH DIVISION, TO GET CORRECT MESSAGING OUT TO THE PUBLIC, INFORM CODES AND STANDARDS PROCESS OF THE CURRENT FIRE PROBLEM, AND DIRECT RESEARCH TOPICS TO ADDRESS ISSUES THAT ARE IDENTIFIED.      INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL THROUGH INCREASED FIRE SAFETY TO THE EXTENT THAT THE RESEARCH IDENTIFIES THINGS RELATED TO CIGARETTE FIRES THAT CAN BE ADDRESSED THROUGH PUBLIC EDUCATION, CODES AND STANDARDS CHANGES, OR DIRECTED RESEARCH ON THE PROBLEM.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO SUBAWARD TO A CONTRACTOR TO CONDUCT LITERATURE REVIEW, DEVELOP BASELINE MATERIALS, AND PRODUCE A REPORT.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP A VALIDATION PYROLYSIS MODEL FOR FLEXIBLE POLYURETHANE FOAM. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: TO COMPLETE AND FULLY VALIDATE THE PYROLYSIS MODEL FOR THE FLEXIBLE FOAM THE RESEARCH WILL PERFORM 3 EXPERIMENTAL AND MODELING TASKS. TASKS 1 IS ANALYZING FOAM IN A SERIES OF A LOW OXYGEN THERMAL DEGRADATION TESTS. TASK 2 IS SCALING UP APPRECIATE SAMPLE TO THE CONE CALORIMETER.  TASKS 3 IS LARGER SCALE VERTICAL FIRE TESTING.  THE RESULTS OF THESE WILL BE USED AS INPUTS TO AND VALIDATION OF PYROLYSIS FIRE MODELS THROUGHOUT THIS PLAN.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COMPUTATIONAL APPROACH TO PREDICT AND EVALUATE NEW TECHNOLOGIES TO REDUCE THE FIRE HAZARD OF FOAM.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: OWNERS OF BUILDINGS HOUSING SOFT FURNISHINGSSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

TITLE: APPLYING MACHINE LEARNING TO DETECT NOVEL NETWORK ATTACKS AND APTPURPOSE: NETWORK ATTACKS CAN LEAD TO SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES SUCH AS LARGE-SCALE DATA BREACHES, SYSTEM INFECTION, AND INTEGRITY DEGRADATION, PARTICULARLY WHEN NETWORK ATTACKS ARE EMPLOYED IN ATTACK STRATEGIES SUCH AS ADVANCED PERSISTENT THREATS (APT). THROUGH EXPLOITS A LOGIC FLAW IN PROTOCOL SPECIFICATION, NETWORK ATTACKS SUCH AS PTH USUALLY DO NOT HAVE A DISTINGUISHING SIGNATURE. THIS MAKES IT VERY DIFFICULT TO DETECT SUCH NETWORK ATTACKS. EXISTING METHODS CAN BE CLASSIFIED INTO THREE CATEGORIES: (1) NIDS; (2) HOST-ASSISTED DETECTION; (3) MANUALLY WRITTEN RULES FOR EVENT CORRELATION. HOWEVER, THE THREE CATEGORIES OF METHODS SUFFER FROM SIGNIFICANT LIMITATIONS. SINCE A DISTINGUISHING SIGNATURE IS OFTEN MISSING, NIDS COULD BE EASILY EVADED. TO ADDRESS THESE LIMITATIONS, THEY PROPOSE TO APPLY MACHINE LEARNING TO DETECT SUCH NETWORK ATTACKS. ALTHOUGH TRADITIONAL MACHINE LEARNING (E.G., SVM, DECISION TREE) COULD PERFORM POORLY IN DETECTING SOPHISTICATED NETWORK ATTACKS, DEEP LEARNING CAN LEVERAGE BIG TRAFFIC DATA AND GENERATE ACCURATE DNN (DEEP NEURAL NETWORK) DETECTION MODELS. BASED ON THIS NEW INSIGHT, THEY PROPOSE TO DEVELOP THE FIRST DEEP-LEARNING-BASED DETECTION SYSTEM AGAINST NETWORK ATTACKS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  THE PROPOSED RESEARCH ACTIVITIES CAN BE DIVIDED INTO THREE PHASES:            PHASE 1: DEVELOP DEEP-LEARNING-AWARE PROTOCOL FUZZING SCRIPTS TO GENERATE COMPREHENSIVE DATA FOR TRAINING AND TESTING DNN DETECTION MODELS. THEY WILL GENERATE COMPREHENSIVE DATA SETS FROM SCRATCH, INCLUDING BENIGN AND MALICIOUS DATA SETS, BASED ON THE PROPOSED PROTOCOL FUZZING-BASED APPROACH. THEY WILL CHOOSE THREE DEMONSTRATION LFE NETWORK ATTACKS INCLUDING PTH, DNS CACHE POISONING, AND ARP POISONING, AND PERFORM DATA GENERATION FOR THEM. ALL ATTACKS WILL BE CARRIED OUT THOUSANDS OF TIMES SO THAT A FAIR AMOUNT OF MALICIOUS DATA CAN BE COLLECTED. BENIGN DATA GENERATION WILL ALSO LAST LONG ENOUGH TO GATHER THE COMMENSURATE AMOUNT OF DATA COMPARED TO MALICIOUS DATA.            PHASE 2: APPLY DEEP LEARNING TO TRAIN ACCURATE DNN DETECTION MODELS.            PHASE 3: BUILD AN INTEGRATED SYSTEM PROTOTYPE AND EVALUATE ITS COST-EFFECTIVENESS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL RESULT IN DESIGN OF THE FIRST DEEP-LEARNING-BASED NETWORK-ATTACK DETECTION SYSTEM. THE DETECTION SYSTEM COVERS THE ENTIRE MACHINE LEARNING PIPELINE RANGING FROM DATA GENERATION TO MODEL TRAINING TO MODEL DEPLOYMENT. THE RESULTS OF THIS RESEARCH WILL BE PRESENTED IN OPEN SCIENTIFIC FORUMS AND PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESEARCH PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION SEEKS TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY OF ENTERPRISE NETWORKS TO DEFEND AGAINST CYBER ATTACKS. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH ENHANCES ENTERPRISE SECURITY BY MORE TIMELY AND MORE ACCURATE DETECTION OF ADVERSARY TECHNIQUES.  PROTECTION OF ENTERPRISE NETWORKS WILL HAVE BROAD BENEFITS FOR THE AMERICAN PEOPLE AND THEIR ECONOMY. THIS WORK WILL ALSO PLAY A ROLE IN EDUCATING THE NEXT GENERATION OF COMPUTER SCIENTISTS THROUGH CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH EXPERIENCES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: (A) THE SUBRECIPIENT WILL INVESTIGATE ON THE TOPICS OF HOW TO APPLY MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO DETECT NOVEL NETWORK ATTACKS AND ADVANCED PERSISTENT THREAT. (B) THE SUBRECIPIENT WILL ATTEND REGULAR PROJECT MEETINGS, DISCUSS AND REFINE THE PROJECT DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION ASPECTS. (C) THE SUBRECIPIENT WILL WORK ON THE TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS AND HELP CONVERT RESEARCH OUTCOMES INTO PAPER WRITINGS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO DEVELOP TOOLS FOR THE HARMONIZATION OF FORENSIC SEQUENCING DATA. THE TOOLS WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO A PUBLICLY AVAILABLE ONLINE SOURCE.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL DEVELOP SOFTWARE TOOLS TO EVALUATE, CONVERT (IF NEEDED) AND REPORT SEQUENCE INFORMATION FROM THE FORENSIC COMMUNITY.  THIS ACTIVITY WILL BE CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE WITH EXISTING NOMENCLATURE GUIDANCE FROM FORENSIC STAKEHOLDERS.  THE INTERFACE WILL INTERFACE WITH THE EXISTING "STRIDER" DATABASE TO TEST AND VALIDATE THEIR APPLICATION. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESEARCHERS ARE DEVELOPING A GUIDANCE AND SOFTWARE TOOL TO EVALUATE FORENSIC SEQUENCING INFORMATION.  THE OUTCOME WILL BE 1) A STR SEQUENCE CONVERSION TOOL 2) INTEGRATION OF THIS TOOL INTO PUBLIC QC SEQUENCE DATABASES AND 3) DISSEMINATION OF THIS RESOURCE WITHIN THE FORENSIC GENETICS COMMUNITY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE NOMENCLATURE TOOLS AND INTEGRATED STRIDER WEBSITE CAN BE USED BY COMMERCIAL ENTITIES THAT PRODUCE DATA RELATED TO THE SEQUENCING OF FORENSIC STR MARKERS TO DISPLAY THEIR INFORMATION IN CONSISTENT FORMAT.  HOSTS OF FORENSIC SEQUENCE DATABASES CAN USE THESE RESOURCES TO CONVERT SEQUENCE STRINGS - THIS WILL ENSURE HARMONIZATION AND INTEROPERABILITY IN THE FORENSIC SEQUENCING COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CONDUCT ADVANCED CODING ASPECTS OF DATABASE INTEGRATION AND EXPAND CAPABILITIES FOR THIS RESEARCH PROJECT.

PURPOSE: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A DISTRIBUTED LEARNING, OPTIMIZATION, AND CONTROL FRAMEWORK SUITABLE FOR HEATING, VENTILATING, AND AIR-CONDITIONING EQUIPMENT USED IN COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS BY ADOPTING MATHEMATICAL DESIGN TOOLS FROM GAME THEORY AND REINFORCEMENT LEARNING CONTROL.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL APPLY RECENT THEORETICAL DEVELOPMENTS AT THE INTERSECTION OF GAME THEORY AND REINFORCEMENT LEARNING TO DEVELOP ALGORITHMS FOR DISTRIBUTING TASKS OVER SEVERAL INTELLIGENT AGENTS CAPABLE OF COOPERATING WITH EACH OTHER TO MEETING THE LEARNING, OPTIMIZATION, AND CONTROL OBJECTIVES. THIS FRAMEWORK AND REINFORCEMENT LEARNING EMPOWERS THE INDIVIDUAL AGENTS TO LEARN OPTIMAL CONTROL SEQUENCES WITHOUT HAVING THE NEED TO PERFORM EQUIPMENT LEVEL IDENTIFICATION.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESULTS OF THIS RESEARCH ARE EXPECTED TO RESULT IN A NEW GENERATION OF BUILDING CONTROL PRODUCTS THAT IMPROVE BOTH OCCUPANT COMFORT AND THE OPERATIONAL EFFICIENCY OF BUILDING SYSTEMS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE OWNERS, OPERATORS, AND USERS OF COMMERCIAL AND INSTITUTIONAL BUILDINGS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENSURE A HIGH PRIORITY, FOCUSED AND COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH WORLDWIDE FOR THE RAPID DEVELOPMENT AND APPROVAL OF FORMAL INTERNATIONAL BIOMETRIC STANDARDS. THESE STANDARDS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AND ARE NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE RAPID DEPLOYMENT OF SIGNIFICANTLY BETTER, OPEN STANDARDS-BASED SECURITY SOLUTIONS FOR THE PURPOSES SUCH AS HOMELAND DEFENSE, THE PREVENTION OF ID THEFT, BORDER CONTROL, LAW ENFORCEMENT, INTELLIGENCE AND THE MILITARY.ACTIVITY TO BE PERFORMED: ANSI WILL PROVIDE THE RELIABLE AND COMPETENT LEADERSHIP, MANAGEMENT, AND ADMINISTRATION TO ENSURE THAT SC 37, BIOMETRICS, AND ITS WORKING GROUPS, EFFECTIVELY COMPLETES ITS STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BY OVERSEEING THE TIMELY DEVELOPMENT OF DRAFT MEETING AGENDAS, THE ESTABLISHMENT OF TARGET DATES FOR CONTRIBUTIONS FROM TECHNICAL EXPERTS AND COUNTRIES, ESTABLISHING TARGET DATES FOR AND TRACKING OF ALL ACTION ITEMS OF THE STANDARDS PROJECT EDITORS AND PREPARING FOR AND ATTENDING THE SC 37 PLENARY AND SC 37 WORKING GROUP MEETINGS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF SC37 AND SC37 WORKING GROUPS SEMI-ANNUAL MEETINGS THAT WILL INCLUDE UPDATES AND MAINTENANCE OF INTERNATIONAL BIOMETRIC STANDARDS. DURING THESE MEETINGS ANSI WILL PROVIDE LEADERSHIP AND EXPERT GUIDANCE ON PROCEDURAL ISSUES TO ENSURE THAT THE U.S. PARTICIPANTS ARE SUCCESSFUL IN ACHIEVING THEIR GOALS INTERNATIONALLY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE BIOMETRICS COMMUNITY THAT INCLUDES DEVELOPERS AND END USERS OF THE TECHNOLOGY WILL BENEFIT FROM HAVING BIOMETRIC STANDARDS THAT SUPPORT INTEROPERABLE AND IMPROVED BIOMETRIC TECHNOLOGIES. NIST WILL ALSO BENEFIT IN ITS GOAL TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT AND ADVANCEMENT BIOMETRIC STANDARDS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS

PURPOSE: RADIO-FREQUENCY (RF) CHANNEL MEASUREMENT AND MODELING REPRESENTS, IN A COMPACT MATHEMATICAL FORM, THE PHYSICAL MEDIUM THROUGH WHICH WIRELESS SIGNALS PROPAGATE, AND IS USED TO DESIGN NEXT-GENERATION (NEXTG  5G, 6G, AND BEYOND) DEVICES AND NETWORKS. AS THE GS GET HIGHER AND HIGHER, THE NETWORK TECHNOLOGY BECOMES MORE AND MORE COMPLEX. FOR EXAMPLE, MASSIVE PHASED-ARRAY ANTENNAS WITH HUNDREDS OF ELEMENTS HAVE BECOME A CRITICAL PART OF THE SYSTEM DUE TO THEIR ABILITY TO COMBINE MANY SIGNALS IN SPACE THROUGH BEAMFORMING, WHILE PROVIDING HIGH ANTENNA GAIN TO COMPENSATE FOR THE GREATER PATHLOSS AT THE FREQUENCIES AT WHICH THESE SYSTEMS OPERATE, AT MILLIMETER-WAVE (MMWAVE) FOR 5G AND SUB-TERAHERTZ (SUB-THZ) FOR 6G. SO SPACE OTHERWISE REFERRED TO AS THE ANGLE DOMAIN  IN ADDITION TO THE TRADITIONAL DELAY DOMAIN IS A CRITICAL PART OF THE DESIGN. NO LESS IMPORTANT IS HOW THE SIGNAL IS DISTORTED ACROSS THE FREQUENCY SPECTRUM I.E. THE FREQUENCY SELECTIVITY OF THE SIGNAL WHICH REALLY ONLY COMES INTO PLAY AT 5G AND ABOVE, WHEN THE SIGNALS ARE ULTRA-WIDEBAND (> 500 MHZ). THE NOVEL ANGLE AND FREQUENCY DOMAINS OF NEXTG SYSTEMS WILL FUNDAMENTALLY CHANGE CHANNEL PROPAGATION MODELS AND CHANNEL SOUNDING SYSTEMS AND TECHNIQUES USED TO MEASURE THE MODEL PARAMETERS. OVER THE LAST EIGHT YEARS, THE NEXTG CHANNEL MEASUREMENT AND MODELING PROJECT HAS BEEN ON THE FOREFRONT OF DEFINING THAT CHANGE, PROTOTYPING STATE-OF-THE-ART SYSTEMS FOR MEASURING RF CHANNEL PROPAGATION, I.E. RF CHANNEL SOUNDERS, WHICH HAVE BEEN PICKED UP BY AT&T AS WELL AS MANY THROUGHOUT INDUSTRY AND ACADEMIA. WE SPECIALIZE IN REAL-TIME CHANNEL SOUNDERS THAT CAN MEASURE THE CHANNEL IN JUST MILLISECONDS, IN HIGHLY DYNAMIC ENVIRONMENTS WHERE THE CHANNEL CHANGES RAPIDLY DUE TO PEDESTRIAN OR VEHICULAR MOTION, CAPTURING ALL DOMAINS OF THE CHANNEL DELAY AS WELL AS ANGLE AND FREQUENCY WITHOUT COMPROMISING ACCURACY. IN ORDER FOR THIS TO HAPPEN AT SUB-THZ, WE ARE DESIGNING A 140 GHZ WITH PHASED-ARRAY ANTENNAS, WHICH MUST MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DESIGN OF PHASED-ARRAY ANTENNAS THAT MEET THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:1.	10 GHZ INSTANTANEOUS BANDWIDTH;2.	140 GHZ CENTER FREQUENCY OF OPERATION;3.	16 X 16 PHASED ARRAYS;4.	HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL POLARIZATION;5.	AT MOST 0.9 US SWITCHING SPEED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO SUPPORT THE SENSING APPLICATION AND SIMILAR APPLICATIONS ENVISIONED FOR 6G, WE HAVE BEGUN THE DESIGN OF A 140 PHASED-ARRAY CHANNEL SOUNDER. THE ARRAYS BOARDS WILL BE FABRICATED BY PROFESSOR GABRIEL REBEIZS GROUP FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA SAN DIEGO (UCSD), WHO ALSO FABRICATED OUR 28 GHZ AND 60 GHZ BOARDS. THE DUAL-POLARIZED 16 X 16 BOARDS WILL BE ABLE TO OPERATE AT AN INSTANTANEOUS BANDWIDTH OF 10 GHZ. IN ORDER TO DRIVE SUCH A SYSTEM WITH SUCH HIGH BANDWIDTH, WE HAVE TO UPDATE OUR ARBITRARY WAVEFORM GENERATOR (AWG), WHICH SYNTHESIZES THE EMITTED SIGNAL AT THE TRANSMITTER, OUR HIGH-SPEED DIGITIZER (HSD), WHICH SAMPLES THE SIGNAL AT THE RECEIVER, AND OUR HIGH-FREQUENCY SYNTHESIZERS (HFS), WHICH UP/DOWN-CONVERT THE SIGNAL TO 140 GHZ. DETAILS OF THE MAIN EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO ASSEMBLE THE 140 GHZ SUB-TERAHERTZ CHANNEL SOUNDER ARE PROVIDED BELOW.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:MOST OF THE DATA COLLECT AND PROCESS WE MAKE AVAILABLE ON OUR NEXTG CHANNEL MODEL ALLIANCE REPOSITORY, WHICH HOUSE MEASUREMENTS TO CHARACTERIZE RADIO PROPAGATION IN MANY DIFFERENT ENVIRONMENTS, USE CASES, AND FREQUENCIES. THE DATA IS AVAILABLE TO THE WIRELESS COMMUNITY AT LARGE INDUSTRY, ACADEMIA, AND GOVERNMENT SO THAT WIRELESS NETWORK DESIGNERS CAN USE THE DATA TO DESIGN WIRELESS NETWORKS QUICKER AND MORE ACCURATELY. THIS REDUCES THE AMOUNT OF TIME TO DELIVER THE FINAL PRODUCT AND ALLOWS DELIVERY OF A BETTER PRODUCT. MORE SPECIFICALLY, THIS WOULD BE THE DESIGN OF 6G NETWORKS.SUBRECIPIENTS: NONE

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL QUANTIFY THE ECONOMIC IMPACT OF ALTERNATIVE, PERFORMANCE-BASED DESIGNS FOR STRUCTURAL PERFORMANCE IN FIRE OF COMPOSITE STEEL-FRAMED BUILDINGS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ACTIVITIES INCLUDE GENERATING OPEN AND ACCESSIBLE DATA SETS WHICH QUANTIFY THE FIREBRAND GENERATION AND DEPOSITION. DEVELOPING LOW COST, FIELD-BASED FIREBRAND CHARACTERIZATION AS WELL AS LABORATORY-BASED CHARACTERIZATION OF FIREBRANDS. IDENTIFYING LINKS BETWEEN FIREBRAND GENERATION AND DEPOSITION INCLUDING FIRE BEHAVIOR, FUELS, AND METEOROLOGICAL METRICS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: BY PROVIDING COST ASSESSMENT AND EVALUATION OF CASE STUDIES TO COMPLEMENT FORTHCOMING DESIGN METHODS, THE PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO SUPPORT NEW PROVISIONS IN BUILDING CODES FOR A MORE EFFICIENT USE OF RESOURCES IN THE U.S. CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND THE US CONSTRUCTION INDUSTRY WILL BE THE FIRST LINE BENEFICIARIES FROM THIS EFFORT. HOWEVER, THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NEW STANDARDS WILL ALSO BENEFIT ANY ORGANIZATION OR INDIVIDUAL THAT USES THE IMPROVED METHODS TO REDUCE FIRE RISK. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

REFINING CYBERSEEK CYBERSECURITY MAPS, CAREER PATHWAYS, AND TRAINING PROVIDERSPURPOSE: THERE IS A WELL-DOCUMENTED SHORTAGE OF CYBERSECURITY EXPERTS. CYBERSEEK IS A SET OF INTERACTIVE TOOLS THAT HELPS GUIDE EMPLOYERS, JOB SEEKERS, ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS, TRAINING PROVIDERS, GUIDANCE COUNSELORS, AND PUBLIC POLICY MAKERS IN UNDERSTANDING THE EVOLVING MARKET FOR CYBERSECURITY SKILLS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT IN-DEPTH REFINEMENTS TO CYBERSEEK TO ALLOW ORGANIZATIONS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THEIR CURRENT AND FUTURE CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE NEEDS; AS RESULT, CYBERSEEK WILL BE UPDATED WITH MORE CURRENT AND COMPREHENSIVE DATA, AND BETTER ALIGN TO THE NICE STRATEGIC PLAN AND THE NICE WORKFORCE FRAMEWORK FOR CYBERSECURITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE PROPOSED PROJECT COVERS THE FURTHER REFINEMENT AND POTENTIAL EXPANSION OF THE CYBERSECURITY DEMAND AND SUPPLY MAP, CYBERSECURITY CAREER PATHWAYS, AND CYBERSECURITY EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROVIDER TOOL. IN ADDITION TO THESE TECHNICAL UPGRADES, COMPTIA WILL DEVOTE STAFF TIME TO CONDUCTING OUTREACH, REPRESENTING CYBERSEEK PUBLICLY, AND RESPONDING TO QUESTIONS FROM PARTNERS AND USERS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: SUCCESS IN THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED ANALYTICS, METRICS, AND REPORTING ON THE CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE. FURTHERMORE, SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY INCREASE USE OF THE TOOL. COMPTIA AND EMSI BURNING GLASS WILL CONTINUE TO DRIVE UTILIZATION OF CYBERSEEK, PURSUING AN AGGREGATE GOAL OF 1.5 MILLION UNIQUE VIEWS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD, AND 4.5 MILLION IN TOTAL SINCE LAUNCH. THE TOOL WILL AIM TO PROVIDE STAKEHOLDERS WITH REAL-TIME INFORMATION ABOUT THE STATE OF THE CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE IN THEIR REGION.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  THE CYBERSEEK TOOL IS INTENDED TO BE USED BY AUDIENCES INCLUDING: EMPLOYERS, JOB SEEKERS, ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS, TRAINING PROVIDERS, GUIDANCE COUNSELORS, AND PUBLIC POLICY MAKERS. PROPOSED REFINEMENTS WILL MAKE CYBERSEEK MORE INTUITIVE FOR USERS, MEET THE GROWING DEMAND FROM BOTH JOBSEEKERS AND EMPLOYERS FOR A CLEAR UNDERSTANDING OF CAREER PATHWAYS IN THE CYBERSECURITY FIELD, AND PROVIDE USERS WITH REAL-TIME INFORMATION ABOUT THE STATE OF THE CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE IN THEIR REGION.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE DEMAND DATA WILL BE SOURCES FROM COMPTIA?S PARTNER, EMSI BURNING GLASS. EMIS BURNING GLASS? PROPRIETARY DATABASE OF ONLINE EMPLOYER DEMAND INCLUDES HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS OF CURRENT AND HISTORICAL JOB POSTINGS, PROVIDING VALUABLE INPUT INTO THE TOOL. EMSI BURNING GLASS LABOR MARKET ANALYSTS WILL MATCH JOB POSTINGS TO WORK ROLES WITHIN THE NICE NATIONAL CYBERSECURITY WORKFORCE FRAMEWORK ON THE BASIS OF JOB TITLES, SKILLS, CERTIFICATIONS AND INDUSTRY.

UPDATE SRD 106, IUPAC-NIST SOLUBILITY DATABASE, INCLUDING NEW CODE BASE, FURTHER REVIEW OF THE DATA, AND SUPPORTING UNITS IN QUDT AND OTHER REPRESENTATIONS.2.	EXPAND WORK ON THE UNITS OF MEASUREMENT INTEROPERABILITY SERVICE (UMIS) IN CONCERT WITH THE CIPM DIGITAL SI EXPERT GROUP AND CODATA TASK GROUP, DIGITAL REPRESENTATION OF UNITS OF MEASUREMENT.3.	SUPPORT THE DIGITAL NIST PILOT PROJECT BY ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF DIGITAL CALIBRATION REPORTS AND DIGITAL CERTIFICATES OF ANALYSIS.4.	INVESTIGATE ADOPTION OF BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY FOR IMPROVING TRUST IN RESEARCH DATA.5.	CONTRIBUTE TO METADATA STANDARDS DEVELOPMENT IN CHEMISTRY AND MATERIALS SCIENCE.EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1.	UPDATED WEBSITES FOR SRD 106 AND UMIS THAT CONFORM TO NIST PERFORMANCE GUIDELINES.2.	XML SCHEMAS FOR THE DIGITAL NIST PILOT.3.	RECOMMENDATIONS ON BLOCKCHAIN USAGE IN RESEARCH DATA.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: USERS OF NIST RESEARCH DATA AND STANDARD REFERENCE DATA AS WELL AS CLIENTS OF NIST SRM AND CALIBRATION SERVICES.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PRODUCE TOOLS TO CHARACTERIZE POLYMERS AND PARTICLE SUSPENSIONS, WHICH ARE OF TECHNOLOGICAL IMPORTANCE AS FUNCTIONAL AND STRUCTURAL MATERIALS. THE AVAILABILITY OF SUCH A TOOL CAN ENABLE ENGINEERS TO DEVELOP MORE EFFICIENT PROCESSES FOR WORKING WITH THESE MATERIALS AND TO FORMULATE THEM FOR SPECIFIC APPLICATIONSACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE RESEARCHERS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY ENHANCE NIST?S CAPABILITIES FOR COMPUTING VIRIAL COEFFICIENTS WITHIN ZENO BY INCLUDING FLEXIBILITY, ATTRACTION AND INTRAMOLECULAR BONDING. THESE PLANNED DEVELOPMENTS AMONG OTHERS REQUIRE AN IMPROVED SOFTWARE FRAMEWORK.  ONCE THESE VIRIAL COEFFICIENT CALCULATIONS ARE IMPLEMENTED, NIST?S ABILITY TO DISTRIBUTE METHODS OF ANALYSIS IS EXPECTED TO GROW AND ENABLE COMPARISONS TO MEASUREMENTS PREVIOUSLY UNAVAILABLE.  FURTHER, THE TEAM PLANS TO VALIDATION THE CALCULATIONS BY COMPARISON TO VIRIAL COEFFICIENTS FOR KNOWN PARTICLE SYSTEMS, OR COMPUTED INDEPENDENTLY WITH PREVIOUSLY VALIDATED SOFTWARE DEVELOPED BY THE UNIVERSITY AT BUFFALO. SOFTWARE WILL BE MADE WIDELY AVAILABLE DIRECTLY TO NIST PERSONNEL AND POSTED TO GITHUB (THE LARGEST OPEN SOURCE COMMUNITY)EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE IMPROVEMENTS TO NIST?S ZENO SOFTWARE SHOULD INCREASE UTILIZATION BY THE COMPUTER SIMULATION AND COMPUTATIONAL COMMUNITY THROUGH THE UNIQUE AND IMPROVED FRAMEWORK FOR THERMODYNAMIC QUANTITIES.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE SOFTWARE GENERATED FROM THIS RESEARCH CAN BE USED BY RESEARCHERS TO MAKE PREDICTIONS OF QUANTITIES UNAVAILABLE IN ANY WIDELY DISTRIBUTED SOFTWARE PACKAGE AND IMPROVE VALIDATION OF METHODS BY MEASUREMENTS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) IS OF INCREASING IMPORTANCE ACROSS A WIDE VARIETY OF SECTORS, AND WITH THE NATIONAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE INITIATIVE ACT OF 2020, THE U.S. AIMS TO ?LEAD THE WORLD IN DEVELOPMENT AND USE OF TRUSTWORTHY ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE SYSTEMS IN THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS.? AI SYSTEM CHARACTERISTICS SUCH AS EXPLAINABILITY AND INTERPRETABILITY ARE PROPOSED TO BE A KEY PART OF TRUSTWORTHY AND TRUSTED AI SYSTEMS, AND ARE OF INTEREST FOR NIST?S TRUSTWORTHY AND RESPONSIBLE AI PROGRAM. THIS RESEARCH PROJECT WILL EXAMINE THOSE TWO AI SYSTEM CHARACTERISTICS: EXPLAINABILITY AND INTERPRETABILITY.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE TWO-YEAR PROJECT WILL CONDUCT RESEARCH WITH HUMANS?EXPERT AND NON-EXPERT SAMPLES?EVALUATING MODEL OUTPUT IN A MEDICAL SCENARIO SIMULATING AI RECOMMENDATIONS FOR ANTIBIOTIC PRESCRIPTION, USING DIFFERENT MEASURES TO EVALUATE EXPLAINABILITY AND INTERPRETABILITY OF AI SYSTEMS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF EXPLAINABILITY AND INTERPRETABILITY OF AI SYSTEMS, WHICH IS FOUNDATIONAL WORK NEEDED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND EVALUATION OF TRUSTWORTHY AI SYSTEMS. THE RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL BE PUBLISHED IN THE SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: BENEFITS TO NIST INCLUDE ADVANCING THE STATE OF EVALUATIONS FOR INTERPRETABILITY AND EXPLAINABILITY OF COMPUTATIONAL ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE (AI) SYSTEMS. EXPLAINABILITY AND INTERPRETABILITY ARE KEY CHARACTERISTICS OF TRUSTWORTHY AI, AND AS SUCH WILL BENEFIT NIST?S LARGER TRUSTWORTHY AND RESPONSIBLE AI PROGRAM. EVALUATION MEASURES DEVELOPED IN THE PROPOSED WORK WILL HELP THE PUBLIC, AUDITORS, POLICYMAKERS, DEVELOPERS, AND END-USERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT OF AI SYSTEMS THAT ARE TODAY BEING DEVELOPED AND DEPLOYED, ULTIMATELY INCREASING TRUSTWORTHINESS OF?AND HUMAN TRUST IN?AI SYSTEMS.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT PLANS TO SUBAWARD FUNDS TO CORNELL UNIVERSITY TO CONDUCT ANALYSIS OF EVALUATION MEASURES TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT OF AI SYSTEMS FOR THIS RESEARCH PROJECT.

THEISS RESEARCH



PURPOSE: THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO MAKE ADVANCES IN TWO SEPARATE AREAS OF EMERGING COMPUTING TECHNOLOGY: QUANTUM INFORMATION SCIENCE AND NEUROMORPHIC COMPUTING. FOR THE FORMER, WORK WILL FOCUS ON THE DEVELOPMENT AND ASSESSMENT OF QUANTUM COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS AND APPLICATIONS. FOR THE LATTER, THE GOAL IS TO IDENTIFY PROMISING APPLICATIONS AND DEVELOP TRAINING METHODS FOR SPIKING NEURAL NETWORKS, AN ALTERNATIVE COMPUTATIONAL SYSTEM LOOSELY INSPIRED BY OUR UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE HUMAN BRAIN WORKS



ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: COLLABORATION WITH THE EUROPEAN TELECOMMUNICATIONS STANDARDS INSTITUTE WILL BE UNDERTAKEN TO HELP CLARIFY THE VITAL LINKAGE BETWEEN SECURITY PROOFS FOR IDEALIZED QUANTUM CRYPTOGRAPHIC KEY DISTRIBUTION (QKD) SYSTEMS AND THE CHALLENGES OF REAL SYSTEMS BUILD FROM IMPERFECT COMPONENTS. THE PI WILL ALSO APPLY HIS VAST EXPERIENCE IN DEVELOPING QKD HARDWARE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN EXPERIMENTAL QUANTUM NETWORK IN COLLABORATION WITH NIST SCIENTISTS. FINALLY, IMPROVED METHODS TO TRAIN ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORKS (NN) WILL BE STUDIED, AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NN APPLICATIONS AND BENCHMARKS THAT MAP WELL TO SCALABLE, LOW ENERGY NN PLATFORMS SUCH AS THE SUPERCONDUCTING OPTOELECTRONICS NETWORK (SOEN) UNDER STUDY AT NIST WILL BE DEVELOPED.



EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH SUPPORTED BY THIS GRANT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE BODY OF KNOWLEDGE NEEDED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF PRACTICAL AND RELIABLE SYSTEMS AND APPLICATIONS OF QUANTUM NETWORKS AND SPIKING NEURAL NETWORKS. THE RESULTS OF THIS WORK WILL BE PUBLISHED IN THE OPEN SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE WORK PROPOSED HERE WILL PROVIDE THE NIST WITH A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF THE STATE-OF-THE-ART IN POTENTIAL NEW COMPUTING TECHNOLOGIES, ALLOWING IT TO ANTICIPATE NEEDED MEASUREMENT TECHNIQUES AND TOOLS TO ENABLE DOWNSTREAM COMMERCIALIZATION. WHEN FULLY REALIZED, QUANTUM NETWORKS COULD PROVIDE NEW MEANS OF SECURE INFORMATION EXCHANGE, A WAY TO SCALE CURRENT TODAY?S SMALL QUANTUM COMPONENTS INTO A LARGE, DISTRIBUTED COMPUTING SYSTEM, AS WELL AS TO DEVELOP NEW HIGHLY SENSITIVE SENSING CAPABILITIES. NEUROMORPHIC DEVICES, SUCH AS THE ARTIFICIAL NEURAL NETWORKS TO BE STUDIED HERE, COULD PROVIDE VERY HIGH-SPEED PROCESSING FOR CERTAIN APPLICATIONS WITH VERY LOW POWER REQUIREMENTS, WHICH IS A LIMITING FACTOR IN SCALING UP CONVENTIONAL COMPUTING DEVICES. 



SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THERE ARE NO PLANNED SUBAWARDS.

LASTLY, WE WILL COLLECT SETS OF MATERIAL PROPERTIES FOR BLACK POLYMETHYL METHACRYLATE, NYLON 6,6, STANDARD FLEXIBLE POLYURETHANE USING THE TOOLS AND SCRIPT DEVELOPED IN THIS PROJECT.EXPECTED OUTCOME: FULL AUTOMATED AND FREE SOFTWARE TOOLS TO OBTAIN EXPERIMENTAL DATA AND PUSH IT TO A DATABASE THAT WILL DRASTICALLY ACCELERATE ANALYSIS AND DATA SHARING IN THE FIRE COMMUNITY.
